review: Clocked 50hrs in my first four days of playing and I feel like I might be halfway to where I want to be if not less. This game is beautiful it flows so goddamn well in terms of movement and the grind is fairly enjoyable.One thing I want to mention though I don't know if this is a popular problem is that it balances progress with a stagnant grind You research monsters and then have to kill them several times over to get enough materials to make armor and weapons (sometimes me than several times). You can just leap monster to monster but at some point you will have to stall your progress and really double down on grabbing some fresh gear. You can do this at any time but it means that you likely won't be grabbing every single armor set without putting down lots of time for things that will be technically outclassed by the time you research a few more monsters. On the upside it means that you can choose when and where you want to grind unless you're stuck on a monster.I am constantly amazed by how good this game looks. I'm a big proponent of Fashion Souls using whatever armor looks the best and this game absolutely delivers. Every single armor set looks wonderful and the weapons are insanely good.To add there are certain Western game tropes that are altogether absent from this game and Japanese themes reminiscient of Earth Defense Force and Yakuza. The result is something very fresh on the market if you don't normally play "eastern" games.Lastly the feeling of accomplishment is unreal. I played this LAN style with a friend and every single capture or kill was worthy of celebration.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: I admit to pre ordering ths game before its launch and also being one of many people vocal about the issues this game had at launch.It's now months after the fact though we're currently in December and the question has to be asked "Is this game worth buying?"I can safely say that over the past few months this release has indeed been gaining some love and care from its dev team. The game doesn't run miraculously better than it did from launch but in hindsight I was probably crazy to expect this game to ever reach 100+ FPS anyways.Regarding any hiccups in things like stutters due to certain effects and some control issues for M+KB users those were addressed as well. While it would have been GREAT if some of these things were addressed BEFORE launch part of me can be forgiving that this dev team who have probably never worked on a PC Game before this was able to address user concerns and issues in a manner more timely than Square Enix's handling of Nier Automata.And regarding gameplay it's just good fun Monster Hunter. It does what it does well and I wouldn't have personally spent the hundred hours I have into this game if it wasn't any fun. It has some changes and bits of streamlining from the handhelds and stuff but then this is the game where the team is really trying to take advantage of more powerful and modern hardware.All in all yeah I totally recommend this game. Are there still any issues in the performance? Probably but it's not killing my buzz whenever I pick up the game
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: Sad that the reviews at the start have such an impact still. The disconnection issue sure was a bother but it got fixed in about 2 weeks and have been stellar since (in my experience atleast). You can see on the chart that 90% of the bad reviews are from those early weeks. Appart from the somehow bland weapon design (for my taste) early on the game is in a really good state now Lots of content Really satisfying with how you learn as you go you will start to feel like an experienced hunter after a while So many "holy crap!" moments both hilarious and terrifying Hella of alot of fun with friends DImportant to find a playstyle that fits you try alot of wepons early. I know alot of people go for heavy weapons only to feel like the gameplay is slow and clunky. You will in the end enjoy most of them tho. Happy hunting!

review: Product received for free. My friend got me this game and I am absolutely loving this game. Amazing. Great community to bind with to fight off the sometimes overwhelming monsters. That doesn't matter though because you will easily lose yourself in the amazing detail to the world and find yourself in the grind for armor weapons and some gear for your palico definitely worth it even if I was going to buy it a week from now. You will meet a lot of great people to team up with and though the beginning is a little confusing the more you play the more you learn and will be rewarded with amazing items. The game has a combat system much like the older games if you have played them if not then you will learn and learn that you will love the combat system. The game doesn't really have an easy matchmaking service which doesn't take away from the game. Just head over to your mission board if you have a friend in game you are in a chat with and link up that way. Great game Great community great combat what's not to like?

review: Got this recently after being underwhelmed at console launch (played on PS4).52 hours in I've blown past where I stopped on console after putting in over 70 hours (I try to maintain a dollar hour use ratio even if it isn't the most enjoyable. I've watched movies at the theater for more per hour so if I can enjoy at least 60 hours in one way or another I feel I generally got my money's worth)I don't understand the hate some have for the pc controls I haven't messed about too much with the controls beyond changing the radial menu to be KB+M bar style instead of radial and it works great for me. The connection issues seem to be fixed at least from what I experienced on console in my 52 hours of play I've had maybe three disconnects and it was within the same game session so I tend to think it was probably something on my end given the timing of them (Wavecable later that day had a full outage even)The gameplay is great. While I can't manage the 2K that I would love to play this at with my current GPU I can handle a steady 60 70 FPS at 1080 using reshade to sharpen up and make the colors a little more vibrant. The FPS isn't as important but it does make fights with some of the higher mobility monsters a bit easier to track and besides if you aren't chasing those frame rates with your rig you're doing something wrong. Monsters are varied and the difficulty curve leading into HR and beyond isn't steep to the point of punishing. Yes you'll grind in this game but honestly thats what a game like this is entirely built up around. There's a good sized group of basic monsters (round about 15) that you hunt repeatedly as you progress the story and hunt for materials to build gear and then the game comes into it's own as you start hunting variants and the "elder dragons" which are more or less the real challenge in the game. There's new monsters being added periodically and a G rank coming later next year which is a whole 'nother level of difficulty and gear to grind for.Each weapon system is varied enough that it gives a different feel to the game (my 52 hours has been solely the charge blade because I'm a sucker for technical gameplay but I plan on eventually going through and playing with all the rest) allowing you to really change up your experience as you try new things. If that isn't enough there's also the Arena mode which forces you to use specific weaponsets in a hunt and rewards tokens used to craft new gear available only through the Arena. Did I also mention crafting? Holy **** this game is system upon system allowing you to min/max to your heart's desire or just go with the general flow and not have that really be an impediment on your experience until the third or fourth act of the story.Now if you want a quick linear story feel disgust at the idea of learning the terrain of each hunting ground or despair at the thought of spending hours upon hours hunting a specific monster in order to break a certain body part in hopes that RNG smiles upon you to give you a Jagras marrow (Not that that happened. I'm ok.) so that you can then craft the weapon you want to use in your hunt of an even more powerful monster than I hate to say it but this probably not the game for you.But if the idea of losing yourself in an extremely immersive monster hunting sim where you can do just about whatever the hell you want is something you find appealing then absolutely this is the game for you
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: Tldr Due to recent Updates i would recommend buying the Game. The PC version seems to be finally catching up with the Consoles. The combat is fun and if you enjoy playing with friends or even randoms this game might just be perfect for you. First of all I d like to mention that I am a huge fan of the Monster Hunter Series. I started playing when MH Tri came out and I picked up every game ever since. Monsters like Gore Magdala or Zinorge will always have a special place in my heart and I was devasted when I heard that Capcom will not add these to MHW. On the one side I really like the new released monsters but on the other I need to mention that MHW lacks monsters. There currently are 28! (Console 31) different monsters. Four of these (Rathlos Rathian Azure Rathlos and Pink Rathian) are basically the same (Moveset and look differ slightly). Hence I really hope that Capcom will release new Monsters soon because older games MHU games had more than 50 monster.... Luckly there are mods out there which alter many existing monsters into powerhouses. They are really challenging and fun to fight against. https //www.youtube.com/watch?v 3LtNjbuAPAE https //www.youtube.com/watch?v S 7VyF6AjY8Second I really must praise Capcom. The new combat mechanics are amazing. I can really feel the impact when swinging my Swich Axe while slicing Odagaron apart. Even though the game gets repetitive after 40 50h I still enjoy the combat. When you get bored playing the Switch Axe you can easily change to a Hammer or Bow. There are 14 different Weapons which feel and play very well.Third thing I want to mention is that Capcom fixed the Server Issues. Many old reviews state that servers are having connection problems. I have yet to face these problems because they never annoyed me. I played since the first week after launch and I mostly joined SOS flares (join a quest) and up until now i was only disconnected twice from the host.(I have an 20 Mb/s Internet connection)Finally I want to mention I few things that annoy me personally. These is mostly QoL stuff. NPCs are scattered around and i hate walking. I need at least 10 15 second to reach the cantina. NPCs like the "Farm" Manager and Smithy are not located in the Gathering Hub. (Multiplayer Hub) It takes a lot of time to open the Quest List I miss the Pause button from older generations I hate Toaster Filter for specific Quest monsters doesn t save last settings which can be quite annoying I had to use a roundabout way to remove Armor Presets (no delete Button) The Gem sorting is awful why are the Equipped Gems at the end of the List and not under the unequipped one?! Did I mention that I hate Toaster and his nova ?These are only minor things but I still hope that these will be fixed very soon.*Excuse my grammar I am no professional *wink*
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

I would love to see more seamlessness in terms of playing with my friends. Being able to see them in Astera etc. And the default control for the keyboard + mouse arent ideal. But overall a great game.

review: It needs more work on the server stability also if it's not for the help of the community I can't even play together in a quest with my friend. We tweaked the steam shortcut command a bit and it's working like charm until now.But it's a sign that your game is far from perfect.Now for the gameplay I appreciate the developer for keeping the taste of the early Monster Hunter still intact in this game though I missed how unique the environment of Monster Hunter 2 DOS feels when you got back to Head Quarter and you walk pass by their AI which autonomously making a sound of a Monster Hunterish language even without being interracted with.For the action It has improved SO MUCH aspects from the early Monster Hunter titles. the combat is more liquid than ever. Though I hoped you can somehow change some of the monsters attack's hit boxes such as when nergigante doing a leap/flying attack that it supposed to hit anything that's infront of him and it's somehow made me ashamed that it actually hit me when I try to hit him from behind while he's still facing the wall in the middle of it's attack consquence. I find this happening in early titles too but I have great expectation that this kind of inconvenience (I can consider this as a tremendous hitbox bug) won't be surfaced anymore in this game.I love the UI now. more so because it's on PC so I can chat more easily. the display of health and stamina bar is more neat and I prefer it this way because it gave me a wider range of view. though I hope you can do something about the item display on the bottom right. everytime steam is giving me a notification the whole item shortcut section is covered by it. It's really frustrating and more so in the middle of fighting a monster. please do something about it.as for music well like other game it's good I can't give much opinion on music except the one that makes my ears bleed. so i guess it's all good for now.then there's a problem on the sound. there's time where your attacks hit/landed on the monster and it shown the damage counter. but the sound didn't connect. It's actually bugging me more than I though it would be.for now It's 8/10 game and minus the frequent connection problem it's 7/10.I wouldn't recommend my friend to buy this yet as long the connection problem presist but I recommend anyone who loves grinding to play this on solo but you might get bored once you finished the main story.Edit Capcom has taken action on fixing the sound bugs and the connection seems more and more stable now.Go grab it!
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: What to say...I started playing the Monster Hunter serie back on the playstation 2 with the very first one and I stopped after that on the PsP. I never touched any Monster Hunter games after until recently with the new asset knows as Monster Hunter World.To be honest the story was a bit thrilling on some sort but very poor unfortunately. I could say this is one of my big points of my deception. I also had some problems with my connection while I played with other players (or seeing the dead freeze lag when someone faints even with a strong computer/laptop) was unparallel when I started playing it. At least they did some fixes.I could say it is also annoying that you do hear the special even music in the Headquarter city when you have a special event that you haven't finished yet is getting annoying. I mean I never finished the Behemoth "raid" monster so I constantly have the music of Final fantasy constantly playing until I finish it. I wish there would be an option for that seriously to listen the normal music instead.Yet despite all those problems mentionned above I would say by my experience this Monster Hunter is way much more friendly compared to what I played before. I mean back on Playstation 2 and PsP you didn't have a mini tutorial at the start or a training area to test the weapons properly without taking a quest. You even have some little videos implented for brief explanation for each weapons. Compared to many games I can tell you this is rare to see something to be that friendly toward any kind of players Old MH veterans to new players.And also another thing that I was happy with it is that you don't have anymore "Loading transitions" between each area on one map. I mean when you do wanted to go like from Area #1 to Area #2 in the old games you had a loading screen to load that map. It was pretty annoying and long. Now it's a full map with so many interactions in it.And then the combat system surely it got improved compared to my MH serie experience. I did felt those were easier compared to the old ones as they removed lot of clunkyness in the game. Funny as it is and not like the Bowguns weapons because they got some cool things implented with them the warhorn is somehow the less touched of all weapons as being changed over the years during the combat. I really think that the only thing they added is to enter into the music stance right after you can hit an enemy and that damage shockwave.As for my overall review in the end the game has flaws but the gameplay really pushed me hard to enjoy it to play even more. For this year Capcom got a game that is quite decent. It is really a game I would consider to keep an eye on it. I am pretty you will not be disapointed.Oh and Capcom if you read this for the next Monster Hunter please.... do a better written story while keeping your gameplay formula. I know you can do it. Thanks in advance!
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: The launch was a bit bumpy and there are still some problems but that is most games. I don't understand why the game is getting so much hate. The problem with this review system is people are far more likely to share their dislike and problems with a product than there are those who are willing to share their satisfaction. Frame rate isn't as good as it should be. I do agree with this but maxed out graphics minus that one setting that was giving everyone problems gets me 80fps which is pretty much constant.The keyboard and mouse keys are bad but at least they are rebindable. Monster hunder has has crappy and i mean crappy keybindings on prior games. The game works just find with a controller and I would recommend one over kb and mouse. for the same reasons i would recommend a controller for darksouls and bloodborne gamesOne can hpe that the claims are true about capcom being open to allow us to mod the game. I would like to see a mod to fix the cat system as well as the multiplay fix. I would like A and B armors to be unique are well as weapons along a branch. I understand the graphics are more work in this than 36sI hope when the stuff is fixed that you who have negatively vote switch your votes around. The game is great.Now that I've played far more I must say the community stuff for this game is so poorly implemented. How could the 3ds with its simple stuff have the tightest of communities and the easiest to interact in. Pain to send messages People don't see messages all the time if not ever. Pain to send and receive guild cards. I forget to send them because its walled in. I think I've only received 2 cards. The other thing is the surprising amount of people who suicide run into monsters and won't listen to anyone.Be nice to have a ranking system based on weighted average of completed missions vs attempted. Each monster would have their weight and then another weight based on method of defeat like cap or kill and number of carts. Time ain't important so long as you win. Then the game can allow you to play within your weight class instead of being thrown in with guys who think this game is a beat em up.I still love this game but it lacks something most monster hunter games and good games in general have even though this game is loads of fun. I can't reccomend this game for a person who loves old style MH because this feels far more laborios for less reward and easier difficulty.

review: I enjoyed the game a lot. It has its downsides like the controls that feel very uncomfortable if played with mouse and keyboard. I strongly recommend a controller to play this game.The many negative reviews on Steam must have been written at the game release and never updated. Most of them complain about connectivity issues that are now almost non existent. If I have to describe the game to someone who never played any title of the saga I'd say that the monster fights resemble the epic Dark Souls boss fights. The end game monsters in particular can be quite tough even with the best gear. And about that there are many pieces of equipment and weapons that lead to different character builds just like in Diablo. Overall it's a good game that can provide many hours of entertainment. Recommended.

review: It's pretty much boss fights the game and it's a bit grindy. So if you like the idea of fighting big monsters a lot of times to carve off pieces to make either your weapon better or a better weapon with some tight controls. It offers a lot of depth though and you can always switch weapon types if you're feeling bored or want something else to do or learn. There's 14 of them so take your time finding one you're comfy with. Or learn another later down the line if you so choose.Turn off the "Volume Rendering Quality" and you can manually make it go to 60 which seems to be where it's meant to be played. Volume Rendering Quality is in game fog and it makes things look milky and freaks the game out. Seen a lot of that floating around below. Also the menus in here are a bit of a confusing nightmare (But workable after you get the hang of it.) And def. seems to want you to use a controller.But all that aside (do keep it in mind though.) I've had a soft spot for MH since I'd played it with a few friends on my DS a while back so when I heard a port was coming to PC I was hype. Pre ordered after I played it off and on at a friends house on his PS4 to make sure got my settings messed with after looking up a few vids on folks trying to stream it (Pat Stares At has the above setting and what it does it was helpful to get everything up and optimised).To emphasize it is a bit behind consoles as this is this developers first forray into PC. Not a good excuse but something to def. keep in mind. We're getting things caught up still but I'm having a good time running around with friends and even hammering things out solo. It's nice and challenging and like Shadow of the Colossus and Dark Souls you have to kind of figure out the moves of your opponent and most weapons have a grappling action that lets you jump on and take 'em down. I love this odd little albeit grindy game. No micro transactions no fees and an expansion is on the way. Good times.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: Awesome game as you'd expect from the saga plus new mechanics and an open world feel to it as the game doesn't load areas singularly but loads the whole level at once. Cool no? Where's the catch then?Optimization. MHW is a port from this generation consoles and the first PC port the team ever made. Well it shows. A PC with an i7 at 4GHZ per core 16 GB DDR4 and a GTX 1080 for graphics has a hard time keeping the 60FPS mark tanking constantly at 50 sometimes 40 in the more detail rich areas like the Rotten Vale it even went down to the hideous console level 30s. Fixes are spread throughout the internet but usually require you to lower your graphical settings which is a pity. I'd like to take this occasion to inform people at Capcom that you're gonna sell even more copies if you can fix this quickly. PC gamers tend to be demanding and considering the overall better equipment at hand with good reason. You already did a great job and have our thanks for bringing this masterpiece to PC but please work on optimization!UPDATE END OF 2018And there they did it! The game is well optimized now and the tedious disconnections are no more. They added lots of content since my last review at the point that they are basically at the same level of the console counterpart and the modding community's been doing huge steps onward to make interesting new challenges.If you still didn't get this game it's a high recommendation from me.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: The game is great do not let the "mixed" overall reviews fool you. Many people left negative reviews on launch day where a lot of bugs were plagueing the gaming. These are fixed now.Recently my game kept crashing consistently with the "err12 graphics device crashed" message so I thought it must be on my graphics card but no apparently it was caused by my Ryzen processor. Whether this game doesn't work well with Ryzen or my processor was flawed will have to be determined once my replacement comes in.After switching back to an Intel i5 6600k the game hasn't crashed in over 10 hours.If you are having the err12 graphics device crash issue please post about it on forums it is a widely spread problem that still has no definitive solution and every post could help bring modders closer.To the game Once you get the hang of whatever weapon you are first picking up it becomes fun before that you will probably find yourself frustrated with feeling slow and clunky. No shame in looking up tutorials about each weapon the community is very helpful.

review: MHW is a good entry for newcomers while feeling familiar enough to not alienate veterans of the series.The game features all 14 weapon categories introduced in previous games (main series). With 14 weapon categories 11 being melee 3 being ranged there is enough variety to not be disappointed that MHW didn't introduce a new weapon category. One drop of bitterness is the weapon design though. The weapons don't look bad but they look too similar to each other.In previous games you had one sword that looked like a jaw one that looked like a giant horn another one was covered in serpent skin and released fang like blades when drawn.Now the weapons differ less from each other. The core or base of the weapon mostly stays the same and the only thing that changes is that the blacksmith adds claws skin etc onto the same "weapon skeleton"That is a huge downer!The new areas look beautiful and the newly added possibilities to interact with the environment and even use it to your advantage is something I've always wished for.The fights are what fans of the series know and love so I'll skip praising stuff that's typical MH. Another good thing about the game is that it has a modding community which is pretty active (Nexus Mods is where you'll find most MHW mods)Cons The story was uncalled for is unskippable (even when creating a second char) has a few tedious missions and hinders the multiplayer experience on which they improved on in this game in that (nearly) every quest can be done in multiplayer now. &gt So there's no seperation between guild and village anymore. You can't play through the sad excuse of a story with a friend that easily though since a lot of progression relevant quests have cutscenes in it. And you can't join someone if you haven't seen the cutscene yourself before and even then you can only join after the host has seen it which is admittedly easy due to the new SOS system (drop in mid quest co op) but still an unnecessary nuisence 99 48 if you want the full game (with the cut out mtx dlc stuff) + OST The game lacks a lot options regarding visuals HUD and more. You can't even pause the game in offline mode. &gt Using the MHW process tool (NexusMods) lets you pause the game. Most errors are fixed but not all. I've lost a character due to a corrupted save after defeating the "last" boss (Xeno'jiva) a few days ago. I thought they would have fixed this by now since the problem exists and is known from day one on. &gt Be smart make copies of your savdata every once in a while &gt &lt Steam&gt userdata &lt your_id&gt 582010 remote" &gt SAVEDATA1000 And last but certainly not least Denuvo
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: TL DR It's a great game if you enjoy coop multiplayer. The optimization is average and story is going to be short. But you will find of your time spent on weapons mastery and builds that prolongs your enjoyment.If you played previous monster hunter games this game has quite a few imrpovement and some downfall.The Good Quality of life improvement (move while consuming potion gather resources faster preview armor build etc) Weapons feel weighted and combat feels fluid. (Open stage) no more loading into the next area. Free DLC quest and challenges continues. Multiplayer is easier to setup (with some issues).The Bad Optimization is weak (heavy CPU consumption). Limited weapon design variations. Dropping out of multiplayer quest happens from time to time. Monster variation is not as great as previous games. Tutorial still confusing though not as bad as previous titles.This game is a huge step up in monster hunter series and I find even more enjoyment in pc modding. With the expansion coming soon this is a good time to get in and join us hunters!

review: The most beautiful looking Monster Hunter until date. It has a good story that can be completed by your self regardless of your hunting skills and if you need or want help there s always the SOS signal for you to get someone to give you a hand. Moreover the character customization has never been (in previous games) as detailed as it is now. In addition the lack of unnecesary quests in which you have to hunt the same monster over and over again is nice too. In the negative side controls always feel sluggish at some point that s never gonna change apparently. Also it does need more types of monsters to hunt but that is being fixed through DLCs. Awesome game for experienced and beginner hunters. I highly recommend it!

review: Product received for free. You've read all the reviews. You know about the disconnect problems denuvo microtransactions whatever fine.So let's get straight to the point.Gameplay is slow and methodical. Boss patterns are many but they are slow. Knowledge and timing are more important than reflexes and intuition in this game. It's mind numblingly easy to run around and dodge all the boss' attacks. Fine.But the risk comes into play when you try to go on the offensive. YOUR attacks are slow too. You are also usually locked into the direction you begin your combo in. Although Monster Hunter World's action gameplay is slow so are you and so battles mostly consist of thinking ahead and deciding just how deeply you want to commit to your combo. Commit too far and you'll get hit during a recovery animation. That's usually the way it goes in this game. Learn your weapon class' ideal DPS combo and use it. Try not to overextend your combo or you'll get dunked on. Play it too safe and your battle will take 20 minutes. And you might die in those 20 minutes. It's yours to decide.There are fast weapons. A few. This is offset by their poor damage. So basically you have to take even bigger risks and take full advantage of boss opening windows to offset the damage cost of using a faster weapon. In the end it's just as risky anyway if you actually want to be useful.And then there are ranged weapons which have even worse damage. So you have to work 4x as hard to carry your weight. Of course the reason for the nerf is self explanatory and logical. Ranged is easy and almost completely risk free. But the damage is ALMOST unsalvageable. Almost. There are ways.Unless you're very experienced and/or very geared most bosses in this game will 3 or 2 shot you. Sometimes even 1 shot depending on how late game or ungeared you are. Monster Hunter World is a somewhat punishing game although not nearly as its predecessors. It is nevertheless not for those looking for a relaxing and carefree experience. At least the game is not intended for that purpose unless you're Mr. America McBadass. Anyway you can find out everything else from other reviews.Good luck!

review: It's a Monster Hunter. A quite different one than veterans might expect but it remains a MH at it's core.For those that are fans of the Monster Hunter series there is no need to try and recommend this. You already have it and you like it. For those that haven't touched the series this game will feel weird at first. After a bit of general fidgeting of controls and some trial and error the game can be really great. It highly depends if the typical MH playstyle is something for you. You are mainly fighting "bosses" and have something akin to dragged out duels with them. You wear the monster down and try to survive while doing so. At some point you will (hopefully) come out victorious because your enemy couldn't handle the fight anymore and fell victim to the many wounds you created. Approaching a monster without care can easily lead to a quick defeat so the fight never feels boring unless you know the monsters moveset by heart. Even then it's not always easy. If this game sounds fun to you I can only recommend it. The controls might feel weird at first but just rolling with it should do the trick. Just make sure to not cry out in a negative review after the controls don't work ABSOLUTELY perfect in 5 minutes or something feels really bad at first.Looking at the other reviews some people like to try something in 10 minutes and then complain how bad or slow it feels. Half of these reviews state "problems" in the game which don't exist just because they didn't even take a look at the game. Imagine someone left a review on Dark Souls saying the game is trash because you can't dodge even though that's a thing you can do from the first second of the game.This game will take getting used to but it's not Runescape or World of Warcraft in which you need atleast a month to get an Idea of the game. You're a new hunter fresh blood. Of course you will need to get used to everything. If this sounds like too much of a Hassle or not your type of game then take a stop here. You will spend your money better in other places. Monster Hunter is not a calm game and you won't be perfect at the game in just a few hours. You might also want see if you have friends to play this game with because just on your own it can easily feel a little empty. Conclusion Veteran? you already have this game and you like it.New? Smashing big monsters and getting better with your weapon of choice. Grab friends for the best experience.Not into boss rush + Gathering and grinding? Maybe just watch the game on Youtube. Might not be your style.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: In this day and age while not necessarily perfect the MH dev team are the only team I trust to deliver a quality game every time and the only series I'm willing to preorder new iterations as they release. I have played every Monster Hunter released in the West since Monster Hunter Freedom 2 on the PSP (with the exception of Tri). I bought a 3DS specifically to play more Monster Hunter and to this day I still only own two games for the device MH4U and MHG. Monster Hunter has a gameplay loop that has enthralled me since I first read about it and I didn't even get my hands on any games until a year and half after I first came across it!MHW brings many quality of life improvements to the game while also bringing a roster that is a mix of fresh faces and nostalgic fights. Weapon movesets are reinvigorated and improved so much so that some may even find it hard to return to the previous iterations. And that's important because when the gameplay loop requires you to do effectively the same thing over and over you better hope it's damn good and it is. The feeling of taking down a previously frustrating monster still produces a thrill that many other games struggle to reproduce.The game has a lot of negative press and reviews due to being riddled with issues at launch almost all of which have been fixed at the time of this posting. Don't let them deter you if you are even mildly interested in this game. For the price of entry you have a game that is great solo and better in coop with hundreds of hours of content and even more content released as free DLC. I have sunk many many hours into this game am likely to continue to do so for the foreseeable future.

review: Ok before you roast me here's the issue I don't usually write reviews and even then I don't usually write negative reviews because I like leaving positive feedback but after the millionth time seeing my friends and I get kicked from an online session because of the Steam servers I feel like unless we kick up a big enough fuss (It's not even listed in the known issues section) Capcom will just sit on their butts like how they treated the Dragon's Dogma port which didn't get a good patch till like late in it's development cycle.PROS 1. The core gameplay loop is seriously addictive. Even if you don't usually play these kind of games it's easy to get really into it once you've hunted your first few monsters and are working your way up to better gear. And with the massive amount of people playing it right now getting friends to join you isn't too hard either. (When the servers actually stay up.)2. It's gorgeous. Some person wrote the that graphics look like they're from 2009 in the discussion page. Are you blind? JP game dev studios have always put art direction first and foremost in their game designs something which I really appreciate. Breath of the Wild Okami Super Mario Odyssey to name a few you can look back in like a decade and still feel like the games look amazing. MonHun captures that wonderfully here with sprawling vistas likelike monsters and beautiful set pieces it's really a feast for the eyes. If you have a rig that can run it well of course.3. It has ridiculous amounts of replayability and end game content. A problem I have with a lot of games like this is that once the game is done that's it. It's over. Especially MMORPG's. But MonHun doesn't have this problem. The game is constantly updated with new content and the tough boss fights in the end game will keep you going for hours. I've played almost all the MonHun games since Freedom and I've put like around 100+ in all of them. That's how you do content.CONS 1. Server issues server issues and server issues. When I first heard that Capcom was opting to use Steam's servers instead of the clan system they have on consoles I breathed a sigh of relief. At least Steam had the pedigree to keep multiplayer flawless right? Nope. The first day of launch was fine. But after that it was dc after dc after dc. Me and my friends can't even finish a hunt it's just so bad. Which is a shame because I waited out the initial console release just to experience this game with friends eight months after release and here I am hunting solo. If I wanted to do that I would've just played the console version and saved myself the wait.2. Optimization. Capcom isn't exactly known for optimization and it shows here. I glad that a lot of computers which are below minimum spec can still run the game unlike earlier reports but it feels like even beefy rigs struggle to run this game well owing to it's CPU heavy usage. Which is weird because the loading times are amazing even on my HDD but it feels like it could've really used some tweaking to get more out of it. I'm not a game dev though so maybe there's some super special feature which can't be disabled which is taxing all the memory and processing power.3. Those Egg fetching quests. What blood type are you Capcom? S? Are you S type? For sadistic? Whoever designed that mission where the Rathian chases you around while you're trying to deliver eggs and where the Aptonoths (or whatever those rhino thingies are called) keep respawning and trying to hit you while you're carrying their eggs is a sadist. He needs to be tied up with rope and left in a square somewhereCONCLUSIONSo as you can see I thoroughly enjoy this game and believe it completely deserves my thumbs up. But until Capcom fixes the server issues and irons out the kinks I will be leaving my review as a negative so that hopefully someone will take notice. Please Cap give me a reason to turn this thumb upside down. To the right side.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: What will I say that hasn't been said before. This game is a MASTERPIECE! 14 highly unique weapons wit hvastly different playstyles. Tons of armor with virtuously limetless customization and fine tuning.You wanna be a badass wielding a bigass sword that swings as slow as a tank but also hits like one? BOOM greatsword! You wanna wield a sword and shield that ALSO turns into a big battleaxe that has a rediculously high skill ceiling? BOOM Charge blade! Wanna become a helecoptor? BOOM Kinsect Glaive! wanna enter MAXIMUM WEEB?!? BOOM Dual Blades!The environments are absolutely stunning. The zones are massive and have several secret pathways and little interactions that can make or break a hunt.Speaking of hunts lets talk about the 66% of the main title. Hunting Monsters!Every monster is incredably unique including the subspieces (not gonna bother explaining learn yourself). They vary from an evil hardcore looking pachirisu (that electric squirrel pokemon) to a rampaging pickle monster that uses OTHER MONSTERS as a ing WEAPON all the way to a traditional dragon and even a litteral b2 bomber dragon! They all have unique attacks behaviors weaknesses interactions with other creatures and their environments. You can either capture them or if you have a serious grudge against a certain monster (the roar is ingrained in my head) you can just outright kill it and skin the remains right off of it!This game has insane replayability and even im finding new stuff and learning new weapons every time I log in. Final verdict 10/10 would play again and again and again. Buy it full price or on sale this is a must have game.Also AW LAWD HES COMIN!

review: Hmmm......... Is Monster Hunter World Good or Bad?Let me put it this way very seldom do I get too engrossed in a game. This is one of those times.Monster Hunter may be classified as Open World but technically it's more of Open Exploration of the Small World you have a map and you can go anywhere on that map and do a lot of things ranging from killing big monsters to killing small monsters to kill innocent herbivores to fishing (yes fishing) or catching bugs and collecting plants.The good thing about this game is that it doesn't require level grinding only item grinding... Which now that I say out loud is worse hahahaha. Because at least with leveling you get there at some point with item grinding you could collect all the requirements except one. But anyway the graphics and combat system are remarkable easy to master easy to appreciate. And it's not predictable at all times because unlike other RPG games where you just hunt the target in this game you could face more than 1 big monster even though you're only hunting a particular one. Bottomline is you'll probably get addicted after your first big hunt.

review: Finally I can review this game. After playing it on PS4 and now on PC things are finally looking up after yesterdays patch. Connection issues seem to be COMPLETELY fixed for myself and my friends. I can now FINALLY put a recommended review up now. This game is lots of fun with lots of content. A great introduction into the Monster Hunter series.A few pros Tight Controls 14 different weapon types(Playstyles) HEAVY HITTING weapons(Hit lag feels GREAT) Easy to learn hard to master Lots of QoL changes Cat Warriors Meowscular ChefCons Awkward settings for chatting with fellow hunters Frames drop in the REALLY particle heavy fights Doing story missions with friends require everyone to see the cutscene first Really missed out on the squads setupAll in all its a fun game to play. I plan on putting as much if not more hours into the pc release(592hrs). Get your friends and go kill some huge monsters!

review: So I'll start off with the context that I played the PS4 version of this game for around 600 hours and I've put somewhere around 2 000 hours into the franchise I'm sure. Just picked this up because of the winter sale and I sold my ps4 for a switch and really missed this game. I only have a mid range rig at best but this game plays just like it came off the PS4 and in fact can feel even better at times. I highly recommend this game to veterans and newcomers alike it is such a fresh and explorative game and it gives you the power to do whatever you want whenever you want. This game never once feels like a grind and that's because of the sheer simplicity of it. You run around and collect and kill stuff to make stuff then you run around and kill and collect more stuff because you want better stuff to make and so the beautiful cycle of Monster Hunter pulls you in for one of the best experiences you will / have ever had. Hands down one of the best games of the year!
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: Maybe when it launched te game deserved a "Mixed" rating but it doesn't as far as I'm concerned. I'm told I'm only half way through the game but oh my goodness this game is a lot of fun.There's a ton of grind that doesn't feel like a grind I find myself wanting to fight against the same monsters so that i can learn their patterns find their weakspots and get their armorsets/weapons.The menus are clunky there are a ton of weapons that all play differently and the co op is hard to understand. (you cant do expeditions with others unless you use an SOS flair but you still cant if its an expedition for a quest and also if you complete a quest you can return to camp and THEN you're in an expedition but...... etc etc etc)But it's so fun and I haven't played an hour for each dollar I've spent but I wholly intend to and I fully recommend this experience to anyone. It's easy to get into (although guides whether they be online or via friends help tremendously) its a lot of fun to play and it's a great time.

review: This game is incredibly good! It's my first Monster Hunter game and man am I enjoying it. Being able to explore areas freely is awesome (so many hidden spots!) learn the terrain to take advantage of it during fights and simply just fighting stuff massively larger than you is an incredible feeling.One thing that a lot of games get wrong but this one did right the tutorial.The game basically unlocks features as you play so that you aren't overwhelmed and there a short popups with clear concise information to avoid any confusion. You can also review them at anytime so even if you stop playing for a long time getting back in the game is easy.I'm really looking forward to the continuation of the storyline in the upcoming expansion and fighting new monsters of course!

review: My first experience with Monster Hunter was back on the Wii. 3 Tri was the first ever difficult game I had ever purchased one that made me realize gaming isn't just Lego Star Wars or other children games. The difficult along with the environment to immerse yourself in blew my 12 year old self's mind and truly inspired me.Now seeing a series that sparked my gaming love come to PC really was a sight to see. I dumped in 100 hours the first week it was released and I've had such a good time playing it. As it's the first Monster Hunter game to come to PC and other platforms the "lack of content" is understandable and doesn't bother me as there have been so many steps forward in the games mechanics from the previous titles. Open envrionments beautiful textures and exillerating monster fights all shown through a brand new lens. With new DLC planned for release and other fun events constantly occuring there's lots of fun to be had with friends and by yourself. With the plethora of weapons equipment and armor choices there's tons of room to experiment and have fun as well as finding the style that fits you best!Happy Hunting!

review: The best thing about this game is definitely the combat and everything around it. This was my first Monster Hunter and I was really impressed. There is a bunch of weapon types to choose from each with its unique moveset. The monsters themselves are designed very well and they can put up a real challenge. They also change locations during the fight so you get plenty of opportunities to interact with the environment and use it to your advantage. The variety of monsters is good and it will take you a long time just to finish the game even without any grinding. I would definitely recommend buying this game just for the sake of the combat and amazing boss fights alone.However the game is not perfect in every aspect. The story is meh and there is zero character developement. They also didn't do a great job with world building they just throw you into this world with zero clue what is going on. It also doesn't help that only the most important quests are voice acted and a lot of the dialogue which cover some of the lore is not. If this is what you are looking for this game might not be for you. I realize that neither story nor character development nor world building was the main focus of developers of this game but it would be so much better if they put more effort into these parts and make the game something more than just series of boss fights.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: awesome game i just loved even after never being able to play a monster hunter this is my first one on the series and it was amazing! fight in epic scale with all kind of creatues mastering all kind of weapons after 250+ hours played i enjoyed every single one of them but after so much playthrought you are left with not much to do besides waiting for events and farming arch tempered elder dragons praying to get the draconite to upgrade ur favorite weapong wich is just and rng fest for a boss that is extremely hard to hunt by yourself and people online well lets just say some of them are a sack of potatoes besides of that the decorations system another rng fest the best ones have little to 1% drop chance so good luck with that i see a lot of people complaining about the disconections well it has not happen to me that often maybe once per day but not a big deal tbhI give it a 9/10 but it may get a 10 on my opinion with the new expansion iceborne we'll see

review: Allow me to start off by saying I do not truly consider myself as a veteran. I was first introduced to the Monster Hunter series back in the good ol' days of 4 Ultimate when G Rank was something I could happily look forward to. With my time spent through 3 different 3DS XL systems and a 2 DS XL I had clocked roughly 900 hours into MH4U alone across 2 different accounts being lucky on two different occasions that my save data hadn't been corrupted with my 3 DS deciding to brick itself. Then came good ol' Generations where I'd spend yet another 1000 hours across 3 different account wishing for G rank to come back all the while screaming at the waste of space that is Blangonga and dying to a dabbing Communist Yogi Bear. That being said here's my standpoint on World as a whole...The game is good. There's no other way to put it. I put in roughly 500 hours into the game on PS4 with a few friends absolutely enjoying the hell out of everything before the MHWorld team decided to start pumping out Tempered and Arch Tempered stuff. Look I'll be honest as much as I want to take on a challenge just as much as the other guy some of us actually want to play the game at a more casual rate than others so introducing new content that's supposed to be on par with the top 10% of players is actually more of a kick to the balls then a friendly tip of the hat. I don't want to spend 10 hours farming Tempered Azurelos just at a chance for a crit boost gem I'd rather farm the subquest on a Brachydios Hunt and hope to Gog that I land myself the Charms I need for the next armor set I'm wanting to build. I thought that being able to craft charms and hoping to get certain decorations was a good thing (simply because of how many times I've had to farm for those damn Aquaglow and Sunspire jewels) but now I absolutely hate it.Speaking of gems and charms the skill system a basic watered down version of what us old gen players had to play with. There are no downsides and I hate that. There's no strategy involved with making an armor set anymore other than "Durr hurr how many of armor can put on with much gem slot to make stroge to kill monster fast with less brain hurr durr?" so (almost) anyone can slap together a few pieces that have similar skills and crank in a few gems and viola everything is good! Meanwhile back in 4U it takes a god like talisman with a few painfully hard pieces of armor to acquire for you to just have Honed Blade (Sharpness +1 plus Attack up L) and Steady Hand (Mind's Eye and Razor Sharp). It took me 40+ hunts before I could get my first Wartorn Dragonsphire even with breaking all the parts on that oily sunuva but I still love Gogmazios and will always have a place for him in my heart.Oh and monsters in this game? They're alright. Anjanath is a giant chicken wannabe Deviljho Tobi is actually fun to fight Great Jagras knows how to vore and Nergigante is just a big spiky pushover. I just wish there was at least one other water and thunder monster so I wouldn't have to feel bad farming Mudkip and Emolga.The weapons and how they handle is fantastic. Charge Blade is a happy medium between the 4U initial start and the crippling nerf of Gen/GenU Long Sword is a permanent favorite of mine and I appreciate the counter system (which didn't need a larger window for the counter to proc people just need to git gud) and Hunting Horn is more of a "support" team carry weapon than ever before! The only thing that messed up is giving weebs an excuse to try and hunt by making the dual blades be the way they are... Thankfully they nerfed Dash Juice and Wiggly Litchis exist but still...SO yeah I'll be on and off playing this 'till the winter expansion comes out. Gonna give it a whirl on console then throw more money at this amazing company and team to get the expansion on PC! You guys out there are some amazing people the developers and players alike (other than the stingy Hunters who auto kick someone if they don't like the way they look y'all can stop with that toxic nonsense) and I hope this game doesn't die out too quickly. Good luck and good hunting Doodle !
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: Monster Hunter World is my favourite game of 2018. Beautiful landscapes surrounded by intense monsters which each require a particular skill set to master. There are 14 different types of weapons to choose from which are all available right from the beginning. Most of the gameplay consists of hunting monsters to enhance gear so you can in turn hunt even stronger monsters. I only played one previous installment for the 3ds but the strides made to reinforce and redefine the series with this version of the game have (imo) perfected the series. I was completely taken aback a couple hours into my first session when I witnessed a Jyuratodus come out of butt**** no where and it just began mauling this poor Barroth I was hunting. 'Turf Wars.' so hilarious and fun to be around. At launch there were some inconviences with online play but I personally got around it and was able to play a good chunk of the story with my friend after watching the cutscenes. Pretty excited to throw my $$$ at Capcom for the new dlc launching in the fall. 11/10 will give them my soul if it means another crisp Monster Hunter game like this one.

review: The game is great. Starts a bit slow and I didn't liked the tutorial quests but I understand why they were there and I think that is a good way to teach the basic controls to someone new to this kind of game.It's a friendly game to newcomers or at least friendlier than the previous entries in the series.The story is there to serve the gameplay and nothing more really. It's not bad neither brilliant it's just there.The gameplay loop is adictive in a good way. You kill oversized monster to obtain materials to craft sick weapons and armor to kill more oversized monsters. It's really fun.Graphics are nice and the game could get a little further optimization but it's not as bad as some people made it look.It can gate stale after you finished the main events and overcome the few milestones but there's a bunch of things to do to counter that Try a new weapon. There are 14 types of them and each is diffrent in terms of play style skills and aesthetics. Play with friends. Seasonal events.Rounding up this review I thoroughly recommend this game.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: 700 Hours and counting on Console.Incredible game with an enormous skill ceiling. Somewhere between Dark Souls and Devil May Cry. The attaining of mastery provides endless satisfaction as you topple enormous threats with increasing skill. Using the environment to your advantage learning your enemy knowing your own abilities. It all comes together for an exhilerating experience and one that's even better with friends.Progression is steady and expanding your options feels well earned. By the time you finish the main questline you'll just be getting started. Don't buy this game for a story there is barely a husk of one.The story quests will drag a bit at the beginning but you'll need the time to get your bearings. The focus is seeing and doing and wearing and fighting cool stuff. There are some neat concepts but there's almost no narrative tying it together. There is lore you can read up on elsewhere and I highly encourage doing so if you're interested.For the love of god give us an event for easier gold crowns on Elder Dragons. Please.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: This game is outstanding. Monster Hunter has needed a break from the handheld platform for a while now and that's mainly because of the camera. I can't stand using a camera on the 3DS games because I have an OG 3DS and the camera is awful when using the touch screen. The nipple may make those games better but there's nothing better than a C stick. I was even content with using the mouse and keyboard when I started playing this port (I'm a light bowgun main and the keyboard and mouse are pretty managable with the bowguns.) Of course then the game finally let you play with a controller and that's way better.Already the presentation is better than the older games. There's a greater sense of speed in this game and that's something this franchise desperately needed. The graphics are also a noticable upgrade and the music is so good! This is probably the most cinematic the franchise has been and makes me desperately hope for a film adaptation that focuses on action and score mainly like the games do. These games have never had good stories and that's to their credit. Who gives a crap about where Zorah Magdaros is going? I wanna jump on a Rathalos and stab it until it's grounded! I see a lot of people saying that there's too much of a grind in this game and they're right. The Monster Hunter series has always had a ton of grinding but this game actually makes that less painful with the quick way you can pick up materials. Monster Hunter is best played multiplayer too and this game's SOS flare feels great. Struggling on your own? Fire a flare as it's never too late to ask for help. This game is the best the series has to offer and is one of my favorite games of all time.

review: Probably the worst Monster Hunter game so far. It's too much of an MMO now. Like it was grindy and somewhat like a single player MMO in the past but this is a entirely different level. Gathering points respawn in like a minute account items are everywhere to the point that "research points" are basically worthless and the online play makes it so you can't pause the damn game even when you're playing solo hunts.In past games you had to keep track of your inventory and possibly ditch valuable items. Now you have an item box for account items one for gathering items and one for monster parts and ores. Meanwhile tools like whetstones BBQ spits and pickaxes do not take up space have infinite durability and are constantly equipped. So unless you spend an hour constantly gathering items you probably have enough space to carry everything.As for actual gameplay there's SO MUCH HANDHOLDING I CAN'T TAKE IT. NPCS CONSTANTLY SHOUT AT YOU TELLING YOU WHERE TO GO. MAGICAL PIXIEDUST FLY THINGIES ACT AS A QUEST ARROW POINTING EXACTLY WHERE TO GO. MONSTERS HAVE BEEN DEBUFFED TO BE MUCH WEAKER THAN PREVIOUS ITERATIONS OF THE GAME.I've noticed that environmental effects such as needing cold drinks to prevent stamina draining in the desert has been removed and I assume hot drinks are gone too. Quests have been cut down to only main quests and one or two side quests every so often. The canteen offers preset meals with the bonuses shown to your face straight off and all crafting recipes are automatic and 100%.All in all this is a monster hunter game with pretty graphics more multiplayer aspects and has been dumbed down to appeal to the average gamer even though the combat is just hard enough to make those players leave anyways so moot point there.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

Your constantly learning and trying new things and yes you may kill the same thing over and over but strangly i enjoyed my 1st kill of kulu ya ku as much as my 50th. Tons of free updates and communication from the company no buying of cosmetics or any real micro transactions (besides emotes and dances) deffinetly would spend $80 dollars again easy.I will add their is a disconnection problem many a time ive been disconnected a few times but overall id give this game a solid 9/10

review: DO NOT BUY UNLESS ON SALE. DO NOT PREPURCHASE CAPCOM GAMES (they cant port to PC)I have based this review after my first crash of the game. Not as smooth as it should be for PC. I will update my review as time goes on but as a prepurchase at $65 its very sloppy. I like capcom. I do. I remember playing them back in the Snes/PSx era of video games. Megaman Breath of fire Resident evil street fighter etc Great consoles. But over time PC gaming became far superior over console. Sure consoles are still fun but consoles are just a closed PC like a mac. Would be nice to see Capcom switch to PC as primary platform since it would smooth out issues like this. From what I have played the game is smooth for fighting. Controls could be a bit more refine but that can be corrected as time goes on. Game still needs some updates for PC. No push to talk for voice chat. very annoying but can be patched later on. Watching video tutorials cause game to lag and crash so I cant watch them or play. I do remember console days and have an xbox controllers for my rig. Times have changed with digital downloads which should offer more flexibility to predownload before the launch time. Also for digital sales When you say Aug 9th make it Aug 9th at midnight. Aug 26th. Cant play the game without it crashes. I beleive its my nvidia drivers conflicting with denuvo. CAPCOM can make a great game on a console. Too bad they can't port on real computers or develop games for PC. Lets see what capcom support says (

Denuvo makes consistant framerate impossible. I have a 7700K CPU and an RTX 2070 and I cannot manage to keep the game from losing huge chunks of framerate randomly. Is it fun? When it works. But the frustration I feel when my character has a little nap while there's literally a dragon in front of them makes me want to pull out my hair and the ugliness I have to deal with to maintain high framerate is unbearable. Removo Denuvo and this becomes a personal issue. Til then....

Challenging fights and lots of enjoyment playing with friends.As a downside it has a horrible story you can't do story quests online until everyone has seen the cutscene on their own. Which is weird. So you get these moments where 4 people playing together all start the same quest solo. 3 of them leave after watching the cutscene and then join the last player after they watch their cutscene. It's a silly system. Also one of the major bosses if just boring. And you're forced to face it three times.Not bad enough to give this a negative review. You only really play the story for a short portion of the time you play this game. The intense combat and great coop gameplay really make this game.

review: Great Gameplay Mastery through Repetition A World that Breathes and of Course there are MonstersMonster Hunter World is simply one of the few good games available.Combat is the game s absolute strongest feature which may be a struggle to get used to at first but it gets way better through progression. while Every weapon combo imaginable can be executed at level one this is a game about utilizing the tools in your possession. Do not think you can defeat these monsters with just a oversized weapon so easily. with this said if you are looking for a game that gives you additional attack moves and super duper ultimate attacks with your favorite weapon style look somewhere else. If you are looking for a game with combat that relies heavily on resource management strategy a large variety of toys to play with and the thrill of hunting down enemies big and small buy this game.It can get repetitive to which I say what game isn t? sure you may be required to hunt the same target multiple times but it does not matter so long as you have fun every time. this game does exactly that because it is all about adapting and becoming familiar with your hunt. Its about how well you do the next time around compared to how much you struggled the first time.True to its name the world is fantastic to describe it appropriately. You are going to have a lot of fun exploring each map for the first time and interacting with the world. there are going to be times where you would not even think a certain area was reachable because everything blends so well. The world is so alive that you can hear it breathe. Other features include environmental damage using the environment against your target and using other monsters against other monsters.Monsters are the heart and soul of the game and they obviously spared little to no expense creating each one to be different. Though there is little variety in physique what matters is that each one feels different to hunt and that each one has unique traits and quirks. Most of all taking them down feels satisfying.This game is not without downsides however.Sometimes monsters get easier and that carries on to the next target but other times one monster can be so hard you d swear there was a difficulty setting change. This commonly applies to two targets so I hear. I don t want to spoil anything but to put it discreetly these two monsters are only hard because of one super overpowered attack they each have. There are also monster that can be somewhat annoying and its not because they are at all hard Let s just say that the reward money does not matter I d kill Bagel Grease and The Evil NO! for free any day.There are also many times (and I do mean MANY) where things can be unpredictable random and unresponsive. Some monsters attack faster than the human mind can react by both glitch and by intention since there is no build up to some attacks. it almost feels some attacks are meant hit you sometimes no matter what. Some damaging Hitboxes are often applied to the target s entire body as well meaning a tail from a monster s trampling forward charge (which often has no build up) will have the same damage as it would if you had gotten hit in the front. Above all else prepare for lots and lots of staggering stunning slowing air time and plenty of your face in the mud. you are also going to be in situations where you feel as if an attack should hit. i'm not going to lie this is probably the number one reason for a player to quit the game because i myself was very close. The game is also lacking in personalization for something with so many armor and clothing variants. To put it simply the game lacks a glamor system. You simply can t place the stats of one outfit to another. There are specific outfits that you can layer over armor to give it a completely different look but there is a limited few and they are only obtainable either upon completing in game challenges or paying for DLC.Here is what I think of the game overall.some monster attacks feel cheap there is a ton of scenarios where you simply can t do anything to help yourself against their attacks and the game lacks basic personalization features. However it is simply a really really good game. It has solid gameplay replay ability unique monsters and a fantastic world to explore. I think that it is definitely worth your time and money.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: The game itself isn't bad at all though i have played the first to the 4th generation monster hunter games (i have no touched the hand held verisons) For me almost every monster is somewhat easy since most of the attacks are recycled from other older MH games.(the newer monsters have a mixture of their own attacks added with some based off the ones from Tri and frontier and 2)The only thing you'll see standing out is the differences of how effectively you can learn to use whatever weaponyou picked. Not every weapon suites just one person and don't ever listen to anyone who brags about the Long sword (LS) being the best those kind of players never touched anything else and they use LS based on the fact they are just a bit to lazy and all on learning how other weapons work in both disvantages and advantages that is the only differences in weapons is their advantages over each other but it all still comes down to how you are able to adjust and adapt with them.A lot of toxic waste and cancer as always on the steam discussions of just about anythingwhen you have questions about anything related to the game post it with the risk of getting random poor advice more than helpful ones.the graphics are crisp. (do not try and play this game unless you have a decent graphics card and at least min of 8GB of memory if you plan to use low graphic settings for med to semi high 12GB You might get away with mostly setting 75% 80% of the settings high but only if you know that the PC you own can handle the stress)I own a 1070 GTX TI and i have it set to medium/high and at times the game tends to tear if theres a lot of animation effects going off i never have any issues on any other games set to ultra settings think capcom should consider a graphic optimization in the future or at least a fix?First timers please understand that there is an learning curve to this gameKnowing the time it takes to execute attacks based on what weapon you choose.knowing when you need to evade attacks and how to use the surrounding enviroment to aid youLearning the attack mechanics of each monster can be tricky.But you'll eventually get the hang of it.Its best to figure out what works best for you and not be the type of person to base how you play on what others tell you.Advice is always there but always learn from it and apply your own tactics with what you learned while progressing into the game.This game is going through a lot of overall graphic quality patches which is making this game very unstable.Even with my 1070 or 1080 TI graphic cards my frames drop from the low 90's all the way down to nearly 32 fps. I can play elite dangerous with high settings and exploding ships and weapon fire can be going off around my ship and my frames will not drop down below 78.capcom is just screwing things up and the only ones who are sticking around mostly are those Narcissism generation stereotypes just to whine and complain excessively about the same issues every week to a month.My only mistake was purchasing this game and thinking it would have some what a slightly semi decent semi positive group of socially interactive people apparently not.even turning the graphic settings down to medium and low and turning off a couple of useless looking settings frame rate seems to only go between 35 46 which is decent but horrible for a gaming system that can handle ultra high settings on doom and ED and other games.all you will hear when you ask about issues is that is you and you alone you hardly get any positive helpful information.Thing is now this game requires capcom to seriously fix these issuesYou can have vover 16 24GB of memory (I have 24GB and i have two VGA cards 1070 and a 1080 an also a 1030 as a backup vga i have a six core processor AMD of course none of them are overclocked and i have had random fake stereotypes tell me my drivers are outdated or my PC sucks (This is their way of saying you suck cause you can afford these things and they can not cause they live with their parents and they can only afford low quality to medium quality PC stuff even if you got a decent vga card with 2 4GB ram and 12 16GB or memory you are good. Heck i've played this game with a low profile MSI Ge force 640 2gb vga card and had no issues till they adding more content and increased the graphic requirement(any whine and dine comments expressing any form of hate racial flame war will be removed. Also anyone exhibiting behaviors of toxic cancer like drama will be added to a list if bannables via game informer Destructoid and gamesradar+ which is constantly being monitored by over 32 000 groups of player based clans fleets guilds groups etc that play different games professionally and or causually so if you can not comment without acting like a spoiled whiny high demanding childish fool then don't comment at all please and thank you everyone for reading this)

review: I remembered playing Monster Hunter on PSP and I've stopped playing after few hours as it's too difficullt for me. But in Monster Hunter World it's a lot easier. The map is bigger and has open world with tons of things to explore. You have to hunt the monsters and get their parts to make stronger equipments. There are many types of weapons to choose from just try out which weapon you are most comfortable with. I love the overwhelming satisfaction in hunting monsters with my favourite weapons. Hunting in group is where this game shines you will be able to team up with 3 players to hunt down monsters. You can ask for helping hands by firing SOS flares to make your hunting easier. This is definitely one of my favourite games. Highly recommended.

review: This game is one of the few I've experienced worth $60. If it's on sale..BUY IT. The base game at launch is packed with enough content to keep you busy for well over 80 hours and with each event they add additional monsters gear and items that add hours upon hours to the game. With the upcoming expansion in the fall of 2019 they'll be incorporating content that would otherwise be it's own sequel. The game is perfect to play with friends but the online community is so active that you can do it with strangers or solo. Queing makes it easy to find a quest with a party and hop in instantly. The level of detail put into the environments Poogie palico customization etc. are astonishing and its easy to waste time just simply admiring the optional things to do.An honest 10/10 game and to the dev team for constant (free) updates and support.

review: Started playing this game when it was first out on the PS4 and its awesome. Controls took a little bit of getting used to but after that it was so much fun. Its a beautiful game with an awesome eco system and once you have worked out how to use the weapons effieciently combat has a good flow to it especially with the Switch Axe my main weapon of choice flashy and great damage. Some cool things about the game Palico your adorable cat companion who fights by your side is very useful especially when you get a certain gadget for it which helps harvest parts of the monsters Monster Behaviours and Parts I like how certain parts are breakable others are extremely tough and you can sever tails. Its makes you think more about where your placing your attacks and what weapon you will be bringing as well as learning when and where to block or dodge. Weapons large variety of weapons with cool attacks. There will probably be at least one weapon you love. While some of the weapons look meh at low rarities at rarity 7 and above they start looking awesome if they dont already. Capturing monsters gives you more loot so if you break and sever all the parts and capture it its more effient than purely killing everything also reduces some of the grind. SOS while I am a solo player. Trying to leave out spoilers but The monster you face in the Collossal Task quest is easy but there are breakable hidden in plain sight parts that will increase the drop chance of the rarest drop from that monster. Firing an SOS really helps get that item for when your farming the monster and the SOS flare gets a lot of attention fast. Turf Wars its awesome to see the large monsters fighting for territory and as long as they dont both target you it can work out in your favour. Mounting fun looks badass and knocks the monster down if you dont get thrown off. (You have to do a certain amount of damage before you can mount again worth knowing if you play with an Insect Glaive) No fall damage hitchin a rides on wind drakes mantels that lets you glide or do other stuff is funThere are a few cons Handler/NPC Partner (She's funny how she gets into trouble but a lot of players think shes annoying) Combat is tougher with others and the money/Zenny is divided between players also if someone faints it reduces the overall money so if you need more coins. (Although when your at a certain lvl there are easy quests/bounties that do give a lot of zenny. One about killing Coral highland Shamos and one about getting fossils from the place you unlock after the Coral Highlands.) If someone gets knocked out the whole team pays for it. If you play with others and someone on your team isnt doing well and keeps going down the team will fail the mission which is a bit harsh especially when helping lower lvls. Graphics on PC and PS4 not really that much difference. I also have a 3840 x 2160 monitor so would like to be able to have a bigger resolution than the normal 1080. But it still looks amazing especially in cut scenes.Things to note I've spent countless hours on the PS4 but only just started playing on PC the PS4 controller works completely fine on the PC Steam version but the control prompts are Xbox. There is a Dual Shock mod on Nexus mods if any of you prefer a PS4 controller no install just replace a folder with the folder you get from Nexus. Also note that the share button is actually the touch pad symbol and the touch pad is the R3 button. There aren't actually that many monsters some monsters sub catagories of other monsters so basically a different colour and maybe a different or additional element. However the tempered versions and events do give good rewards plus if you want full sets of armour or fully upgrading your weapon it can be very grindy so you may be too busy to notice this until you reach the end game ranks. If Poogie the cute pig in Aestera that you can pet dress and cuddle is happy enough it can find items for you around Astera if you put it on the floor when its bouncing in your arms. You can find all sorts around the tradeyard and somewhere there is a meal voucher if you want to eat for free )I brought the Deluxe version on the PS4 when it first came out and then recently got it on PC so definitley recommending this game.

review: When this game released last summer I wrote a negative review due to the lousy mouse acceleration and rampant connection issues. Regarding those two issues the first has been completely fixed and the second has been mostly fixed. There are still occasional disconnects but in general it's a smooth co op experience. In fact the reason I'm writing a positive review now is because simply put this is one of the best co op experiences on PC. This is just a game in its purest state no microtransactions loot boxes or pay to win elements. You have to earn the armor you don you have to earn the next hunter rank and there's no way to boost your own stats. As times goes on I grew to love MHW more and more and really immersed myself in improving my skills and making good builds. This is a fantastic game and I highly recommend it to anyone.
