review: Monster Hunter World is an amazing contribution to the series. As an avid player of Monster Hunter Tri and Monster Hunter 3 Ultimate this is a welcome addition. The quality of life changes that this game brought with it are very welcome. The constant addition of events and updated/new monsters keep the replayability of the game high enough to keep me coming back. The myriad of weapons available always give you the option to change the way you play if you ever get bored.Admittedly the game does get a little stale after a little while but it's still fun with friends and you're free to open yourself up to a new playstyle to fight the monsters all over again if you wish.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: Let me preface this by saying that I had tried Monster Hunter games prior to this and couldn't stand them.This is one of the best games I have ever played. There is a grind but the it somehow manages to not feel like a grind and even then you don't hit the grind until you've reached endgame content and you're basically just trying to perfect your loadout. I have over 110 hours in this game and sometimes I feel like I've barely scratched the surface. There are so many weapons and varieties within those weapons that you will absolutely find something that matches the playstyle you are into. You pay for the game and none of the game content is locked behind paywalls. This dev team is continuing to support this title well after a year after release with crossover events new content and updates throughout. Nor do you have to dedicate your entire life to this game. Yes there are timed events but those events come back often enough that even if you miss them you'll be able to come back later to work for whatever reward you want. And to top it all off the game is stunningly beautiful with some of the best environmental design of this game type that I have ever seen. This game is clearly a labor of love.Seriously buy it.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: I love this game truly is one of my favourite games of all time. PROS You can get lost in this game and there is always grinding to be done.New updates often.Kills time like nothing i've experienced before.Flawless graphics.Everything other than the multiplayer is exceptional.Amazing weapon trees with a lot of weapon choices available.CONS Demanding as hell (nothing is pre rendered) bought a new P.C just to experience this game in glorious 4K.Huge huge downside is that it's P2P connection which I find pretty much counterproductive that you have to fiddle around with your router settings to be able to successfully play online (if it even works).I routinely get disconnected from almost every session I play there is no help to be found about this matter.I don't think a game you pay 50 for should force you to do this to play online with friends.I've had items randomly disappear after multiple saves of the game and have not reappeared back into my box.Player interface is quite tricky and complicated to get around at first.CREDITS NOT SKIPABLE AT THE END OF STORY (had to sit there for a good 20 30 mins and you HAVE to keep them rolling)There is no way of reporting bugs ingame as far as I'm aware.I know there's a lot of negatives the positives really outweigh them in such a huge way. This game is truly spectacular only if they actually added dedicated servers and not having to rely on someone elses connection or even if the person has a different ISP that can be enough to disconnect you.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

It's pretty much the same few monster over and over again. Arch Tempered version only hits harder. Once you reach the endgame you're pretty much just doing the same quest over and over again because this game is very RNG dependant which is the biggest fun killer for this game. Otherwise it's not bad.

review: I've been really wanting to get my hands on a good mmorpg game like elder scrolls online and I have to say I loved the Dark Souls series combat and this game really aced this similar combat. This game is far better and more amusing to me than elder scrolls online and I really love the fluent Dark Souls like combat and the wide variety of weapons available to you. CON 1.You will constantly lose connection online.2. The game is quite hard without others but you constantly lose connection.3. You constantly get stuck in a getting up animation and when I try to dodge it dives and I get hit before standing up.4. Stuns lasts for up to 8 seconds.5. There are hardly any options for you to upgrade you weapons it's either bone or metal and then you can upgrade it to give it special stats or statis boosts to elements.6. The game doesn't have terrible optimisation but it does tend to freeze before you die.8. Without being able to play with friends that can run or not lose connection and being stuck on the same level makes this game very boring as I have been going through this.9 Controlls sometimes bug out such as when I'm running my character randonly draws out the switch axe and then switches into the sword form on its own while I'm running from the massive T Rex and gets me killed in one hit because it stopped me from moving.The only problems I have is I recieve random messages saying the servers lost connection but thankfully the game automatically plays in offline and it doesn't require to load up again and I can still continue playing like nothing happened. Another thing I hate is how I still haven't revieved any weapon better than the basic bone upgrade from the basic weapon even after 11 hours of playing. If you like Dark Souls can stand playing alone and losing connection and can get past the difficult levels and not having much access to weapon upgrades then this is good for you.7/10 Fix the connection issues.To me this is only worth a max of $38 aud.

review: This game is honestly great fun. Its got a lot of in depth and complex features some of which can feel a little overwhelming if you're new to the Monster Hunter genre but after a while they make sense.It's getting a thumbs down for now because I bought this game to play online and the connection issues seem to be getting worse. (To the point where I can't even manually join a server that I can see is online) Also I'm not a fan of the 16 players per server this tends to result in no one doing the quest I want to do at the time and having to wait a long time for a party to form by which point you'll likely lose connection anyway lol.As soon as these issues are fixed it will get a thumbs upEdit The connection problems appear to be fixed but I didn't really play a lot I just wanted to give the game a fair chance. Changing my review to a Thumbs up as I said I would.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: Awesome game definitely worth every penny Amazing Armor and Monster Designs. Environments are far more detailed and graphically impressive than previous games.Combat only takes a few battles to get used to with the default controls but there's alot of gameplay mechanics (Astera Functions Armor and Weapon stats) That needs a few guides to understand for beginners.Sense of progression is great as you started with normal leather armor and eventually end up with sets of armor with incredible design. Combat is satisfying with audible slashing/piercing sounds accompanied by blood rushing out of monsters.Nothing beats the satisfaction of the succesfully hunted theme song after defeating a monster.Unfortunately no native 21 9 support so you'll need a third party software to enable full screen.

review: Product received for free. HR 540 as of this post.Pros 14 different weapon types (11 melee 3 ranged). Intense and satisfying hunts. Lots of cool/unique armors and weapons with abilities that you could experiment with. Awesome soundtrack during hunts. New event quests and monsters being added in as free DLC. Collabs.Cons PC Port doesn't perform as good as I'd like it. FPS tends to dip randomly and CPU usage can get pretty high at times. Network connectivity still has random disconnects and issues from time to time. Story coop system isn't very well done (requiring everybody to view the cutscenes before being able to play together). Story isn't very memorable. Handler.Overall as an avid Monster Hunter fan since 2004 I have to say that I'm quite satisfied with the game. I'd highly recommend it especially if it's on sale.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: I bought this game with the idea to play together with my partner. Regarding the multiplayer this game is very focused on solo play. Literaly EVERY main story quest has a stupid cutscene which for some reason makes it impossible for your (co op) partner to play alongside with. Only after you are forced to watch a cutscene you can fire a flare so that everyone beside your partner can jump in your game instance. Very frustrating. Other mishaps with the multiplayer are that you cannot see or interact with your (co op) partner at the HQ and you can't depart on an expedition together (you need to complete a quest first before you both can enter an expedition). If you are a solo player and despise multiplayer then Monster Hunter World is great. The story is a bit stretched out and while you are hunting you may occasionaly notice the head of your handler or teamleader appear with a wall of text under it. Summarizing Multiplayer very badly designed not realy a multiplayer game.Story Stretched out thin with too many NPC interactions (I don't want to see the head of my handler appear while I'm hunting!)Graphics 7/10Audio 7/10
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: Having played most Monster Hunter games I can definitely recommend this one. **I do not have experience with the online but I have seen multiple reviews stating that it is cubersome. Starts off a bit slow just like any other monster hunter game and eases you into things a bit (Granted I am a bit bias as I knew what did what etc). Based off of what I knew and how the game flowed I can definitely tell it was dumbed down to a degree to allow the masses to enjoy the game a bit more. (This is NOT a bad thing as some of the mechanics introduced are great) +++Autocrafting Pelico tools Tools in general (No having to carry around a pickaxe / bugnet) Recyled movesets for sure (noticed a good bit of similar movesets from monsters such as the Khezu) but they do have a twist to them so they're not entirely recyled. Optimized terribly for PC (I am still able to hit 75fps with my 75hz monitor) But the fact that it eats up my CPU is god awful with a nice overclock I am still hitting 80+ usage IN ONLY this game which I attribute to my frame dips here and there. Regardless of its optimization I still love this game and the franchise itself. Glad to finally have a proper PC game that you don't have to jump through hoops to play (*cough*Monster Hunter Frontier) Is this a bad port? YES and the culprit is likely Denevo. Do I still recommend it? Yes I do because any computer that has a decent Graphics card and an OK CPU should be able to handle this fine. (x5660 overclocked to 4ghz and a 980Ti Lightning Edition with 12GB of RAM) **EditThe network issues are absolutely abhorrent I can't even alt tab without it disconnecting despite having a connection abd being completely fine otherwise. Until (Which probably won't happen) I do not recommend this game anymore. The network issues are absolutely unforgiveable. I am so tired of it kicking me from hunts and kicking people from my SOS.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: This game is super fun combat is usually very fluid and feels like you are actaully taking down giant monsters capable of mass destruction. The controls are fairly simple and very consistant. There are a ton of weapon choices from the swift dual blades and insect glaive to the hulking hammer and gunlance. With a handful of ranges weapons for those who don't like getting their hands dirty you're sure to find a way to slay monsters that suits you. However this game has a couple of glaring issues if you ask me (certainly not enough of them to warrant a thumb down).The first one and it is a fairly weak argument I will admit is that many monsters can insta kill you. It is easy to dodge most of the high damaging attacks and I rarely get hit by them because the monsters usually have a long or unique animation before the attack to warn you about it. However if you slip up by dodging too late or in the wrong direction many of these attacks will knock you out from full health even if you have a full resistance build to that type. Most high level monsters also have a way to stun you knock you down or otherwise take away your movement which makes it easy for them to land these hits. Regardless once you fight a monster a couple of times you will learn how to avoid these attacks which makes them a non issue.Another issue I find and this one is VERY important and may even turn many people off of this game. You can spend anywhere from 20 to 50 minutes in a hunt just to be disconnected. Sure you go into offline mode and continue the fight solo but the higher level fights are designed to be taken on in groups. If you're new to a monster fight low on gear or any other reason for sitting out of a fight for online play and suddenly you're booted into a solo match you're screwed. You likely aren't going to pose a threat to this monster since you haven't been fighting it. Now you can't rely on teammates distracting the monster while you get a good hit in then fleeing you have to face it all alone. Early on I've had no issues whatsoever with this. That is until I reached high rank hunts. Suddenly either I drop or one of my teammates drops in almost every hunt. Considering this game came out on console over a year ago you'd think the online play would be a bit more stable.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: If you're into grinding and farming then this game is for you. This is the best monster hunter game mechanics wise though still lacks contents. I wish Icebourn would solve that problem. It's totally addictive and fun to play if you have the patience9/10 recommended
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: Edit 4 I'm officially going to change my review to a recommend. After installing a 1080ti I'm finally getting the performance from this game that meets my requirements. It's sad that I needed this kind of horsepower but buyer beware I suppose. After having played 80 hours at this point gameplay wise there is NO REASON NOT TO BUY THIS. This is an amazing Monster Hunter experience and I will be playing this game for YEARS to come.Original "DOES have controller support. Runs like on two 1070's in SLI with settings cranked all the way up. Didn't have my FPS counter but the frames felt slugish and low. NO 3440x1440 support! How is this still happening in 2018?! What did they use the last 8 months for? Defintely not making a good PC port! Runs on at least a 4770k without crashing like some have reported. 0/10 until performace is optimized and 21 9 is supported. Will be retuning the game."EDIT 21 9 support has FINALLY been adressed and an update should be coming soon. The game is still HIGHLY unoptimized and I can barely play this game at medium settings at a stable 60 FPS. Gameplay is great. Autocrafting while questing is an odd choice but it seems to work. It's just more good Monster Hunter. Will Change to reccommend once 21 9 is implemented fully and performance is adressed.EDIT 2 21 9 Support has been implimented and that checks one of the two boxes off my list (sorta) However the 21 9 doesn't completely fill up the screen and leaves small vertical black bars on side of the monitor. At this point I am STILL using a mod to give me those extra pixels of real estate back. Performance has still not been addressed and I have had to resort to playing at some fairly underwhelming settings to get a (usually) stable 60FPS.if it weren't for my G Sync monitor I would have to lower the setting to medium or low to get a stable FPS without annoying frame dips.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: I should probably mention that is my first experience with the entire Monster Hunter franchise. And I have to say it was a very welcoming and captivating one that drew me in right away.To anyone like myself who might have felt intimidated at jumping into a long running series without touching the predecessors I'd say that those fears are unfounded. The game has a highly immersive experience and is very accessible even to casuals like I am(I'm a dooting stick main myself and spend most of the game running around drinking potions and swinging an oversized instrument at monsters sometimes landing a successful hit by accident).There are plenty of strengths to this game that others would do a better job at describing. So instead I'll just highlight my biggest gripe with the game and that is the lack of monster variety(from a newcomer's point of view). After my first hundred hours I began to tire of fighting overgrown lizards however diverse colourful and behaviourally distinct they were. The game might feel a little more like a Dragon Hunter than a Monster Hunter at times but with future collaborations and DLC sure to come I'm sure that the monster variety will be less of an issue come a few updates later.Thumbs up highly recommended. Also a little ashamed to admit that the Handler eventually grew on me somewhat. If she's stopping you from enjoying the game experience I suggest using a mod to change her appearance and/or voice.

title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: As a veteran of the series I'd say this a very well polished addition to the franchise with many quality of life changes that make it easier to get into than previous entries of the series. If you are new to the series I recommend starting out with this game since it really does 'hold your hand' for the most part when learning the mechanics of the game. I'm not saying it's necessarily a bad thing (although veterans might find this annoying for the first part of the game where there is constant tutorials) but it really helps new players ease into game. I know for previous entries of the series players mostly had to figure out things on their own for the most part and they did throw a lot of things on your plate with constant quests being thrown at you and whatnot.Even though this may seem like not to large of a game as compared to older MH games mostly since it has The least number of monsters in a MH game Fewer maps Not the addition with G Rank being in game (will change when the Iceborne expansion releases later this year) Endgame may feel 'lackluster' compared to older MH games w/ no events happeningIt does have its improvements Each map is large interactive and is one continuous map rather than zoning b/w zones Monsters react more realistically with the player other monsters and the environment Improvements to in game mechanics (ie HUD quick crafting item box management) It's a beautiful game and the best looking so far in the mainline MH gamesAnother thing is that Capcom is constantly adding content to the game via event quests new monsters festival events and collaboration events and it's all FREE! What more could you ask for?! My only gripe with the game is adding a transmog feature (I know we have layered armor in the game but I wish we could transmog our armor to any gear of our choosing) and that the weapon and armor designs for late game gear have much to be desired compared to older MH games.Other than that I'd highly recommend getting this game. New players and veterans alike will really enjoy this game. It's good wholesome fun to play especially with friends and come on who doesn't want to wreck monsters with giant weapons to make cool looking gear amirite?! Plus with the Iceborne expansion coming later this year it is a good time to get into this game.Happy Hunting!!!

review: Firstly most of these reviews the majority of the ones that are bad are about Server issues between the Steam Servers and Capcom. Both of them are working on it already so they'll be fixed soon( tm) most likely.This is not my first Monster Hunter game. My first was Monster Hunter Freedom Unite for the PSP.Of course you can't exactly compare Monster Hunter World and Freedom Unite but what I liked here in World better then Freedom Unite is that World is definitly easier to understand and play (Thanks to way shorter loading screens).The wait on the PC port for this game was definitly worth it in my mind even if there are a few connection Issues.Many also don't understand that this game has a offline mode you don't HAVE to play online (even if it is more fun with friends). Some people (people like me) don't even have that many connection Issues maybe a few times every 2 3 hours but that's it.The Story behind the game is somewhat boring not really worth noticing. After all most of this games fun is based on hunting Monsters and making equipment out of their parts.The PC Version of this game is at the same Version of the PS4 when it was released. That is to say the 1.0 Monster like Deviljho Behemoth (from the FFXIV Crossover) etc. haven't been included yet.I run a GTX 1060 2 Monitors have only had 2 3 crashes on 'high' settings with a few 2 second freezes here and there if I tab out of the game while hunting.TLDR this game is definitly worth getting even if there are a few problems.

review: Very detailed and requires a high ceiling of skill. With 14 weapons and even more monsters you will have lots of things to master but the in game mechanisms to teach you those skills are lacking and you are forced to seek the information from outside sources if you are new to the franchise. The habitats and monsters are well planned and executed. They exist and interact with or without you just as real nature does. While some monsters ignore your presence others will get angry at the mere sight of you.Get ready to be frustrated as you faint but get rewarded when you finallly down that tough beast. Happy hunting.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: Monster Hunter is a franchise that I was initially hesitant about getting into. Originally I also had never really formulated a solid opinion about the series considering how much talk I've heard about it from friends and online discussions. Last year I bit the bullet and gave the franchise a shot by getting Monster Hunter 4 Ultimate just to get a taste of what was to come. Played it extensively found that I loved it and eventually wanted to get into World.World is a fantastic experience for a newly introduced player like myself. It greatly refines the Monster Hunter formula by cutting out bulky concepts found in the previous games while strengthening mechanics with numerous quality of life improvements across the board. If you're a visual learner like myself this game lays out almost everything in front of you and it becomes fast to pick up and learn new habits. With an awesome gameplay loop and 14 customizable powerful weapons to fit your playstyle this game is rewarding for both newcomers and long time experienced veterans. Thanks to World I think I'll be sticking with the Monster Hunter franchise for a long time.

review: Do I recommend this game? Yes. For what it is.. the game ultimately does what it sets out to do. I got about 100 hours out of the game before I uninstalled however only about half of that was prior to the horrible end game grind.Pros Beautiful Graphics. Interesting engaging and dynamic monster fights. Co Op with up to 3 friends. Controller AND M+K support.Cons Repetitive fights. Only around 30 Monsters from beginning to end. Certain monster fights feel like reskins of other fights. The Co op play is not very intuitive feels very clunky. Weapons don't feel or look very unique to their numerous counterparts of the same type. Overall this is their first attempt at doing a PC port for the Monster Hunter franchise.. and it definitely feels like it too. So take that as you may. For beginners or long time fans of the series this game does a decent job of engaging everyone once you get past the pretty steep initial learning curve.Would recommend but not for $60. Catch it on a Steam sale.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: This game is incredible particularly if you like travelling to strange exotic lands meeting strange exotic monsters and killing them.Seriously the game consists of a cycle of moving to a new land full of strange flora and fauna fighting through increasingly big and angry monsters turning their teeth and claws into weapons and armour climbing to the top of the food chain and then moving to a new area to do it all again. And what a series of beasts it is terrifying dragons which poison you with their claws before they light you on fire lizards who swallow dinosaurs whole and bloat up to gigantic size scaly flying squirrels that crackle with lightning. Quite an array of monsters and that s just the very first area a lush forest surrounding a gigantic tree which you slowly work your way up until you fight the huge dragon in the nest at the top. Good thing you can team up with up to four other hunters to tackle these beasts or you can tackle the challenge of fighting them alone (though you always have an SOS flare if you bite off more than you can chew!).The exotic locales your hunter travels to only get better as the game progresses as you see the majestic Coral Highlands and the fetid and grim Rotten Vale (filled with the dead and decaying remains of the beasts you ve fought thus far). I ll hold off on describing more of the regions you ll traverse and the monsters you fight because I promise you ll want to explore and research them for yourself. You ll get the chance to learn 14 different weapons each suiting a different playstyle allowing you to smash horns off with colossal hammers fill the enemy with explosive lead with gigantic bowguns and slice clean through tails with a range of swords. Again I won t even go into detail on the more complex weapons and techniques but I highly recommend the Official Monster Hunter World weapon overview playlist on their YouTube channel if you think the game sounds interesting. https //www.youtube.com/playlist?list PL7z ZXbhfoKH0VlmoMX1Q5Wwk1cNRvrUV If none of this is catching your fancy the game s not for you. There s not much more to the game than fighting the variety of monstrosities and using their parts to make weapons and armour to fight even bigger beasts. If that s not your thing then move along. But for those of you who think all that sounds fun then be ready for hundreds of hours of beast slaying.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: Buy it play it enjoy it.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: Tldr at the bottom.After playing this for a while now I have fallen in love with it the breathtaking graphics (which I am greatfull for the hardware I have to see it in the first place) and the storytelling for the "main" story line was incredible.The item design was great at some fronts (wyvern ignition) but I noticed some items had repeated textures (kadachi claws 1 2 3).The AI was ok but sometimes were wonky and sometimes things look quite weird (kirin running to a ledge but not going off yes i know it should be that way but it just looks jank ) (up a ledge down a ledge repeat) but most of the time it was ok.Difficulty was challenging but not hard it really tested every skill i had (ahem tempered kirin) but I would want more things to be doable solo (I know you can do most of everything solo but some are just tedious no remorse no surrender or just downright impossible slay behemoth i got to final phase as time ran out ).But the difficulty choices in my opinion was quite properly done to truly test every fiber of the player on certain quests but maybe a tad bit of balancing would be better in my opinion(this is coming from a dark souls player) as most of the harder quests have been just me evading and at the end timing out.The lurning curve is more of a learning slope really learing how mounting and KO damage and their diminishing returns worked what all the slinger ammos did learning what the weapon elements effects(elderseal) and ailments actually do weak points breaking and severing parts untold moves or features in the moves (demon mode preventing knockback) (slinger torches clearing poison gas in the rotten vale) and much more but it was satisfying to say the least after conquering said slope.The tutorials did help but there is little to no incentive to look into the hunting guide as it's not giving too much for you to work with (maybe add moster habits like nergigante's spikes growing and blacking and him doing the dive when all of them are black and it reseting after said dive. I know you'll say "Oh but you should have realised it at that point." but it's nice to get a refresher here and there and some things I don't even realise like lavisioth with its hardening lava which gives him armor which if you need to reheat once in a while to be able to easily hit it. at research level 4 5 or 6 would love it).Recommendation get the npcs (excitable a lister hunstman) to help you out in SOME NOT ALL solo runs (they don't even have to be insanely great but at least get another more "reliable" source of damage or bait but for important attacks like behemoth's comets to always target the player) but remove them when going multiplayer to help with some of the more tedious quests as you palico can't really replace another player.If you could in any way lower the price it would be great as the hefty price is deterring some people from buying it and since this game wants to promote multiplayer as a core feature playing with more of my friends would be better than just those who actually can afford it.SOS or randoms is not an excuse though as most people who jump into SOS don't communicate as much as you expect and can wreck games your own or others (sorry for those who I have wrecked yours).And last but not least connection issues sometimes I'm helping someone in an SOS and then we do well but suddenly dun dun dun my internet decides to cut out and I die a horrible death and fail the quest for my team or it's them not everyone has insane internet speeds and if they die and later cut connection soon after or right before their death don't count it it's not their fault and if everyone leaves or you leave the quest due to connection loss reset the difficulty please I don't know how many times I have cut out from a behemoth quest died on their screen and had to face a multiplayer behemoth ALONE.So in conclusion if you want great graphics storytelling rpg elements a really well done learing curve and memes here and there and don't mind putting up with wonky AI meh randoms slightly off difficulty mechanics the inevitable materials/gem grind and getting beaten into a pulp once in a while then Monster Hunter World is the game for you.

review: As it's usually said Monster Hunter World is definitely the most accessible game in the series so far. I'm impressed with this iteration of Monster Hunter as it keeps a lot of the personality of previous Monster Hunter games. The story is pretty standard but the point of MH games are the combat and crafting not necessarily the story. The end game leaves a little to be desired as it revolves heavily around RNG versus games previous in the series.However the progression through the game is well paced. If the game starts to get stale you can always switch weapons and learn everything over again. Weapons have received numerous updates compared to older games and the controls are very fluid. The new monster designs are great and the soundtrack is amazing.In short if you like Monster Hunter pick up this game.

review: After waiting for so long for a proper Monster Hunter Game since they moved the title to nintendo the last MH game i played was the one for the PSP I have been truly looking forward to this game. And now a year after launch and 500+hrs in i think i can safely give my honest review of it.First the bad It has a rocky start with so much issues with regards to optimizing and tweaking your setup for it to run without chugging. Given my rig isn't the best BUT i have been able to run it without looking like a potato. Server issues and disconnects for some reason it is back the disconnects but not as often but often enough that you can get bummed out by it. If you don't like grinding and somewhat repetitive routines (not sure if this is a bad or good i guess this wholly depends on what you want in your games for me i like i like MH mechanics oddly enough it's a grindy game but for some reason i enjoy it more than say Diablo 3 which is also grindy with a bit of RNG)With that out of the way now the GOOD bits It's a breathing living world complete with weather cycles interactive environments verticality flora and fauna. It is hands down gorgeous (and i'm not even running it in Max settings! cause my rig is a semi potato any more than medium settings chugs my frame rate) so much quality of life updates from what i was used to compared to old monster hunter games (things just feels way more streamlines here in MHW) Gratifying combat and the feeling of pride and accomplishment once you've been able to best that beast in combat and carved out it's entrails for parts. Constant free content and support for the game! Cool looking armos and weapons and layered duds so you can play dress upFinal thoughts If you like killing monsters if you like collecting parts repeatedly without feeling the grind. Then this is a game for you and if you are a returning Monster Hunter player you'd be very pleased to find so much quality of life changes have made this such a fluid game. Given it still cannot match the number of monster variety to other titles of the same game but it is still one of the best Monster Hunting Game out there right now at least in my opinion. Better than say Dauntless (i tried it it and it was okay but just didn't stick with me i just felt something was missing in that game) and so did God Eater it was a good game but it also didn't scratch that itch i had for monster hunting.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: As my first foray into Monster Hunter this has been a really positive experience. Here are a few pros and cons off the top of my head.Pros Excellent graphics. The game simply looks beautiful. The lighting is exceptional and there are few graphical issues other than a few small bugs that are settings related. Great gameplay. The combat while a little clunky feeling and hostile at first it really shines when you get better. Once you dedicate yourself to learning the proper tactics and anticipation it becomes quite satisfying to take out some of the monsters you initally struggled with at first Progression is tied to your gear. No level ups or perks to buy. Your gear decides the effectiveness of your build. Finally the tracking of monsters is well done. Rewarding hunts. There is a Dark Souls level of satisfaction in killing a very difficult monster and some of the monsters take a heck of a beating Cons Lack of direction. Sometimes the game just sort of leaves you high and dry without any sort of clue what to do next. Theres a few places I think they could put a tutorial in and just smooth the learning experience out or offer a better explanaition of the mechanics. Loss of control. I don't mind mechanics that punish you by restricting you but totally removing you from the driver's seat is a bit much. I feel the stun and roar mechanics could use some work. I am far less annoyed by the stun mechanic though. If you don't get hit you should be fine but the roar mechanic to me is too much. Monsters roar constantly and most of them completely freeze your character up. This in the middle of a fight can leave you totally open to attacks and gets you killed. The method to prevent this is poor in my opinion. The earplugs skill is really dumb as a stand alone skill and needs to be buffed or made a passive piece of all armor sets. Like make it so that having a full helm adds levels of it or make a berry like consumable that keeps roaring from affecting you. But as it stands I think the mechanic is a little unfair. Specs are a little much IMO. I feel that it could use a little optimization for lower power rigs.Overall this game is approaching masterpiece level to me. It is a GOTY level game. The game shows the passion of the developers through all the quirks and the character it shows. This game if it ironed out a few things could be a perfect 10 but that said it will still pull 100s of hours out of your playing time with little effort.9.5/10

For me its a good thing since most of my friends now play the game and were slightly turned off from the previous titles. Extremely fun solo or multi play. Controls in PC are ok. You'll get used to it. Graphics are great especially on max settings.Cons The extremely frustrating disconnection issues are getting somewhat out of hand. I've been getting disconnected with online hunts and its ING annoying. FIX! THIS! Imagine being 8 mins in a Arch Tempered Hunt and boom you just got disconnected from your friends! Not that much variety in the weapons. Some look the same. Oh well. Hopefully the upcoming IceBorne content will make things better. Variety wise.So there! Youll love this game. But be prepared to get extremely frustrated with the disconnection issues.

review: I am really enjoying the game so far I recommend playing it for sure. But my review will be negative until they add some PC features quality of life things to the game. They had almost 1 year to make a PC version as promised not bring us a console port missing PC game features and QOL.+ Graphics are good about 8/10 looks very nice but nothing mind blowing.+ Performance early on is great very smooth on my GTX 1080 as it should be+ Nice character creation system + My controller works fine (I regiustered it in big picture before playing to be sure)+ Loads of monsters &amp weapons (compares to Dauntless the F2P PC MH game) UI design is console style they didn't update it for PC Hitboxes &amp monster AI along with crispness of rolls/hits are inferior to Dauntless The voice acting does not match the mouth movement with what they say No 21 9 support (Really bad since I have a 34" Gaming monitor that uses this) Mouse controls are terrible (bad PC port instead of real mouse control) Inability to change settings such as motion blur and other PC basics in the settings I get a long black screen at launch of the game that lasted about 2 5 mins(game is on SSD) so its some kind of bug happens all the time.I am only at the beginning of this game but it plays smoothly and looks nice but they left many things "console style" and I will not give this game a positive rating until it has 21 9 support I did not wait 8 months for them to leave out PC features like this.UPDATE 2019 They just added 21 9 support so I can finally play the game in full screen no black bars they updated many other things to improve the game as well. They keep adding new events for free so the game continues to be very fun to play. However I still run into problems where the controller disconnects in this game and other things due to the quality of the port from console. It is always improving though and that is all you can ask. Great game overall!

review: Recommendation with a caveat this is a great pick for playing with other people. If you wanna go stabby stabby on giant monsters solo it works but I would give Dragon's Dogma a try first.The game is great at the start when it keeps giving you new monsters and areas to learn. But do keep in mind that gradually almost without you realizing it it starts to push harder and harder towards repeating the same hunts in ever increasing numbers for ever decreasing percentual chances of drops. And tying into my mention of other people it will also gradually shift more and more into content designed from the ground up to be tackled by a team.Or you could just goof around at your leisure and mod the game as you want and do whatever. There are unofficial mods for just about anything from quality of life improvements to cosmetics to rebalance grind reducing and of course a lot that could be called cheats.So you can personalize the experience. Which goes a long way.

review: I love this game to death but a game requires a feeling of progression. Grinding the same quest literally hundreds of times trying for a random chance to get a weapon or skill you want isn't fun or challenging or rewarding. It's just dumb. I need to feel like I'm actually progressing towards what I want it can't just be a completely random chance. It wouldn't even be such a problem if the odds weren't so astronomically stacked against you. If I played the quest over a hundred times and I was actually closer to getting the item I want that would be one thing. But taking away any form of progression takes the fun out. It makes your time playing feel utterly pointless.

review: I got this game since day 1 and it was badly optimized on release. However Capcom has made the game now very good. It should've been like this from the very start but it's very undeniable this game is far from what it was on launch on PC. In short Optimization is now better. At launch my PC could not run past 30 frames for its life but now I can get 40+ frames consistently. PC controls got better significantly. There's still the bad menu controls but camera controls are so much better since you are given the option to basically use the mouse as a MOUSE and NOT as a controller stick. Alt+Tabbing doesn't make the game crash anymore fortunately but it does disconnect you from being online. It's not as bad as the game crashing fortunately but getting disconnected mid hunt can sting a bit especially when the rewards (specifically currency) are divided between all hunters a part of the hunt. The three main problems that really killed this game for me on launch were mostly fixed out of the game essentially and now I can enjoy the game much more to the point where I would change my review to recommend the game. Right now it can only get better and hopefully no stupid decisions are made but I doubt it.

title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: As someone who has always had his eyes on the Monster Hunter series but hasn't gotten around to playing it due to it being available only on Nintendo consoles and being too lazy to actually go and buy it this game has really been a blast for me so far though I sadly haven't played it as much as I've wanted to by far.There have been a few situations here and there where I felt it was a little wonky of an experience but that was as far as I can remember at least mostly just due to me not being used to the series's style of gameplay yet.I might update this review now and then with more insights as I go.Combat In this regard the game is overall really well done. You have a very complex combat system with many weapons and each of them with a good amount of skill sets some of which you need to "unlock" during combat (like the Kinsect where you need to have your insect gather the red white and orange upgrades by hitting certain monster parts for optimal buffs and upgraded attack animations for a set time period). If played right the combat is also very fluid which is very important for a game like MHW.One thing I dislike so far is that when in a combo it doesnt seem to respond to slight directional input as well though this could possibly just be due to me not having figured it out completely yet.Audio Here too I think they did a pretty good job. The background audio is nice to listen to and so far I don't think I've encountered any issues at all.Multiplayer This is one point where I'm generally happy as you can create your lobby with preferences and choose to be with beginners like myself or veterans (this is of course based on players' input). You have a good few settings to configure what type of player is most likely to join and other options like kicking sending friend requests ("Guild Cards") and so on.Now one big part I don't like is that there are connecitivity issues here and there namely getting an error when trying to join friends' sessions (here I found that just trying several times and alternating between friends on the list if they're in the same lobby can help) some desync thanksfully rarely so far and a few others that I can't remember at the time of writing this.Bugs and Issues One thing I really hate is when tabbing out to respond to a message and tabbing back in only to see certain inputs not working anymore (in my case the Y button on my controller for combat while still working in menus) and having to restart the game for it to work again.(Opening the Steam ingame overlay before tabbing out seems to remedy this issue.) A friend randomly had all combat input not work anymore randomly for a little while on a mission but it started working again a few minutes after.All in all I really like the game and would definitely recommend it to anyone interested but I hope they improve the game in these regards.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: This is the best MonsterHunter made so far. It has added innovations my friends and I have wanted since the first game. Pros1. Amazing graphics even if you run on low settings it is still better than any monster hunter that the US has gotten so far. 2. Weapons all feel satisfying and I recommend people try at least their 3 favorites as they play the game. 3. The enviroments feel real with the monster interactions.Cons1. Initial release ruined the game for a few people. The game was not released optomized but this is no longer an issue. 2. Could have more monster but I would be willing to pay up to 20 for 5 or more monsters in a pack (with their weapons and armor). Sounds bad but there is enough content for a full game here already I just want more.Update As of Dec/4/2018 this game gets a thumbs down. I keep gettinig error 5098f mw1 when I join a session. I wanted to say this is one of the best game but I can no longer say it with confidence. If capcom can fix this issue I will give it a thumbs up. But until that happens I cannot recommend this game.Update Jan/30/2019 Changed back to thumbs up. The game is fantastic and issues with playing with friends have been corrected. To be clear the issue was fixed with an update. It was never an issue on my end.

review: This is my first Monster Hunter experience I've been missing out! It's a great game played solo or with others. The environments are well done and enjoyable to travel through. review: Monster Hunter is a special genre for gamers who like grinding for better weapons and armour sets. Monster Hunter World does a good job in terms of quality of life features. Although not everyone like the new mechanics (f.e. bugs instead of colour balls the new mantles etc.). I would call myself a Monster Hunter veteran. I played since MH3U through MH4U MHG/U and now MHW. Every game of these until end game content for over hundreds of hours.After a few hours I loved the mechanics and features of MHW. Some more some less. I played for about 300h on PS4. Nevertheless I hope some features of the old games find their way to World. F.e. playing as a palico store palicos with different skills and features hunter styles etc.What I really missed was the 21 9 support which was one of the main reasons to stay on PlayStation 4. The other reason was the delayed release of extra content like Kulve Taroth and the Arch Tempered Elder Dragons. Although the delay could not caught up I bought the PC Version because mods are supported the performance is slightly better and 21 9 support is now included since today!

review: Give it time. This one is a slow burner. But if you do enjoy the tough rewarding and very steep learning curve then you will greatly enjoy the previous games. From a gameplay perspective MHW is the easiest and most accessible game in the MH franchise. I would strongly recommend going back to play gems like MH4u and MHFu if you enjoy this game. But most importantly don't give up after 5 hours!! This game takes a good 20+ hours to start getting in to. But it is so rewarding when you do.

review: First JRPG I've ever played and it was a lot better than I would have gave it credit for. Different weapons with different play styles for each different kind of player (Ranged dps support heavy strikes quick jabs etc) to keep you interested in the game. Once you master one weapon try others! While its fun to play with friends its also incredibly rewarding to hunt difficult monsters by yourself too and while it might be difficult its not impossible. Great game if you like challenging gameplay that rewards skill and methodical tactics.

review: I have played some of MH Games like MH3 MH4U MHGen and this one is impressive. review: A boss fighting game like any other were you punch a brick for hours and if you ever miss a dodge you die. How this game is unique is you have a set amount of time to kill the boss preventing you from playing smart and waiting for opportunities and forcing you to constantly run towards and enemy that more than likely has an attack up its sleeve that can kill you in one hit. 90% of the time the boss can fly so it uses this ability to waste your time the only way to counter flying is with a limited amount (3) consumables that force it to land for 2 seconds each. Like other boss fighting games you will find that the monsters only take damage to one area but unlike other boss games I have played you use Japanese anime weapons that are ridiculously large so you will swing for the neck hit the wing with a downward strike reflect off and be stunned for a few seconds. After doing damage to the boss it will run away from you to the opposite corner of the map forcing you to chase it and waste more time. That is the game rinse and repeat there is a story in the back ground but all the characters have a distinct Japanese feel to me that means over the top and insanely annoying. The entire premise of the game is you are part of a group of monster hunters when you are at base there are people around but they never help you in fights. Even if the story tells you that this dragon is like a god and you are going to need all the help and luck you can get. When you get back to base they don t even treat you like you are the only one doing anything they act like they all contribute to the cause. This isn t really unique to monster hunter but I think it bothers me more in this game because these people have been on the continent for like 40 years or something and no one accomplished anything till you showed up. In the end the game feels supper mediocre to me but the games has sold enough copies that I m sure they will make more pc monster hunter games in the future the only question is if they will be willing to change the formula much. In the end I bought this game to play with a friend and after you leave normal skill quests in this game you kinda are forced to play the game with others because otherwise the game just isn t fun.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: One of my favorite series of all time I've sunken nearly 300 hours into the game between console and PC. Pros Numerous quality of life changes make this the most accessible entry in the series The ecosystems and the monsters that inhabit them feel more lifelike and robust than ever before Loads of free DLC in the form of free content updatesCons Multiplayer/matchmaking systems are unnecessarily complicated and frustrating until you adjust to them Compared to previous entries in the series the weapons aren't nearly as diverse in appearance PC version of the game still is synchronized with consoles with regards to the content updates
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: If you are a fan of the franchise you already know what this game is about. I wasn't till this one so I will write my review as a person who have played a Monster Hunter game for the first time.TL DR If you are an MMORPG lover who also enjoy raids with friends or grinding and leveling up your character and kill endless bosses and mobs alone this game is for you (I highly recommend playing multiplayer though) The game basically is boss fight after boss fight in every quest enemy variations are great and combat mechanics are not simple to learn yet not impossible and you'll definitely have fun while doing so. Though I'd say don't expect a mind blowing story cause you won't find it in this game the game is not about the story anyways. It's about hunting monsters and it does what it supposed to do very well.Graphics are good but I should warn you though you definitely need a good PC otherwise you won't get a good framerate or you'll end up playing the game with potato graphics cause even though the graphics are great and smooth in most occasions it's not really that succesfully optimized for older systems so even medium graphic settings looks very bad.Audio is nice and fitting soundtrack does work very well with the game which is all I need from a game soundtrack anyways. (Though when a game has a soundtrack that can be considered a masterpiece I never complain obviously)I played it with both controller and keyboard and since this game heavily depends on weapon (of your choice there is a good weapon selection in game which is a plus) combos I'd say it's way better and comfortable with a controller. But that doesn't necessarily mean that it was badly optimized for keyboard users it's doable. It's up to your preferences I guess.And last of all grinding is a real thing in this game you'll end up grinding for supplies killing endless amount of monsters and if you find grinding in games intolerable you'd end up hating this be aware of this before you buy it.TL DR ended ) Over all I really enjoy this game it's challenging it's fun and it's well worth it's price.

review: This game is finally in a good enough place where I can recommend it.At launch the game was kind of a mess. Multiplayer didn't work FPS was just awful (Mostly Nvidias fault for their crap driver) and the camera controls sucked for mouse. This has all been MOSTLY fixed. Multiplayer seems to work perfectly fine now Nvidia has fixed their driver and now FPS is mostly fine (Should honestly be better than it is though) and the camera has finally been fixed so it isn't super delayed.The game is really good. It's a lot of fun to kill monsters with people or just yourself and your palico. If you do end up picking this up I'd recommend downloading and installing the mod "Special K" to help out with your FPS. I'm not sure if you can be banned for using it but honestly it gives absolutely no advantage gameplay wise so I doubt they would ban anyone for it. The only thing it does is disable some CPU thing that bogs down performance that isn't needed. With this mod I can play at 60 in most places. Again though no idea if this is bannable.Link to Special K https //steamcommunity.com/app/582010/discussions/3/1745594817439431537/

review: I first got in contact with the Monster Hunter Series 10 years ago when Monster Hunter Tri was released for the Nintendo Wii. To this day Monster Hunter Tri remains my all time favourite game for the Wii. The atmosphere the gameplay the looks everything was done just right. Unfortunately Capcom decided to shut down the online service a long time ago. So I didn't play MH for a long time aswell. Then Monster Hunter World came out. I gotta say nostalgia hit me a bit... I really love MHW. It does everything MHTri did for me and even more. I don't understand the negative reviews concerned with optimization problems. It runs super smooth (I recommend the use of a controller tho). Super Great Game 10/10

review: Game of the year for me and only getting better. The mixed reviews are from the initial launch which had a lot of graphical/bug problems that have long since been fixed. And now with Iceborne coming out this could shape up to be the greatest entry in the series history. Have bought the game twice now and have put over 300 hours in and I am still having a blast. That said you have to enjoy the grind once you get past 50 hours but if you like the game then grinding isnt a chore. Make sure to change up your weapon type (14 of them!!) once in a while to keep the game feeling fresh. Also if someone puts the monster to sleep dont wake it up it put bombs in its face please I beg you.

review: Love it..... this game will suck your time away.... if you were a veteran player from other monster hunter game.... youll love it and also miss a few things from previous games... if your new to monster hunter... this version is easier especially for new players... play with friends..... going random with others is weird... but its welcome.... send sos people do help.... most of the time you play alone send SOS and some random high ranks show up and cheese the whole thing for you... so you better return the favor to others when your high rank yourself... want to see some kaiju battles? yes there is... and it is glorious to watch them fight...... Dkill monsters and carve them up for parts to craft new armors and weapons with... well that is lit af... hunt with friends? yes please!! all the high jinks and fun or making fun of friends you play with while hunting is the best feeling!!!having a hard time hunting a certain monster? send SOS high ranks do help a lot.... join a random just to die 3 times and ruin their hunt? please dont... unless its your friend that you just wanna screw with...LOLwheres the PVP you ask? it comes after you kill a giant monster..... pvp all you want LOL...this game is PVE god... theres nothing more satisfying than defeating a monster as large as mountains...and yes they do exist... lol.... wait? you old school and miss dino crisis? well capcom is here and we have monster hunter.... come join... still not convince? you have a pet cat you can dress up and also fights alongside you.... you also have a waifu.... your partner... come on dude free waifu.... multiple types of weapons... ranging from bows.. light bow guns... heavy bowguns.. long swords... heavy swords.. sword and shields.. dual blades... spear and shields.... gun spear and shield... giant flute club.... wait what? yes we have those... spear and bug? whaaatt? yes... and they are awesome.... and transformers weapons.. some that optimus or megatron uses.. like sword and shield that turns into an axe? yes please.... or an axe that turns into a freaking blade? really now.... haha D awesome.... i like this game.... 8.9/10 why not 10/10? because perfection is the end of innovation... and i want to see more added to this game... forgot to tell you theres a lot of farming here.... what i mean is picking up grasses flowers and stuff.. digging for rocks and bones... haha D lets play... see you soon...
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

I have refunded the game but I will be watching the updates closely. EDITTHEY FIXED ALL THE ISSUES AND IT'S GREAT NOW!!!

review: Sick game. Many people sadly don't understand that everything is about knowledge of fights your weapons your combos and your timing which make them call it a &amp quot game". That being said those plebs just have to git gud.The game is very fluid in combat and also it looks really good as a bonus everyone I know that has played this game is astounded by some of the monster mechanics because they were not prepared for the advanced nature of them. Some people have had framerate issues but everything has worked flawlessly for me so I can't comment on that part. In the last 200 hours I have gotten disconnected twice from a multiplayer session which can happen in any game and instead I will just finish the missions by myself so no harm done happens. Also in my total playtime I have crashed once the rest has been flawless.The m/kb controls weren't the best at launch but now it all seems to be fixed (still can't rebind exactly as I would like to but it works). For my part I play with a controller because that's how I played through the Dark Souls franchise so anything other than that just felt wrong for me.Have fun dying.

review: I highly recommend this game to old returning players and new players to the Monster hunter series.Pros Large variety of play styles due to the various weapons Beautiful world very large instance that you can consider it an open world. Very addictive be it collecting resources and acquiring new weapons.Cons Some parts of the story aren't explained well e.g. finding a certain amount of monster tracks Can be RNG Grindy (Generally the grind is good creates a real sense of progress) however some items have a relatively low carve rate. Very easy to accidently delete your save file on title screen literally 2 taps and its gone.My verdict A must buy if you have a decent PC set up! 9/10.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: Audio doesn't work. I have to keep reading the dialogue as sometimes the character's audio just cuts out eventhough the BGM is still on. KB+M controls are terrible. It is 2018 the game costs 60 bucks and they can't be arsed to fix the flipping controls on the platform they are selling on?Also you gotta pay more for stuff like gestures and what not feels like a scam.This could be a great game but for the devil in the details. If this were some indie game worth 15 20 bucks I would not care. But for a game this big I expected a better complete experience. Last time I am pre ordering a game. They fixed most of the bugs. Takes some time to get used to the controls and they added a helluva lot of content over time. So worth it. Grind is real though. Also no hope of hunting some Monsters as a casual solo player (AT Pony AT Farty McFartFace Buffalo Temp Pickle AT Toaster).
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: So I had to take back my intial review. I thought it was a bug my hammer kept charging and swinging on its own....my controller had a broken trigger (So after I realized what was happening I gave it another shot. Much better experience. Whats my biggest gripe? 2 days after I rebought the game it goes on sale. Pros fun simple gameplay but with some mechanics that get challenging. Crafting and customization is rather in depth. Monsters are genuinely interesting. Weapons (like my favortie hammer) are hilariously oversized. Solid job on the atmosphere and eco systems. Lotta herbivores and small animals and just predators and monsters everywhere. Cons godawful acting and writing in these games but I expect it at this point. Graphics seem subpar to me. You really will be googleing a lot of 'wtf does this do?"Somewhat steep learning curve (things start to make sense but theyre not introduced in a meaningful way that lets you reinforce what you learn...watching a 10s tutorial video doesnt do it)Overall Im enjoying it now I can actually play. On a 1 10 1 being terribad and 10 being absolute perfection Im going solid 7Voice acting is about what you expect from a Capcom game. Bad
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: Monster Hunter World is a great game and a masterful first crack at the Western market on Capcom's behalf. Sure there's a bit of a steep learning curve with the combat mechanics and maybe some of the design choices could be considered a bit idiosyncratic or redundant (looking at you Gathering Hub) but the sheer amount of fun and satisfaction you get while hunting monsters overshadows all of its flaws. Each of the 14 weapon types have their own unique playstyle every monster has its own cool mechanics and behaviors and every armor set has an interesting (if not a little over the top) aesthetic. If you want to pick up a game that doesn't treat you with kid gloves the entire time then Monster Hunter World might be for you.

review: This was my first Monster Hunter experience and I had a great time.Beware the game can be a bit challeging at first but nothing a bit of practice cant solve.This game has the perfect formula to keep you playing over and over despite fighting the same monsters. Lots of weapons to pick different biomes fighting against multiple monsters and many other variables will make every hunt a new experience.Monster Hunter has a fame on its own and if you dont know why you should try this game.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: Monster Hunter World is the first monster hunter game I have ever played and i honestly enjoyed it. sure some people who have played some of the other games would surely say "the old ones are better!" and i totally respect that. now first off monster hunter world is great for newcomers to the series like myself and i will definitely be playing future games for i love this game very much. every monster is each their own challenge and i thoroughly enjoyed fighting each. monster hunter games have always been a grindy game. for example if you wanted to get a set it may take a couple of hours to grind to get even one set piece. MHW will take patience time and a determined mindset. there are many side quests to do if you are bored wanting that last piece of your set or just wanting to play with friends. there are also many events crossovers with other games and even DLC coming out soon. multiplayer is okay some of the time but you will crash a lot. overall its a good game i would suggest to anyone looking for a game to play for hours or looking to sever some tails.

review: If you've ever played a Monster Hunter game you understand what you're getting into.The difference being this is the most immersive addition to the franchise. Especially when played on a proper or overpowered PC with a curved monitor and surround sound headphones. I swear on the $5 to my name if anyone plays this game for the first time with half of what I mentioned they will have a lot of fun and thrilling fights for quite a few hours.Currently for PC there's enough content for at least 150 250 hours of game play before the game feels even a little stale. (depending on how much you grind)Then what keeps the fire going is the fact that new content is being released consistently so it's beyond a solid game now.Additionally there are plenty of fun fighting events to collect special gear from other games like Devil May Cry Megaman and Final Fantasy. So thats a huge bonus in my book nothing else quite like hunting a dragon with my moogle. Hunting 101 tip#1 always be prepared for the area and enemy that which you are engaging for the hunt research various ways to make the prep cycle fast! like setting loadouts for items and gear. Peace and good luck on the hunt!

review: Monster Hunter World is a good game. With a lively environment beatiful graphics and intense fights. But enough of the "pros" let me hit you with what most potential buyers are looking for in reviews the flaws of a masterpiece.To put it plainly Lots of grind (if its not ur cup of tea then you probably won't enjoy farming the recquired materials for high level gear) Story is boring (nothing surprising heartwarming or tearjerking just a girl screaming at you to try and dodge monster attacks when you've already soaked in 50 hrs into fighting living breathing killing machines) You can get tired of the end game (although there is going to be more stuff to be added once you've reached around HR 100 or even less you can get tired since most likely you've seen it all.) Bazelguese (find out about it yourself)With all that being said do still buy the game but keep these points in the back of your head while doing so.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: This is my first game of the Monster Hunter series and I'm very impressed.I was surprised at first by the many weapon choices and complex combos and the game mechanics that make the game pretty difficult no monster hp bars + character attacks in the direction it's facing regardless of camera direction and target locking + monster stuns may put you in a position where you cannot avoid their next attack.Despite all those things and maybe even because of them the game is super fun and captivating. A huge amount of different monsters one more challenging than the next a good main story and so many mini activities that you sometimes lose yourself in the world of monster hunting.Incredibly grindy tho you have been warned!

review: 10/10This game is an absolute example of grinding and hating yourself. If you are a anti social like me you will realize that Dark Souls Bosses are way easier than some of this game monsters. Prepare to hate yourself for fainting in the same corner 3 times in a row by a monster that keeps repeating the same attack. Prepare to heal and be hit by the monster with twice the life you healed as damage.Prepare to scream and cry and do lower level monsters to be able to forge and upgrade an armor set just to have a chance with the monster that keeps kicking your butt. It's really hard to play solo not impossible tho. They should have let you see other players on the map so you can ask for help not just in one area of it because nobody goes there. You can send an S.O.S. flare so other players can join you if a monster is too hard but be prepared because nobody will come in your help. At least nobody came in mine.

review: Let's ignore the issues that set this release apart from the consoles for a second and focus on the meat the game. Instead of bite sized areas we have open lanscapes that support a believable ecosystem. Gathering points are much easier to gather from but are more spread out waiting times between areas are gone but you have to run much further between zones. Not to mention there's always scoutflies up and ready to insult your intelligence though it definitely helps on the cluster that is the Ancient Forest. Monsters treat every zone as territory leading to conflicts that are fun to watch at first. Later (especially when Bezelgeuse starts constantly invading quests) turf wars become incredbly annoying and dangerous halting combat combat being what really makes the game shine. Unfortunately it seems like a lot of the changes in MHW come at a compromise. It's good to see that they took the combat improvements from 4U and added even more mechanics though. Anyways the open world doesn't really bother me more good than harm was done there. I can't recommend this game because it really wasn't all that fun. I feel like I put the time in just to complete it. This issue stems from the fact that the new monsters just aren't very interesting or fun to fight. I think they did a great job with the elder dragons especially Nergigante but when it comes to other additions I can't think of many monsters I want to fight again. There are a few exceptions Tobi Kadachi Bezelgeuse and Legiana are more involving and challenge your ability to dodge Odogaron feels like wasted potential though his attacks are too precise making them too easy to dodge he is a less interesting Tobi. Diablos and the Rath couple return but they're barely changed. The rest of the monsters are boring punching bags because they hardly pose a threat and/or are easy to evade. Once you have endgame gear this is even more daunting nothing besides elder dragons will challenge you.Edit Servers are still complete garbage
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: Product received for free. One of the best games I have played in 2018. The wealth of content is enough to keep me going for hours. It is a bit overwhelming at first with the menus and all the items you can take but after a while you start to get used it. The co op is the best part where the game allows you to queue up with up to 4 people on a single quest. Or you can go at it alone. It's honestly a lot more fun to play with if you have friends. I rarely run into connectivity issues and finding my friends lobbies is a breeze if you have half a brain. This game also gets free monthly updates where they have events that collaborate with other Capcom franchises such as Mega Man and Street Fighter. They also collaborated with Square Enix and CD Projekt Red to bring Final Fantasy and The Witcher into the game too! On top of all this there are harder versions of monsters that you can fight called arch tempered monsters which add another layer of replayability to the game along with new armor sets to beef up your character. I want to tell you more but to be honest it is something you have to experience for yourself. Trust me when I say that you will not disappointed in this game. Capcom if you are reading this thanks for the wonderful experience and hope you continue to impress me.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: Ok so far what i think about the game* Terrible UI and UX.* Story is meh and the handler made me so ing annoyed and cringe at the same time.* Connection errors are pretty moderate.* Unskippable cutscenes/credit.* Overall gameplay is hella good. * Best with a group of friends.* Customization is pretty much on almost on the same level as warframe theres a lot of stuff to get fashionwise and you can get it all by just playing the game as far as i know.* Monsters are super fun altho can be a but irritating at times when you realize hitboxes are really not forgiving* Great visual design.Even tho i have my gripes with the game it was well worth the money i spent on it
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

review: Monster Hunter World if you haven't guessed is the newest installment in the long running Monster Hunter series. Side note is Monster Hunter THAT popular in Japan that it's basically their Call of Duty except with less scumbag exploitation and more teeth grinding boss fights?Anyway if you've heard of the Monster Hunter games or even tried a few but maybe didn't take a shine to the combat for any variety of reasons (no momentum to the attacks made them feel pretty awful hit or miss and your character kept planting themselves in place to swing so you could get swiped) this is bound to be the game that wins you over. It certainly won my heart over the course of a week around Christmas I managed to clock over 40 hours on this game usually 10+ hours per sitting.The game has given major overhauls to many key systems to make them less irritating and more modern. For one you can actually move around during combat and make attacks at the same time giving you much more of a chance to dodge without making huge sacrifices to your damage output. The Sword and Shield and Dual Blades are the most mobile weapons in the game bar none and will allow you to dance around the monster taking potshots so I'd recommend those as your starters.Next items. There's a radial menu now that has 4 sub menus you can assign items and quick chat phrases to the slots for quick access in the midst of combat. (Though I will admit that I scroll using LB + B / X since it feels more precise) You can now move while using most items which can allow you to heal up while making a necessary retreat. Or better yet keep chasing the monster you're hunting while also refreshing your Demondrug and Armorskin buffs so that you're ready to fight when you corner it.Speaking of movement no more eight directional garbage. Omnidirectional movement with realistic momentum is in and it feels wonderful. Your character feels like they have mass and momentum when sprinting full tilt which can carry into your weapon swings for a sudden charge attack or help you to away from an agitated Rathalos that's none too happy about having his tail severed. You're going to be doing a LOT of running around in this game so you're going to learn very quickly whether the movement is up to your standards. If it is then it's a surprising joy just to run around and test out all the different ways to navigate the environments.Next level design. The levels are exquisitely designed mini sandboxes that have dynamic A.I. creatures roaming around and many hazards that can help you during your hunts. There are quite a few to explore and you'll likely be intimately familiar with them after playing for a while the Ancient Forest Wildspire Wastes Coral Highlands Rotten Vale and Elder's Recess. The Ancient Forest is well a massive multi level forest that teems with life around every corner and much of it is quite hostile. The Wildspire Wastes are sprawling deserts sharing space with a surprisingly lively swamp and multiple muddy oases. I'll let you discover the rest they're all visual and auditory treats with lots of wildlife to find and carve.What else? Probably worth mentioning that the game is very much a slow burn and requires quite a grind to get your weapons. While the materials might seem really easy to gather early on (some Iron Ore claws from slain Jagras so on) they start getting much rarer and much more of them will be required as you progress. Tier 8 weapons are especially nightmarish to build up to usually requiring at least one or two Gems (extremely rare drops that come in a wide variety many monsters have a unique Gem type) and tens of multiple materials to complete. Also plenty of dosh so be sure to farm money using your Bandit Mantle early on.Conclusion Monster Hunter World is a game that simply doesn't do quick gratification but when you get invested into the game you'll find that it's really hard to pull yourself away. You'll find yourself telling yourself that you'll stop playing after you hunt that Teostra that's been smearing you across the pavement and obtain that much coveted Gem. Before long it'll be 6 AM and you'll have crafted two Tier 8 weapons a new Tier 8 Charm and a brand new set of Tier 8 armor all while wondering where the hours went.It's a game I will sing the praises of despite the many flaws it has simply because the game is so absorbing that I forget what bothered me about it. Even when getting cheap shotted by Lunastra over and over I find myself getting vengeful which is a little bit different from mad or frustrating. See with the latter I start to consider Alt F4'ing the game and playing something else just to calm down. When a game makes me vengeful I'll cuss like a sailor and yell about how unfair it is in the moment but it makes me want to play MORE just to teach the game who's in charge.At $60 it's a bit of a tough sell (as any game is these days $60 is a major asking price) but even for just a 20 25% discount I would say give this Monster Hunter game a try. The game only gets better with friends so if you have pals playing it this is one of the best co op games ever made.
