review: After reading alot of reviews myself and as someone who bought the game on release and played the beta 70 times over all i have to say is that this game is good but you can see why many would dislike it. So lets go over a few things about it and see.QUESTS As someone who has made about 9 different characters and playthroughs and as someone who beat it back before there was a single guide up for the game all i can say is some quests are a pain that is no lie but this game requires alot of back tracking and reading and memory but even then you can screw a whole hour of quest chain up with simple things such as accidently not saving a NPC or killing one or even killing one too early who may of been able to give hints or not picking up a right item in an area.This can kill it for some people but for me it was interesting to see how every quests could be completed by simple dialogue trees or even having a item before the quest or even stuffing it up all together and just brute forcing through it. Do i think some quests are Yes. Do they drag a little bit sometimes? Yes. but thats the nature of a long read and walk about RPG.COMBAT Now this is one that people love to on do i think it can be balls? holy hell yes this combat can be either the easiest combat in world or the hardest most unfair combat in any game it most of the time comes down to build and you characters and companions some builds are better then others but it all comes down to Turn Based Enemy First Every Fight t this means every fight most enemies are allowed to go first and will always use most biggest hit moves possible to knock off your armour and magic resist leaving you to your 1 go and mercy of every enemy as they gang up on single targets for better effectiveness. But sometimes it aint all bad when ya get hang of it and do a fight 700 times ya start to feel good when ya do a well place set of moves during your turns and completely wipe floor using barely any poitons or scrolls.ARMOUR/MAGIC RESIST Now this is a mechanic i can see people hate cause i hated it to and still do in some cases because sometimes end game tanks can look like this YOU (2000 Armour) Enemy (4000 Armour) and take this if you hit a enemy you do maybe 300 500 damage per go while some enemies can deal 800 1000 depending on difficulty and level and this just isnt fun you spend the whole game getting gold and items only for it to mean jack most fights .STORY As someone who played OS1 and genuinely enjoyed every moment of it the story in this feels lack luster and very all over the place it retcons alot but it does add some neat twists maybe too many but if you only played OS1 you may really enjoy this story taken as a spin off or alt universe but i never played the other games bar OS1/OS2 but my best friend told me everything about the entire lore of every other game so i do understand alot in the game but can see why some fans would hate it.But all in all this game is worth a playthrough if you played OS1 and truely enjoyed it and if you hate turned based rpgs then give it a miss and if you hate long reading and lots of drawn out quests.My Final Score 8.5/10 I loved it from start to finish and spent a good 50 70 hours in beta and played the hell out of this and still do from time to time when im in mood for a bit of Sin.
title: Divinity: Original Sin 2 - Definitive Edition

review: Need to stop making emotional reviews.Game is set with you imprisoned and alone you can make friends quite easily and get a team up an running quite quickly.You start with 2 pretty much sole missions. 1/ To work out what the hell a godwoken is and why they're being jailed. 2/ To solve the meaning of the universe.. etc.. the usual really.Now Questing is quite simple an idea.. someone says something to you.. you decide to follow up on it and must glean clues to resolve it in the most part the missions/quests are fairly straight forward but many are just poorly laid out others are pretty insanely difficult and very very drawn out. You'll need to talk to animals to people read books and letters persuade alot of people you're right and you'll even speak to the odd spirit or three.Combat is turn based.. for the first time in gaming history it is actually better to have a smaller team than a bigger one. As the ai always gets 5 6+ combatants and you can only have 4 max the ai then alternates with you 1 combatant at a time. ie if your team is 4 each character fights every 8 turns or so. If you have a smaller group you can plan more efficiently and capitalise on taking out the damage dealers in the opposing team before they even get a shot off. In short the combat system is crap.You have a fair sized inventary of spells and skills to use some out of combat. Class skills are the usual mmo rpg fair D&amp D style. Graphics are excellent music is ok.. not superb.. but more than good enough. Overall game design feels rushed and lacking. Later sections of the game come over as largely broken or poorly planned and rushed.But overall it is also a fun game repeatable and the ending is fairly good. (If you remember to spread your team out and not get aoe wiped in the first 5 seconds)You get to play Origin characters custom characters and these include undead.. to which all AI will attack on sight. So keep that hat on and all times!

review: Ignore playtime I've cleared all available content. Took about 10 hours taking my time and reading mostly everything.Big patches are rare but the game itself is solid. It's an improvement in every way over the original. Currently only the first chapter is available. It's 'alpha' ish so it's buggy but it's coming along well. The original characters are pretty cool for singleplayer and the default 4 player is a very welcome addition. Origins are preset stories/personalities for followers (though you still control what they say they just have more options). They're race/gender specific. As is all the characters are very likeable but don't be afraid of going Custom! You don't miss out on anything big (so far) and don't feel like you're left out as you sometimes have more flexible dialogue choices.The Undead race is presently not in the game. Hopefully we'll have a sort of Zombie Forsaken esc race rather than just some skeletons.Lizard race is pretty cool. Name is a bit silly (lizard (race) vs lizard (animal)?) but they look cool and are pretty badass.Gear appearance is race specific which was going above and beyond for them but you'll want to make sure you like the way the gear looks before picking your race. IMO the elf stuff looks a bit much but eventually we'll have mods to fix that (probably).The story is more coherent and very present in all you're doing. That said there are multiple ways to handle the majority of quests. (HOWEVER do NOT sell the telekenisis gloves as you will need them in a maze later on.)The writing is more concise this time around but clearer and better. Source Magic is a nonrecharging resource which is pretty cool but so far the only ways to acquire it are obnoxious and higher level spells require you to spend source (which has a very small cap of 3 some spells taking 2) which feels clunky and tedious. That said this is only chapter 1 so we'll see how it goes.TL DR Only chapter 1 available improvement in every single way over Original Sin 1 which was already an 8/10+ game. If you like DND style RPGs this is your

review: First off no matter what I say I love this game! Mostly for the fact that it can be difficult does not hold your hand and I love the atmosphere! Probably the biggest reason though is I am oh so sick and tired of AAA games and their micro loot shit grubby greedy What this game gives you is a complete game and you don t have to pay to unlock weapons and gear. And if the first DOS is anything to go by they will most likely release an enhanced version for free if you already own DOS2 "fingers crossed" cause this game does have some issues My biggest complaints are 1. Inventory management is a complete mess it s terrible one of the worst I have ever seen.2. How often you need to replace your gear is terrible and feels like a chore. It doesn t feel special when you kill a boss and get that sweet epic cause when you roll back into town a vendor will most certainly sell a better one.3. The last act in Arx was not as fun as the first couple I really felt like I just wanted to finish the game and probably paid the least amount of attention in that act.4. I had casters and melee and I made it through the game just fine but I really did feel like it would have went smoother if I had all melee or casters because of the armour system. This armour system is flawed and needs to be reworked or abounded all together.I had a blast playing it! One of the best games I have played in awhile. If you are sitting on the fence just get it.

review: I've played football management games since the days when they came on cassette tapes. I've played this franchise since Championship Manager 97 98 and I've played every version intensively. Football Manager 2019 is the worst version of the game ever. There are many reasons for this. Firstly the match engine is terrible and has been the subject of countless bug reports and complaints on Sports Interactive's Football Manager forums. One particular annoyance has been the problem of getting players to cross the ball they will seemingly do anything but. But it would be wrong to focus on my 'favourite' bug in the game as there are so many problems with the match engine and other areas of the game which explains why at the time of writing this review there are more than 20 000 posts on the bugs forum. One of the big claims to improvement by SI for this game was the revamped training system. However it is shambolic. The sheer volume of choices which should be a good thing becomes an issue when the decisions you make either have no effect or trigger immediate problems. The AI controlling player personalities driving interactions with players is simply broken. One of my favourite examples is a player who was a few months into a five year contract. I was given a heads up that he was unhappy because he wanted a new contract. He hadn't asked for a new contract much less been refused but was unhappy anyway. I opened a private chat with him but the chat was over immediately because his reaction was that he was so pleased I'd come to talk to him he didn't want a new contract any more. There are many threads on the forums devoted to the nonsensical and plain silly player interactions which really mar the game.Press conferences are the most tedious pointless aspect of the game. There is an option for allowing the AM to handle them but it doesn't matter how good your AM is he will make a mess of press conferences. The much vaunted dynamics on the game are equally ridiculous with players showing unhappiness on one screen appearing to be entirely happy on another. As a tactics buff I expected great things when I first saw the new tactics screens on FM19. However for all the choices you have you might as well not bother because the don't seem to affect matches in the slightest. It's not just the crossing problem. Pressing possession play marking... it's simply broken. On a tactic I used I had instruction for two of my players to man mark specific positions on the opposition teams. I played many many matches and never saw my players make a single attempt to mark those positions in fact the opposite seemed to be true with the opposition players being given huge amounts of time and space. The daftness of the game permeates every single element. After I played a Community Shield match I got an inbox message stating that my keeper had set a new Community Shield record by keeping one clean sheet as the previous record had been zero clean sheets. I paid good money for this game. I am not alone in being infuriated by paying for a game which is simply not ready. Unfortunately there are limited opportunities to make complaints. The obvious option in to use the Sports Interactive forums. However the level of dissatisfaction over the game being raised on the forums seems to have triggered a policy of moderators silencing complaints and banning forum users who show any dissent against the full on barrage of positive propaganda being spouted by moderators and developers. It suggests SI know they got this game badly wrong. Personally I'm so infuriated with the way SI have milked the fans with this poor iteration of the game which has compounded the problems that surfaced with FM18 after the brilliant FM17 that I will not buy any further iterations. One bad game is a blip but two consecutive bug ridden games compounded by SI's apparent policy of silencing unhappy paying customers has made me completely lose faith in the company.
title: Football Manager 2019

review: Events that took place Did not want to sell player Got an offer for said player Rejected the offer Player demaned to be allowed to speak to the club Got a second offer from said club Essentially forced to accept the offer Player reached an agreement with the club Wished player the "best of luck" in his future endeavours Player is angry that he is leaving Player considerers his new club a "step down" in his career Reminder Player demanded to go to said club Me finding solice in the fact that FM19 although lacking in the football department delivers a brilliant experience in dealings with manic and psychotic people.
title: Football Manager 2019

review: I very rarely leave reviews. That is because I don't regard myself competent in most of the video game genres. But it is different for football manament games. I have been playing in this genre since 1997. My addiction and love started with Premier Manager 97. Then follows the CM98/99 CM99/00. FM 2005 is still fresh in my memories. Hours of gameplay... Lots of soul breaking matches played...And now it is FM 19. I pre ordered it. Big expectations. Bang. Incorrect squad registration roles for Turkish League. Totally unplayable in Turkey. I said ok. Football is universal. Go play somewhere else until they fix it. Took my favourite team in BPL which is Liverpool. Bang! Salah is injured for 11 months during a pre season match. Re started the game. Bang! Mane is gone for 9 months. Re started the game. Bang! Salah is gone 7 months. I said ok I will keep playing this time. 27 players in the squad. Total injuries were 145 throughout the season. Salah couldn't play a single match. Sturridge played 25 matches and scored 4 goals. The most shocking thing was I became the champion with 11 matches lost and 7 draws. I said ok. This is a pre release game. They will fix it. They always did.But no. Not this time they did. Last time I checked I am in 90 hours in this game. The further I came with a team without deleting the save is fifth match in the second season. Here is why 1. Poor match engine optimisation Your striker is very unlikely to score in one on one situations. And by unlikely I mean %5 10. Your probabilty to score goals from rigth wing/left wing crosses are much higher than to score a goal from the penalty kick. During a highlight you are very likely to see that one of your players is running completely opposite way from where everything is happening. Sometimes it is same for the other team's players. You can easily bet your home on that if your defenders started to pass the ball back and forth you will concede a goal.2. Poor VAR optimisation Around %90 of the key moments in a match contains a VAR situation The refs very unlikely to give a penalty decision without consulting the VAR.3. Player's penaltyI call this "player's penaly". Let me explaing what I mean. You take Chelsea. Trying to land a big name. You offer a big sum of cash. Rejected. The same transfer season your rival lands the same player for less. In another save you are Man City. You are after the same player. Offered a big sum. Gets rejected. Chelsea signs that player for less. Same scenario is also valid while negotaiting with a player. You offer 4m euro per year to a player. Gets rejected. Same player signs a contract with an AI managed club for 2m euros.One question here is very necessary. WTF?4. Translations (You don't have to read this part if your mother tongue is not Turkish) Since the first Turkish translation is introduced I have been forcing myself to play it in Turkish. But after a few continues I go back to English. The very first time it was introduced the translation was disgustingly bad. I don't remember the year I think it was 2014. Clearly a google translation. In comparison now it is a lot better this year. But still there is a major problem with the translation that must be addressed. And that is I don't feel myself that I am reading the news from a Turkish newspaper or conducting a interview with the Turkish media or listening the commentary from a Turkish commentator.It feels like a word to word translation of an English sportsman commentating or asking questions. What I mean by that is there is no translation of the jargon. It is like you read a translation of your new rented property's contract. Just word by word. Even the English idioms or figurative phrases are translated to Turkish word by word which doesn't make any sense when you read them in Turkish. "They leave with a win in their bags" What bags? They brought their own bags before the game? Interesting huh?I mean no offense to English culture and literature here. But this doesn't give me the same vibe when I play in Turkish.5. Unjustified buzz before the release On youtube I watched so many videos about the new purple background and a new picture in the introduction page and also a new layout in the menu.The purple background it is just a skinThe new picture(s) in the intro just a pictureThe new layout took me 3 seconds to adjustI am a veteran FM player and don't give a fuchsia about any of these.With all being said I will probably keep playing the game as it is the only AAA game in this genre. But I can't recommend this game anymore. I don't even recognize it as a game. It became a database for real proffesional football clubs with some 3d match engine in it.
title: Football Manager 2019

review: Instant uninstall after reading the privacy policy.Short version "We may collect any data we want (including sensible personal data) from the user and transmit it to anyone the laws allow us to. Also we may transmit your data to any foreign country where other (read laxer) data protection laws may apply."Upon installation and booting up the game the very first thing you will be asked to do is accept these conditions and enter your age so they can send it (together with other data) to third parties which will then show you "appropriate" advertisement ingame.Yeah SEGA aint no way I am saying yes to that. Uninstalled and refund requested.
title: Football Manager 2019

review: This has to be the most polished release of Football Manager that I can remember in a long time. It feels stable it runs smoothly the new features seem to work (and as intended). Most importantly the Match Engine feels like it has had attention put into the right places. At first glance it might not look like too much has changed if you've been playing Football Manager for as long as I have you'll appreciate the changes to the training module and match engine. Training has made a move to units and modules attempting to replicate what happens in professional football more accurately. Players will train in defensive and attacking units working on phases and patterns of play linked heavily to the way you want your team to play. Where previously you'd say 'Defending' now you can say what KIND of defending high engaging press? A low block dealing with crosses? It may seem like a small change but for me this is what I've been after for nearly 4 years. A way to link all the different aspects of management and coaching together. The match engine has had attention placed on helping us as gamers understand what the different match engine options sliders and instructions do and mean. You're even provided with tactical templates to build so you can see how the instructions all link together. Want to play tiki taka? There's a template for that that will set the team up to play that style. This is where FM19 excels for me this year its teaching us how the game works its helping us better understand the thought process and dedication PaulC and team have put into the match engine. There are even new user inductions for the new features too nothing has been left to chance. Perhaps its because of this that the game has felt slightly 'easier' this year I don't seem to be battling against how I feel an idea should work and how the match engine design makes it work. I can see changes I make within the ME taking effect. It has made it easier to exploit the weaknessess of the opposition which now begs the question when will the opposition manager AI do the same thing. Hopefully FM20 can continue the progress started in FM19.More reviews on my curator page https //store.steampowered.com/curator/27022862 LuchaLabs/
title: Football Manager 2019

review: Yes it's another Football Manger game I buy every year. But the same problem for me is still in the game. Even worse this year somehow. Here is the latest example of the problem that most recent FM games have.FA Cup FinalArsenal vs Manchester City I've stood firm and kept my inform youngster upfront for the game95th Min 1 0 Arsenal! my youngster scores! Surely winning the FA Cup!Kick off Arsenal get possestion back and pass around the back. Defender passes the ball from outside the box slowly to the GK. The GK walks towards it then runs away from the ball 1 1.Totally unacceptable I say this every year. I DO NOT CARE ABOUT THE GRAPHICS ENGINE. I still use the 2D dots (but had to look at the 3D to see WTF happened and it looks even worse on there. The GK just stands there then turns and runs away.)This is the latest example of this happening out of the 3 or 4 times its happened previously during the season. Also every other email is an injury to a player I know im managing Arsenal but come on this is crazyEDIT its happend 2 more times since this review same action. But for the other team.
title: Football Manager 2019

review: I honestly don't understand how this game can be so expensive especially considering next to nothing has been changed from previous versions. Whilst at times it might be fun the scripting is unreal and spoils any realism. It isn't user friendly. It's overly restrictive in some area's whilst overly detailed in others. To top it off it has a truly cancerous community and dev team that don't seem to want to make any fixes or changes to the game.The match engine is completely broken. If you are going to have 3D view and animation at least make enough varients that it isn't repetetive. Make idiotic things like 40 yard own goals almost impossible to happen (has happened twice in two different cup finals for me the odds of that ever happening irl are minute). Tactics make no difference. None. Results seem pre determined before the game has started. Players seem to do the opposite of what you ask. Some games reloading and changing things yields different results but in most it takes at least 20 games if not more before you ever get any sort of result. It took me fourty games yes FOURTY to score a single goal in one tie despite me having comfortably beaten the very same team 2 0 just a week before. One on Ones are broken. 90% of the time they will miss or hit it straight at the keeper. The amount of shots especially long range ones that are clearly saved by the keepers and magically every time clip the crossbar are given as goalkicks instead of corners. Kick off goals are insanely common. Strikers are broken as is crossing the ball. Your wingers will get 20 goals a season whilst your striker struggles to get 10. Corners and freekicks are the main way to score and even the worst players deliver a world class free kick 80% of the time. You can never win an appeal for a red card injuries are far too common.Too much is wrong. Not worth buying if you have an older version of the game.
title: Football Manager 2019

review: Feels better than the bare minimum data update rubbish of recent years. It feels much better and the response to the things you do seems to make more sense and feel less like a robotic time wasting exercise in doing stuff just because you know it's better if you do despite the mind numbing tedium. In summary bearing in mind the crap we've been putting up with this last decade or so with this lot this is definitely a step in the right direction. I think they knew the writing was on the wall and have tried to improve things and listen to their customers rather then take them for granted so applause for that but there's still work to be done.Remember every bug in the game play? Crosses One v ones always missing needing to create 30 chances to score 2 goals while the cpu beats you 3 2 with two shots total? Yeah well all of that nonsense is still there as it always has been. The engine still needs a tear down and rebuild but they clearly don't have the balls or the will to do so. Niftier graphical representations of action are not going to solve this. It's time to evolve lads and consign this engine to history imo. You've polished this turd to a shiny gleam it will not polish much further methinks.Apparentlhy the injuries were sorted for release. I'm a (game time) month in and i've had ten TEN! 2.5 a week! We haven't played a competitive game yet my training intensity is low and i've been giving the players 45 60 minute run outs. It's bloody bonkers! If this is the injury issue fixed then you need to look again. All in all at first glance it feels like we're getting there but i feel like it's just better stuff bolted onto the same old problems tbh and when i've had a decent amount of time to assess what's what i'll probably end up hating myself for being such an idiot again and giving my cash to people who probably don't deserve it all things considered. Right now though i like most of what i see.What these lot need is some decent competition to give them a proper kick up the but i don't see that happening any time soon tbh. If like me you've been bitterly dissapointed with pretty much every release in the last decade or so then probably you'll see past the gloss however that said this feels like a much better effort and whilst it won't make up for feeling fleeced by these people over the last decade or more it's certainly now approaching the game it needs to be. They need to be braver and tackle the match engine though they really do.
title: Football Manager 2019

review: As an avid championship manager and football manager officianado over the last 2 decades i will admit i had been semi bored of the similarities or lack of new features in each iteration of the game.This year changes that somewhat. The tactical overhaul makes it easier for both new players to get involved and keeps the same level of depth for the more tactically minded of managers.The training has been expanded allowing you to take charge of the weekly schedules PROPERLY. Team cohesion a little low? Best go out for a team building excercise in the community. Star striker looking a little biy chubby? Fatness to Fitness my friend.A lot of the old FM 'Memes' still exist. You can still put 40 shots on the opponent and not score whilst they have 1 on shot and win 1 0. Goalkeepers and outfield players still make minor mistakes. But the player interaction has improved massively. A lot of the time just approaching the player to talk to them about their issues can resolve the issue.All in all this game is still currently in beta. Theres still a few bugs to fix and im sure over the course of the year more will be found. I think the new era bodes well though.Long Live FM and i'm going to give this bad boy a 9/10 rating. whilst also plugging my channel for FM videos *cough* Keg Man Plays *cough cough*
title: Football Manager 2019

review: When my friends ask me what my favorite game of all time is they always expect me to say either one of the Witcher games or Fallout or any other AAA title and they are always suprised when they get Garry's mod as the answer. I grew up on this game. Days home from school "sick" rainy weekends normal afternoons.. I was always here. It was my routine. My comfort. TTT surf sandbox a little prop hunt now and then...Some of the best moments of my life came from this game. I know i know. Pathetic right? But i've made some of the most important friendships i've ever had on this game. It was my home for 5 years. and i regret nothing. This game may seem simple and maybe even a little stupid. But that's the point y'know? a simple thing for you and possibly some friends new or old enjoy. I miss it. I miss the good times. Hopefully this review will make someone buy it and then they'll learn what i've been talking about. It's an amazing thing.

title: Garry's Mod

review: Garry's Mod is a timeless game even when you do not play it anymore.Garry's Mod (or GMod as it is known) is branded as a sandbox game that allows you to do whatever the heck you want. You can build a spaceship out of bathtubs or you can rob someone's money printing operation.It is this unique sandbox feel that Garry's Mod was able to create very well by opening it up to the community at an early stage before a lot of games even tried. Garry's Mod allowed creators to do what they do best and create for the game. Sure Garry himself came up with "sandbox" mode but it is the community that made Garry's Mod what it is with the popular gamemodes such as Trouble in Terrorist Town or my favourite DarkRP.DarkRP was my favourite from the start when my friend recommended it to me whilst I was Skyping him. At this time he was playing on a server called TPS Gaming which I had never heard of. This was back in 2012 when it was only a year or so old and was on the Evocity map. We went and 'based' in the hotel and money printed not being the best law obiding citizens.The point is that DarkRP allowed me to develop my friendship with the only friend I really had on steam at that point and he is still my friend today. He eventually got a little tired of it but I continued to play and I continued to play for 5 more years spending 3000 hours on the DarkRP server alone. My journey in this server led to me making many friends even a few who are still my friends today. These friends led me to another friend group giving me even more friends. I felt like a part of a community a big community. TPS Gaming was a community and although it's not around today I still want to thank it for giving me the friends I have today and giving me countless hours of enjoyment.Thank you to Tommy for introducing me to the game and still being my friend. Thank you to Robbie for being a noob and basing with me (bad decision) and continuing to be my friend to this day.Although I hardly ever click the 'Launch' button on Garry's Mod anymore it still holds a place in my heart. &lt 3

review: The plot for Garry's Mod is excellent almost unlike any other game I've lived to play. As you may know Garry's Mod is advertised as a sandbox. That's horse Really Garry's Mod is a horrible terrifying twist filled mind . To this day I still can't stop thinking about Setsumi and her internal struggle to leave the 7th floor or Kaede and her attempt to fit in with the other children. What really got to me though is how Shinji wouldn't get into the ing Eva. That really bothered me. Anyway Garry's Mod is all these things and none of these things at once. Basically what I'm trying to say is that I type kind of fast and I like the way it sounds so I just keep writing bull so I can hear the wonderful clicking sound of my Razer keyboard thing that I payed way too much for with fake Charry Mx switches. However the wonderful people of Garry's Mod don't seem to mind too much about my mic spam and stuff so it's all fine. This is probably the only fun I'll have all day so please let me continue.I feel like it's my obligation to write an almost 5 paragraph essay because that's what my English class is for right? Actually English is so annoying. "Yes I love reading books written 2 000 years ago that don't make any sense in this language." "Oh 'Beowulf'? It's Skyrim. That's it." I actually try in school so I got put into honors English so I guess that's what's eating all my time.Garry's Mod has wasted so much of my time. Time that I could've spent studying or reading or other stuff I pretend to do. That's why I recommend Garry's Mod. It's one of the worst games I've every played but so stupid that you continue playing. Most people who play are little kids who don't know what they're doing but I think that's how it is with most games. Then you get others whose job it is to annoy the out of other people. Garry's Mod servers are like hell but better than hell because they're kind of real. In hell though you don't get people changing the vocaloid music you try to play on PlayX into pony so idk hell might be better. However there is one thing that I must compliment Garry on and that is the storyline.If it weren't for Garry's Mod my writing would be more clear and easy to follow but I've lost most of my brain matter because of Garry. In fact if I had never bought Garry's Mod I might be able to read upside down backwards right to left top to bottom Japanese Really though Garry's Mod is a pretty good game pretty much the only one I play now. Garry please go yourself. &lt 3 ｒｅｉ

After 2.5k hours I can say you will not get bored of this game. Not only do you have the base gamemode of sandbox allowing you to spawn NPCS build and do pretty much anything you want you also have tons of multiplayer servers and workshop addons to choose from.Feel like playing a World War 2 Role Playing game? Gmod has a server running it.Want to be a clone trooper in the Star Wars universe and earn ranks and combat ability? Gmod has a server running it.Perhaps you want to play a RTS? Maybe a murder mystery game? Hide and seek? Racing? Yup Gmod has it all.Gmod is thousands of games for the price of one and it is worth it 100%Trust me you will NOT get bored of this game.

review: If you're looking for a Gmod review well you've come to the wrong place.Here you'll find a recipe for waffles. Not just any waffles but pumpkin waffles.Pumpkin WafflesPrep Time 15 minutesCook Time 20 minutesYield About 7 8 Belgian wafflesIngredients2 1/2 cups all purpose flour2 tsp baking powder3/4 tsp baking soda3/4 tsp salt1 1/2 tsp ground cinnamon1/2 tsp ground ginger1/4 tsp ground nutmeg4 large eggs yolks and whites separated1 pinch cream of tartar5 Tbsp granulated sugar divided1 cup milk1 cup buttermilk1/4 cup canola oil1 cup canned pumpkin pureecampaignIcon Coupons1 tsp vanilla extractVegetable oil cooking sprayApple cider syrup maple syrup or butter pecan syrup for servingDirectionsPreheat oven to 225 degrees and preheat a belgian waffle iron (non belgian should work fine too) to medium heat. In a large mixing bowl whisk together flour baking powder baking soda salt cinnamon ginger and nutmeg for 20 seconds. Create a well in center of mixture then set aside.To a separate medium mixing bowl add egg whites and cream of tartar then using an electric hand mixer set on high speed whip until soft peaks form then add 2 Tbsp of the granulated sugar and whip until medium stiff peaks form.In a separate medium mixing bowl whisk together milk buttermilk canola oil pumpkin puree vanilla extract egg yolks and remaining 3 Tbsp granulated sugar. While whisking slowly pour milk mixture into flour mixture and mix just until combined (batter will be slightly lumpy) then fold egg whites into batter. Spray waffle iron lighlty and evenly with cooking spray then pour necessary amount (whatever fills your waffle iron mine was a scant cup) into waffle iron and cook according to manufactures directions. Keep warm in preheated oven and repeat process with remaining batter. Serve warm with syrup of choice.

Tired of fixed mandatory objectives in every single game you play? This game is a perfect reprieve! Had too much enough of said reprieve? Download and play a different objective based gamemode or map! If you do not own this game right your wrong and buy it! But a fair warning this game can be incredibly glitchy at times so be prepared for that when you start playing and keep it in mind for future gameplay. All in all though the glitchiness does not at all overshadow the fact that this is an absolute MUST HAVE that you will NOT be disappointed by! However I suggest that if you are going to puuchase this game that you maybe purchase some other Source Engine titles to go with it. 8/10

review: The sky is the limit quite literally.There are so many things you can do in this game it makes some AAA games look small. When you buy Garry's Mod you are really paying $10 for a blank canvas. It's up to you to find out what you want to do with it. You can mess around in the sandbox making cities waging wars doing heists with friends really there is no limit. If you don't like to use the sandbox mode no worries. This canvas you bought can do so many other things. How about you play a game where you and many others work together to try to kill a small group of Traitors who are also trying to kill you? How about a game where you disguise as props and play a big game of hide and seek? Theres way more than just that but I hope you get my point. Valve has given us this canvas where you can do whatever you want. The Steam workshop is your portal to all of the things you can get to shape your canvas and make your game how you want it to be. There really isn't much describing you can do with this game because you the player make it what it is.

review: Introduction Garry's Mod. A fun sandbox style do what you want kind of game. At least that's what it's advertised as and what people say about it. Garry's Mod is however very unique. The base game is one gamemode and 2 maps with HL2 content such as weapons and props. That's about it. What provides the magnitude of content is the community itself. Since it's release there has been a plethora of content added and created for this quite simple mod. So why would I someone with over 2000 hours of this game not recommend this game? There's a ton of reasons for this and I could legitimately write a book about it but I'm going to boil it down to a set of main ideas. Gamemodes Gamemodes are strictly speaking the heart of Garry's Mod. There are a range of gamemodes available each with their own interesting rules and gameplay. Or at least there would be if it wasn't for the fact that literally only about 5 of these gamemodes are played and have oversaturated the server browser. These are Trouble in Terrorist Town Murder DarkRP (Or any very mildly modified varient they all count) Prop Hunt and Deathrun. I'm leaving Sandbox out of it because it's Sandbox. Let's boil these down to what they should be and what they actually are 1. Trouble in Terrorist TownTrouble in Terrorist Town or TTT for short is a gamemode where you're meant to find out which of your comrades are Traitors and eliminate them or kill everyone else if you're the Traitors yourself. On the face of it it's quite intriguing. You do this by investigating bodies and determine which of your fellow terrorists are not what they seem based on location at time of death weapon and if they were seen committing the deed. However what it really is is an oversaturation of addons that do not work together dropping framerates and killing any sense of mystery (Because they wear ing cosmetics!) overly abusive admins who usually are 12 and paid for it using Mum's credit card trigger happy who thought sniffing the air around them was construed as an attempt on their life and then yell "RDM" at the top of their lungs to every available admin who will then ban at request without investigating claims. It takes about 50 hours of pulling your hair out searching through all servers to find an actual decent one.2. MurderOh boy did you expect a paragraph? Well you're out of luck this gamemode has literally been made for YouTubers and it is a dumbed down version of TTT except there are NO good servers. At all. Next.3. DarkRPDarkRP. A place where dreams go to die and people pretend to be someone else. Which is odd because on the face of it it looks like people could be extremely creative and have fun. ON THE FACE OF IT. The idea is you can get various "Jobs" in city life or make your own if you're just a basic citizen. The only real rules that are universal is the fact that you don't kill people without reason and if you die you don't get to remember your previous life. But in reality very few jobs are actually played usually as a result of server rules preventing you from doing anything actually fun. As well as this server owners again oversaturate the server with about 50000 different addons and have a 60 slot server which then results in 200 ping and laggy as gameplay even if the server is shoved right up your 4. Prop HuntProp Hunt is as it is. You hide as a variety of props and hide from the Hunters and the Hunters look for props. I actually don't have an issue with this mode except for the universal oversaturated addons list and laggy servers as a result. Some server are vanilla Prop Hunt and not much can then go wrong. 5. DeathrunDeathrun is Deathrun. Runners try to avoid traps set off by Death and you are eliminated on death. Runners try to survive and then kill Death and Death kills all runners with traps. Sounds simple. HOWEVER because of the nature of this mode which is no element of mystery server owners fill it with pointshop loot that you sometimes have to pay REAL MONEY for to get as well as 187562 different large as mods and voice lines which clog the server up and renders the game unplayable due to lag. And as a side effect the players get 200 ping at about 12 players on the server even if you again for some reason decide to put the server box right up your ing Addons Addons are what adds to the experience of Sandbox by adding numerous vehicles weapons weapon mods NPC's models props and effects. Now this sounds fine if it weren't for the way the main distribution platform worked. Oh boy strap yourselves in it's going to be a bumpy ride!1. The Steam Workshop Garrysmod.org Toybox and youNow you may be thinking "What are those two latter distribution platforms?". Well as of nowadays they're a graveyard. But before Gmod 13 these were the main sources of addons. This had its disadvantages and advantages because it meant going directly into your Gmod folders and manually placing addons and actually going onto these websites directly in the case of Garrysmod.org or downloading an addon which you had to access in a menu on Gmod but this then meant it wasn't always there clogging your addons list in the case of Toybox. This difficulty to install and upload was a godsend because this meant you usually only found high quality good content that people had made. The Steam Workshop however is an easy distribution platform which allows content creators to develop and share their work with the players of Garry's Mod. Well that does work to an extent like that. BUT! Because saves and dupes can also be uploaded as well as the ignorable bad addons you get a wide selection of 7 year olds making bad poses machines prop constructions and overly used memes you're best not looking for them. And they usually aren't popular. But they are if they involve one thing.2. The Cancer of Five Nights at Freddy's"OH GOODY I'M GOING TO MADE FOXY FREDDY IN HIS GAPING " Every ing FNaF fan ever.These guys. These walking tumours are usually too afraid to play the actual games themselves but buy them to support their shrine for Scott Cawthon download all the FNaF addons that Gmod has to offer which are uploaded by 7 year olds with talent and make really terribly posed ragdolls usually beg for 5 stars and then because of the amount of kids on Gmod because of an issue I haven't brought up they make it to the front page of the Steam Workshop! Like how even is that possible? And to add insult to injury they also do it on the FNaF maps but the ones with no events because they're so ing scared of the actual game. And then they ACTUALLY GET 5 STARS. A FIVE NIGHTS AT FREDDY'S SAVE MAKES IT TO THE FRONT PAGE AND PUSHES DESERVING ADDONS DOWN INTO THE CESSPIT OF HELL. The Community Now as I'm sure you know the game is filled to the brim with 10 year olds. This wasn't so prevalent back in the day before the Resonance Cascade the introduction of a certain set of people.The YouTube Influx of 2013This basically ruined Gmod of today. The popular YouTubers brought in a wave of ing fanboys who flocked to the servers running the gamemodes they were playing. People who actually played the more alternate gamemodes lost people and then the servers running them died transforming Garry's Mod into a lifeless husk of its former self filled with kids and cancer. Conclusion Gmod is a game I simply cannot recommend based on these reasons if you're wanting to play it for the extreme variety of gamemodes. If you want it to play with your friends and ONLY your friends it's a very fun game (This is literally the only reason I still play it.) But for any other reason steer clear. This game is not what it once was.

review: Garry's Mod A.K.A Gmod is a sandbox game. Which means almost anything is possible to happen. It's extremely fun with friends. Gmod offers a lot for the price its selling for. From Trouble in Terrorist Town to Star Wars Roleplay (RP). There are so many game mods alot are RP. It's not all RP though. You can create your own maps. If it's a rip off bomberman except with watermelons. DeathRun which is basically get to end of the map by going through obstacles. Or some normal and old school hide and seek. I would recommend it to who ever is looking for a descent game with a bunch of play value. You can play this game daily and not get sick of it. Because of the community involved with it. The community involves so many people with unique mind sets that for some reason will make the gameplay much more enjoyable. Even if they're RP as a homeless person in RP trying to sell you trash for a serious amount of money. P.S you will need at least a descent PC or Laptop to play this game.

review: As someone who has wasted a week of their life playing this game I can assure you that this game is worth every second. Let me try and run you through what will happen when you purchase this game. First you will spawn in a brand new world and have a wander around. Then you might spawn a few npc's ( non playable characters / bots ) and kill them. This will keep you entertained for a good few minutes ( many hours ). After that you will have a proper rummage through all the tools weapons vehicles ragdolls and other useless crap within your menu. Eventually you will tire of this and download some addons from the workshop just to liven things up a bit. Again you will have a good look at all the garbage you have downloaded. At this point you will be thinking about making your own addons to contribute to the amazing worshop. You have many ideas and plans but in the end you end up posing a female ragdoll bent over while they are being thrusted in the by a male ragdoll. You will be proud of your creation and so upload it to the workshop naming it "GMOD SEX LOL XD 18+". After a few more hours of loitering around in singleplayer you will discover "Multiplayer". You join many servers only to discover that they are full of little Russian kids screaming at you becuase you knocked over one of their props. Not all hope is lost becuase you will then find AMAZING servers full of awesome people and this is where you will waste many hours of your life ( Well it's where I did ). Eventually you will get bored and abandon this game for many months. One day you will be scrolling through your library of games and stuble upon Gmod. You'll remember all the good times you had and start playing again. In short this game is brilliant! Just play it! You will need Half Life 2 for the textures and possibly Counter Strike Source. Have fun!

review: I won't tell you if you'll like it or not. I'll tell you what you're getting so you can decide for yourself.Here's the major points you're most likely interested in Roughly 15 to 30 hours of content (depending on your preferred pace). No replay value outside of achievements. Not particularly challenging even on its hardest difficulty. Very well polished in its presentation and execution (sans a few initial release bugs). Minimal lore primarily discovered scattered throughout the dungeons. Introduces a few interesting inventory mechanics to the scene while cleverly borrowing/marrying the rest of its designs from other successful inspirations.And here are the comparisons you likely care most about 1. Binding of Isaac's dungeons NOT playstyle.While exploring dungeons your top down perspective room to room exploration and overall map are all borrowed from Binding of Isaac / Legend of Zelda but you do not encounter any playstyle changing items throughout each run. Your only 4 attacks (a 1 to 3 hit combo and a charged attack for most weapons) are based on whatever 2 weapon types you brought with you (Sword and Shield Big Sword Spear Glove or Bow).2. Recettear's shop management NOT depth.You place items for sale at your desired price learn from your customers' reactions how to better price them next time and upgrade your shop. Each customer is not unique in their desired target price there is no back and forth bargaining per customer there is no buying items from customers there is no recommending items to customers there is no debt with a looming due date there is only roughly 200 items total (including weapons armors potions and materials) etc.3. Stardew Valley's city NOT gameplay.You can roam around a charming city talk to townsfolk add 5 buildings/NPCs to it (e.g. Blacksmith Alchemist etc) walk to the dungeons and... that's about it. There's no farming (obviously) no shop investments (beyond paying to spawn them) no seasons or real time clock system and no relationship building of any kind.4. Rogue Legacy's progression WITHOUT the passive skill tree.Between each dungeon run (after selling your loot from the previous run) you're given the opportunity to upgrade your gear. This gear (and its upgrades and enchantments) will increase your damage health defense or move speed which in turn makes you stronger (and your next run easier) until you can progress further (and eventually beat the game). However said upgrade options are very limited rather unimaginative and likely won't impact how you approach your next run. If this review was helpful please say so via the button below. Thanks!
