title: Rocket League®

review: This short review is written exactly one year since I bought this game.Well Rocket League is addictive fun and a game which is easy to learn but hard to master.The first amazing thing of this game is it is a hybrid game the combination of football (and basketball hockey etc) with cars. If you are looking for sports game but getting bored of casual football or basketball games then you should give Rocket League a try you probably will like it. This game is all about skill and teamwork other things won't affect your win (except your network of course)The second one is the customization there are tons of items for your car and millions combination that you can try (but you know most items can only be obtained by getting random drops or opening the crates with key that you need to buy or by trading with other players. However you don't need to have those expensive items to be the best in this game. You can play with standard Octane that you got from the beginning and become the Grand Champ if you got what it takes.The third one is the community I know that you will find so many different people in this game trash talker noob ball chaser but still there are still good people. I did find some of them and they showed me how to get better in this game. Other than that custom training is there for you created by the community of Rocket League.However most people say that the server is suck but i don't agree 100% with them. Most of the time i played smoothly no problem. But it doesn't mean i never encountered any problem during online play. Well the server is not perfect but it's not that bad. I still got ping spikes in some server but most servers are good. So basically you need to double check your connection first before blaming Psyonix for the server. Overall this game is a must try for you guys. I'm going to give 8.8/10 for this game. I got addicted to be honest. I've been spending more than 900 hours in this game so you could tell how much i love to play this one.
title: Rocket League®

review: To be fair you have to have a very high IQ to play Rocket League. The gameplay is extremely subtle and without a solid grasp of theoretical physics most of the gameplay will go over a typical viewer s head. There s also Rocket League s advanced scoring system which might seem very simplistic at an initial glance. Those who do not partake in the exhilarating gameplay that we call Rocket League can only imagine it as RC cars playing with an ordinary tennis ball. The fans understand the challenging gameplay they have the intellectual capacity to truly appreciate the depths of physics to realize that they re not just fun and games they say something deep about its functionality. As a consequence people who dislike Rocket League truly ARE idiots of course they wouldn t appreciate for instance the detail of animation which itself is a cryptic reference to Bernhard Riemann's complex analysis through Riemann surfaces. I m smirking right now just imagining one of those addlepated simpletons scratching their heads in confusion as Psyonix s genius wit unfolds itself on their computer monitors. What fools.. how I pity them. And yes by the way i DO have a Rocket League tattoo. And no you cannot see it. It s for the ladies eyes only and even then they have to demonstrate that they re within 5 IQ points of my own (preferably lower) beforehand. Nothin personnel kid

review: So Rocket Leauge... I must say that I usually don't like online multiplayer based games they're usually laggy filled with brats and generally not fun to play (take this with a grain of salt though since I am essentially playing on a potato).Rocket Leauge is different though.While yes the game is designed to be played online it doesn't seem like you're online all of the time.The soundtrack is great not my kind of music but it could be worse.The visuals are great! And I'm not talking about the high quality graphics either I have to play on performance so my game runs better but even then they are better than most games that I have seen anywhere else.The gameplay is something else. the controls are great even though I don't have a controller and it's easy to pick up the basics. Once you got the controls down anything can happen.If I have one complaint about this game it's that the matchmaking isn't the best. My "rank" is 20 semi pro but I'm still only a beginner and I get pitted against pros in which my team always loses. Also I feel like I keep on facing against bots because 3 people with the same username appear on the opposing team and kick the crap out of me.In the end however I belive that everyone should play Rocket Leauge so if you don't have it buy it. Now.What are you still reading this for? BUY IT RIGHT NOW!!!

review: Don't let this game's intense learning curb intimidate you because I made that mistake in the past when I first played this alone on PS4. Rocket League is a game you have to put alot of time and effort into to get good at in order to truely enjoy it for what it is. This isn't a game where you can just pick it up and immediately be good at. Already clocking in 6 hours of game time in this game within the 3 days I've owned it Rocket League is a very enjoyable game of what can really just be best described as car soccer or Soccar as the game calls it. There are multiple modes like standard soccar rumble mode where you have weapons like in Mario Kart a basketball mode and a hockey mode as well as a few other modes (but to be honest I've really only played standard and rumble) that add variety to the gameplay though really you could burn countless hours just in standard mode alone and not even realize it! The plethora of car customizations accessories explosions for when you get a goal boosts trails and so much more also add to the high octane fun of Rocket League.With that said the game isn't perfect just as this review is only somewhat coherent since I haven't experienced all there is to the game yet. The AI is kinda trash at times scoring on their own goals or just sitting there doing nothing like an actual player gone AFK or with a garbage connection. The machmaking is also quiet unbalanced in terms of pitting players against other players with the same skill rank as them. 2 semi pros vs. 2 masters is not a fair match up Psyonix! The matchmaking also at times bugged for us where my group at times would sit in an empty lobby waiting for a match that would never come but that may of been on the end of the person hosting the game as it worked fine when I hosted it so can't really fault Psyonix on that since that is just speculation. Finally the music for Rocket League isn't that good mostly just geneic house produced dubstep but at least it fills the dead air of waiting for matches and being in the main menu so it does it's job at the very least.Rocket League was something I made unfair judgement towards in the past. Faulting the game for being very newbie unfriendly having revisited this again with friends on Steam recently has changed my tone towards it quiet a bit. It's one of those games where you can't let your initial skill at it effect your entire opinion on the game. By yourself it isn't very much of an enjoyable experience in my opinion since a major key of success in Rocket League is good communication so if you've got a group of friends especially one who is very much experienced with the game I definetely recommend picking this up. I can ensure you that yes you are gonna screw up you are gonna play people who are blantantly better than you and you are gonna rage quit but at the same time you are gonna improve upon your mistake and get better in time.
title: Rocket League®

review: Man this is just a fun game plain and simple It's Soccer/Football with R/C Cars there is a cross platforming ability so PC and Playstation can play together or against each other or you can turn it off if you want. The game is beautiful the music is fun the only real downside to it is when playing the game like an actual match there is no music the matches are short only five minutes so its not a time sink and the solo season is fun the A.I could use a bit more I but hey its whatever. I don't usually say a game is worth it's full price but at $20 this game is great for the price or any discount. It has had multiple updates since release all of which have made it look sund and run so much better I don't see being able to play without a controller but I know some people do it and are really good other than that I love this game 10/10

review: Even after 400 hours I'm still seeing new things and learning so much every single game. You've probably heard people say the same about other complex/rewarding games (Dota Dark Souls Spelunky etc). The difference is RL is able to avoid the "bashing your face against a wall" early learning curve players often experience with some of those other titles. The matchmaching system is so strong (and player pool so large) that I was never put into games against experienced vets who would have ruined my day while I was learning the ropes. My first month was all spent playing alongside fellow newbies who had just as much to learn as myself meaning Hour Three was amazingly just as much fun as Hour One Hundred Fifty Three!

review: So I have at the time of this review spent more than 170 hours on the game. First impressions were that it was pretty good. As I continued to play it I soon realised that the game was alot more than just football with cars. The game features a wide variety of cars items like hats flags wheels and even boost trails. If you were to try to combine all of these items excluding the DLC items you would get up into the billions of combinations the game features. On top of this the Devs have added a total of 4 arenas into the game which have all featured DLC cars that fit the theme of the map the maps however have all been free for everyone. Over all a very good game that you could sink hours into even though the matches are only about 5 minutes long (6 Including the Score cams and such.) And i guess this is where my review ends because i suck at reviewing stuff so yeah. Good game very addicting especially with friends and it's well worth your money.Edit A lot of people usually complain that this game has a cancerous community while this is true there is an easy way of preventing talk. Simply go into your settings and change Voice and Text chat to either Team only or turn it off completely.

review: My Favorite AnimalOur teacher asked us what our favorite animal was and I said "Fried chicken." She said I wasn't funny but she couldn't have been right because everyone else in the class laughed.My parents told me to always be truthful and honest and I am. Fried chicken is my favorite animal. I told my dad what happened and he said my teacher was probably a member of PETA. He said they love animals very much. I do too. Especially chicken pork and beef. Anyway my teacher sent me to the principal's office. I told him what happened and he laughed too. Then he told me not to do it again.The next day in class my teacher asked me what my favorite live animal was. I told her it was chicken. She asked me why just like she'd asked the other children. So I told her it was because you could make them into fried chicken. She sent me back to the principal's office again. He laughed and told me not to do it again. I don't understand. My parents taught me to be honest but my teacher doesn't like it when I am.Today my teacher asked us to tell her what famous person we admire most.I told her... "Colonel Sanders."Guess where I am now?

review: I wanted to write a useful review and include some negative things about this game.. but I can't think of any.Maybe the only thing that is bad is that not enough of my friends play this (yet) DThe game is fantastically fun. Your car can have a hat!!The tutorial is good and the pratcice modes are really challenging.The camera works absolutely fantastic letting you toggle between looking straight forward and focussing on the ball at all times with just the press of a button.Online play has been superb no lag issues (after 30 hours of play I had ONE game that was a tiny bit laggy) no queueing for ages (I have never waited for more than 2 minutes so far) not too many intolerant trolls.Match making does a pretty good job at putting you in games with people at around your own skill level.On YouTube you can find some of the best players freely making tutorial videos and other game footage the community is impressively friendly and helpful.Everyone should play this game.9/10 because you kind of do need a controller for the best experience. Playing with a keyboard works and some people manage just fine but you have so much more control over your car with a controller.

review: Rocket League This game is pure perfection.The basic idea in this game is really simple you play soccer with cars and try your best to hit the ball. You start the game you are greeted by awesome music and decide to go have some fun and suddenly you notice you have already played 100 hours. I think those first 100 hours are really precious because you learn the basics and maybe some advanced stuff too like flying and controlling your flying a bit. Rest of the game is basically you trying to make yourself more accurate with your flying and shooting skills and damn it's addictive! There's always something you can improve so you keep getting back into this game.Pros Great Soundtrack Fun gameplay (added enjoyment with bunch of friends) Super addictive Runs smoothly Competitive scene is growing (I consider this as a good thing because it means this game will keep getting updates)Cons Matchmaking is pretty brokenNice Game!What a game!Nice one!Nice one!Chat disabled for 5 seconds....

review: This is one of the games that should be in everyone's Steam libraries. Here's why It's extremely intuitive and easy to learn (not to master though) There's TONS of room for mastery and skill after 120+ hours I can attest that I have much to learn You learn the game simply by playing it. No "build guides" or extended studying needed (I'm looking at you MOBAs). Tons of replay value. I have friends who have almost 1000 hours on it and have stopped playing other games. It can be played in short intensely fun bursts. Most matches are around 7 10 minutes. It works perfectly out of the box reliable/fast dedicated servers 1 4 local co op (works flawlessly) 21 9 ultrawide support... It's fun for complete beginners (everyone so bad as beginners that it's hilarious and exhilirating when you happen to hit a goal in) It's equal parts casual and competitive. Casual matches can be joined and left with no penalty (which I personally enjoy). Ranked matches are fun and intense. The community is pretty great. Most people are fun and friendly mainly because the nature of the game lends itself towards good hearted fun. This is the only game alongside Witcher 3 in my library of 1300+ games that I rate a 10/10.

Lovely to see my friends get banned for being toxic (be it he was...) but there are people who get to spam that "What a save!" or mindlessly talk trash in casuals with nothing really being done about it.They need to add a sort of "Overwatch" system like CS GO had creates more videos for youtubers more publicity more people playing the game also means we can actually have some friendly games for once? Or maybe "undercover mods" who just join random games to play and if they see toxic behaviour ban 8)Why dont I recommend this game?Mainly the community.They keep the game updated with repeated (just revamped old) special events that make the game slightly more enjoyable for a while more. But after 1000hrs of gametime/afktime/trading/whatever I was doing from a baddddd laptop to a PC this game is just boring now.I have no incentive to want to win or to get a high rank. I've seen people in high diamond struggle to rotate or hit the ball even remotely well. Be it we all have bad days why do some of us get put with those people... over... and over? Or trying to grind solos in duos and making great progress with really good games then being put with 4 people that are completely clueless and you get de_stroyed. If you come onto this game to mess around with some friends then you'll probably enjoy it. But to really try and grind this game unless you have one teammate you can click with and work really well with arguments will be started anger will arise and you probably wont have a great time. Bear that in mind before you buy this game.tl drIf you were too lazy to read the whole review then you're probably too lazy to commit to this game. Therefore dont buy the game.

review: An amazing crossover between racing games and soccer games. Absolutely fantastic. You can either play against AIs or with friends online! Competitive players also get ranked gamemode for people to grind! The game's colorfully absurd cars playing sports concept works so well because the energy of its arcadey gameplay meshes with its deep team based strategy and variety of modes. It s also exceedingly rare to find a multiplayer game that s welcoming and approachable for new players and so intricate that the best players can earn a living by mastering its depths. Rocket League is a golden example of turning a good idea into something truly amazing. Perfect soundtracks composed by artists from Monstercat and other groups so just put your headphones on and enjoy. I really recommend this game.

review: Casual Player Review.Alright so Curball Space Program aka Rocket League the 2015 smash hit. This game will run okay on lower end systems and looks spectacular on high end systems. The game takes cars and sports and makes them one. You are an RC cart in a soccer field. You use your wheels and the sky a lot. You can boost and jump to go flying acrost the field you can perform some truley amazing arial hits as well.I play this game casualy. Whenever I want to play it I play a few matches. Some go hard core in this game but I don't. Its a nice game to play if you don't have a lot of time to play because it does not beg you to keep going. Which is nice.I rate this game 10/10 and mark it as an essential buy for any gamer on any platform.

review: Rocket League is a very addictive game. I Regularly find myself saying 'One more game' 20 times in a row. I would certainly not say that's a bad thing. With it's high speed gaming and Steep learning curve it may not be for the slower of us but this game has a *Mostly* welcoming community many of which will help new players. Although sometimes frustrating (Im talking about the goalpost physics of course) this game is very well made rarely dropping below 60 Frames Per Second at any time on any map. However i regularly hear of people complaining about the map 'Aquadome' and it's eyecandy causing lag this has never affected me.Stunning graphics and physics that feel very real Excluding the flying jumping and flipping cars obviously make Rocket League a lovely experience. As well as this cross platform play allows you to play with your console friends in private matches although i would love to see a cross platform trading and parties that allow you to seemlessly play with your buddies no matter the platform.Would highly recommend this game to anyone!

review: Rocket League is a game my friends have been recommending to me since launch it was not at all what I expected. What it comes down to is really just soccer (or football) with cars. Two teams driving a ball into the opposing goal. However there are more fun bits your car is customizable with cosmetics that drop often after each game your char can boost jump dodge and even fly and all movement is physics based. There are a few game modes from 1v1 duels to 4v4 "chaos" games where everyone scramble for the ball. There are even game modes that mix things up like Hockey game mode where you try to shoot the puck instead of the ball. I dont know if Rocket League will please all of you but I highly recommend you try it as I had a good time playing.

review: This is that game that you just can't get off of. This is the one game that you love. Once you see this you throw your call of duty in the garbage. You delete Minecraft. you de install every other game and you buy this game. Why? Because you do.I say this for this game is like no other. It isn't your classical and fun fifa styled game. All though to the common eye it is soccer which it is. If you were to compare this game to fifa all fifa games would go to trash. Why? Cause of the amazing feel of the game.You are a car that is for no good freaking reason fighting to the death playing soccer. Yeah no freaking point what so ever. But you don't care about the point. You care about the gameplay.You know of MLG PRO! Well that is the definition of this game. You can do so many fun things that will suck days and days out of your life and you won't care. I have played 42 hours of this game (as of when I made this review) and it rises by the day. This game is a no brainer to be the best steam game I have ever played. Coming from my mouth that means a lot.You can fly kick people's freaking butts for the fun of it blow people up XD and so much more. Why? Because you freaking do. No reason but you do it cause you just do. You just waste 20 dollars on a game and play your eyes out. you forget about the party you will attend. You play at 3 00 am. You just do that. Why? Because you literally just fell in love with a game. Not kidding. in conclusion this game is a must have. If you don't have it you are missing out on so much. Snap out your flip phone or iphone and grab your friends too 3wellyoubetterbuythisgame 3

review: First of all Rocket League is really fun. Repetitive and lacking in variety definitely but the core gameplay follows the "easy to learn hard to master" play pattern so well that it doesn't get boring as you gradually learn new cool tricks and face more challenging opponents.So why the negative review? Because this is barely even a game at this point. With every update Rocket League is getting closer to being nothing but a digital cash cow. It's not a free to play game yet it has a bunch of DLC and additionally there's a terrible lootbox system here as well. And now they have added a premium pass. All of this shows how disrespectful the developers are of their community. On top of that the game's maintenance leaves a lot to be desired with serious issues being left unattended for weeks if not months. And no new content is ever added these days except more cosmetic items hidden behind paywalls and only accessible via an in game lottery.I simply cannot recommend giving the developers of this game your money they will only go out of their way to get more of it. When these unfair business strategies are dropped I will gladly recommend this really fun game to everyone until then buy it only if you're willing to spend massive amounts of money or accept severe limitations because you don't.

review: I have more than 1500 hours in that game. Rocket League used to be my escape when I was writing my thesis. So many nights spent perfecting my aerials knowing I would be destroyed in the morning because I wouldn't have any sleep. The game was fun. Like "Even though everything is going to **** at least I have Rocket League" fun. However in good conscience I can't recommend this game anymore. I'm looking at you toxic community bad servers and loot boxes. The focus of Psyonix is now clearly on making money rather than polishing their game so the players of all the world can enjoy it to its full potential. The servers are now worst than ever and it seem to get worst with each update. Lag and high ping are now a daily thing. And what have they done to correct this? They implemented a premium pass (or whatever it's called) to make even more money instead of fixing what's essential to the game. Why bother fixing the game when all you have to do is design a new crate and watch the cash flow? You're just a shadow of your former self Psyonix and this is my breakup letter.No I don't want to stay friends.

review: I have moved to this game from xbox having 1300 hours and i have not moved back. The PC version is superior in every way. 60+ FPS Decreased Input Lag Friendly community Steam Workshop Capabilites Discord Communication Easier to find capable Team Members LAN party hosting Much more fun!This game has unlimited customization options. For every match played you are guaranteed a new customization item for your garage. (Boost Paint Job Topper Antenna Banner). After you acquire all the items you have a chance to obtain crates which contain even more items!The Developers of this game (Psyonix Studios) is one of the more engaging teams compared to other games. From what I have seen over the past years Psyonix is able to please the communities demands. On their website about every two weeks or so there is updates from them and they also use a twitter account (Which they constantly update on!)If you are starting the game fresh I recommend maybe finding a friend or 2 (3v3s) to learn the controls and mechanics together. I started with a teammate i knew to play 2v2 together. It is very fun with friends.As you start from the bronze ranks (The lowest rank) you will see many players also aiming to improve their skills. Each rank seems to have a different level of gameplay to them.I would say going through each of the ranks (Champion 3 peaked) you can really start to see the level of communication to succeed. Especially in the diamond/champion ranks here is where things really start to get competitive! This is what overall makes this game the perfect e sports game the concept that the skill level is so high for this game. It is never too long before someone picks up on a new mechanic. Audience Kids Everyone Casual players Pro players Graphics Potato Really bad Bad OK Good Beautiful Masterpiece $ Price/quality Full price Wait for sale Average Refund it if you can Don't do it Requirments 90' PC Minimum Medium Fast High end NASA computer Difficulty You just need 2 arms Ez Easy to learn / Hard to master (Controller optimal playstyle) Hard (Harder with keyboard in my opinion ) Dark Souls Game time/length Really short ( 0 2 hours) Short ( 2 8 hours) Few hours ( 8 12 hours) Long ( 12+ hours) Endless (5 Minute games) Story It doesn't have Still better than Twilight Average Good Fantastic Bugs Game itself is one big BUG Bugs destroying the game Lot of bugs Few Bugs You can use them for speedrun Nothing Others Multiplayer YesSingleplayer YesLAN Hosting YesWorkshop Capabilites YesOverall score 9.5/10 ) perfect physics based game. review: I ve always liked soccer. Cars and sports games not so much. And so it was with a cautious curiosity that I first approached Rocket League. Despite my initial reservations I quickly fell in love with the game. I never knew how much fun it could be to try to kick a ball with a car while flying through the air tipping back and forth and back and forth desperately attempting to get just the right angle to intersect with the falling ball s trajectory but failing miserably and zooming off tangentially then trying to stick the landing but botching that anyway and hoping that by some miracle my opponent will mess up too (but of course he doesn t he never does) and looking on in shame as he scores on my open net and refuses to skip the replay forcing me to relive my shame and then repeating the process all over again and hey this time I actually hit the ball in the air but oh wait what s this it s going towards my own goal oh god no no no no no stop rolling please please please stop rolling and of course it doesn t stop rolling and I just scored an own goal oh god WHY and then I slam my mouse on the desk and quit the game and turn off my computer and walk away because god this game is frustrating and my teammate sucks. Yet inexplicably I come back an hour later ready to do it all again. I really like soccar.

review: Never in my life have I seen such a malconcieved idea of physics in a game. When playing offline movement is largely based on reality and is fairly consistant but online play is like jerking off in wonderland. The combination of the cheapest servers money can buy half cross platofrm patchwork and the varying bubbles around cars makes the game unplayable. There are huge discrepencies between what a player sees on their client and waht the server interprets as happening I imagine this is due to psyonics choosing a 5 10 tick format of packet sending data to the server what a buch of money grubbing cucks. The nice people of psyonics also believe that skins will make us forget about all of these game breaking bugs but they need to pull head from and start fixing what theyve broken. The highschool dropout that coded this game deserves all the best but the company he works for should be condemned to creating only crap free games for mobile devices. EDIT Also the automated ban system is a joke whe anyone gets butthurt for losing a game they fat and gay shame constantly but one no no word like the f word back at them and ur done kiddo. company would rather remove its good players from the game rather than just chat mute them.. WHAT A GREAT SOLUTION. This company is full of the biggest somalian bellends on the planet.

review: A very interesting game that challenges you to master control of these vehicles. I've played this game for years and I've had a great time thanks to the few wonderful friends I get to enjoy it with. I can no longer recommend this game though because over the years the game developers have been riding their microtransaction content to make money off it's most loyal and loving customers only to ing cuck them with the chance of getting a decent cosmetic item. The only content I've seen released over the past couple years are more crates and some semi decent to game modes. If you're a competitive person and want to get into the games ranked system and climb the leaderboards be sure to play with some grand champion friends because more than half the players in platinum rank just started playing the game and sit under the ball when it's over the enemy goal. The competitive match making system in this game is one of the worst I've experienced in any game. It's so easily manipulated that the only way you can guarantee your team mates are the rank they should be is to actually be friends with them and play with them consistently. I loved this game years ago all the way up until they started releasing thousands of cosmetic items and some pretty terrible maps that most players don't even want to play. I cannot forsee anything interesting being changed or released in the game in the future. If you like this game as is buy it. If you like certain cosmetic items in this game buy them from players because your chance of getting it from the cuck gambling system is extremely low.
title: Rocket League®

review: What a blast of an Arena Multiplayer game. It's essentially soccer with cars (with some other differences such as riding on walls) but the game's competition clean controls and strategy REALLY sinks it's claws in you and doesn't let go for a while. There are plenty of single player options and the leveling and unlockables also add longevity even if you don't have a bunch of buddies to play with. If you're wondering if the quality/content equates to enough to merit the pricetag? Yes. Yes it does.

review: Nope. This is the end of the line. this The game by itself is quite fun and could be so much better. But there's so much wrong from almost every angle. Just no. Just ing hell no.Almost every new season has a skill reset some even hard resets. Seeeing you matched with and against EVERYTHING on the spectrum. If you're not planning to to play with friends don't expect it to be fun. But this leads me to the next piece of The likelihood of you in a team of 3 being a ing prick is way to high. The player base and Psyonix's both unwillingness and incompetence to properly deal with their toxic players is another piece of the big t picture. And it could be simple to fix things. But they're not even trying. They could limit the time for players and teams to watch instant review of goals. But they don't. Some people are really getting off of that stuff and that's just what you still have to deal with when you disable all chats. Which is your best option but evidently won't help you against the rest of the t. And even if people aren't intentional they're ing stupid. Even in high tier competitive matches you have ing morons who are too stupid to get the basics of the game. Ball chasing nobody defending the goal stealing boost from team mates shoving team mates around going for boost instead of the goal first...it's ridiculous. Psyonix doesn't give a . They're making s of money because every dimwit is throwing money at them. Now they're even selling their "Rocket Pass" to squeeze even more money out of people and everyone is falling for it. Nope. I've had it with this t. All the randomness the toxic and stupid players Psyonix's ignorance. Just no. Stay away from this. It's not worth it.

review: I love this game but I cannot recommend it. The company that created it has fallen victim to it's own greed and is slowly turning the game into a service rather than a product while ignoring broken parts of the game. The in game VOIP hasn't worked for roughly two years. The bots are still pants on head . The matchmaking and smurfing is still a problem. Instead of fixing these things the company adds more cosmetic items and creates a chat and name censoring system without an option to opt out.The company also bans people from playing the game for up to a month for using bad words without an appeal process. Never mind chat bans they flat out steal your game away from you by changing the EULA without informed consent.Stay away from this game and do not trust Psyonix.
title: Rocket League®

review: tl dr Game good toxic community bad. Fun to play with friends not fun to play soloFirst of all let me say this Rocket League is a very fun game with pretty solid mechanics/coding. I really do enjoy playing this game WITH FRIENDS. Unfortunately the community in public games has surpassed even League of Legends CS GO and other AAA titles in terms of griefing/toxicity. Approximately 30% of my games in COMPTETIVE game modes are ruined by a griefer. Griefing in this game ranges from scoring on their own team afk farming and spamming of quick chats throughout the game and more. Each game is relatively short ( 3 8 minutes) so if you so desire you can just "deal with" the griefers. However as you are getting trolled you have to remain active in the game so you don't get kicked for inactivity. A soft ban on queues occurs with increasing length to a potential perma ban with each kick. I don't have the patience to sit through a full game getting trolled and to me if about one in every three games is wasted time the entire game is ruined. Understand i'm not saying that the game itself is poorly designed in any way it's actually VERY well made comes at a modest price and can run on most computers. My issues are as stated the community (some of them some people are also great but in this case the good DOES NOT outweigh the bad) and the game publisher(s) that have not taken action to prevent these players from damaging other player's experience.DISCLAIMER Everything i've stated has come from my personal experience with Rocket League your experience may differ At the time of writing this review i am fluttering between silver/gold ranks. While i was in bronze i experienced MORE griefers. I suspect higher mmr fewer trolls for obvious reasons but cannot speak beyond my own experience
title: Rocket League®

review: WARNING Game is highly addictive do not start playing unless you have nothing important to do for the next 24 hours.This game should be taken as a textbook lesson for other gamedevs out there. It's gameplay and business model honed to perfection. Few games out there can provide sheer joy like this one when playing online even when you're being steamrolled. And if you're holding off purchase fearing a toxic community you can be rest assured that the majority is nice and forgiving.+ Highly accessible despite having a very high skill ceiling+ Microtransactions are perfectly done non intrusive cheap and so damn tempting.+ Pretty visuals that're well optimized.+ It incredibly enjoyable even for utter noobs (like me) unlike some of the most popular MP games out there (Yes I'm lookin' at you DotA and CS).+ Trading happens ingame not through Steam trade (so no like Mobile Auth).The main issues I have with the game is relatively low community involvement apart from playing the game itself Modding tools are not the friendliest (Look at Source games and UE4 games) Workshop is rudimentary atm (This will hopefully improve as it just came out) No Community servers (Disappointing but I can live with it)Thanks for reading Sel.
title: Rocket League®

review: Product received for free. Minecraft is a fun game by yourself but playing with your friends can make it a truly memorable experience. You can set up a server that will allow you to play and build together that people can leave or join at will.1. Start a new single player game in Minecraft.2. Once the game has started press Esc to open the menu.3. Click "Open to LAN".4. Click the "Mode" button to select the game mode for other players. You can select Creative Adventure or Survival.5. Click the "Allow Cheats" button to allow other players to use cheats.6. Click "Start LAN World".7. Note the address. You will see the message Local game hosted on XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX XXXXX". Copy down the address to give to others.8. Start Minecraft on the other computer(s). These computers must be connected to the same network as the first computer.9. Click "Multiplayer".10. Wait for the network scan to complete.11. Select your game and click "Join Server".12. Add the server manually if you can't discover it. Click "Add server" and then enter the address that was displayed earlier.

review: TLDR This is one of the more unique series' of games that i have played and I wholeheartedly recommend this game. GET IT if you think you are interested. its worth it.Extended review I never would have thought that soccer (or footbal for the rest of the world) would be so fun in cars. Flying through the sky preventing a goal clearing it up the field and shooting is all extremely satisfying. Theres really never a dull moment. youre either excited waiting for the ball to line up for you to drill into the back of the net or freaking out whether or not your opponent will tap the ball in to tie it up right at the end of a game as the ball lazily rolls across your net. I love this game and am extremely stoked that it came out for PC since I dont have a ps4. But this isnt my first experience with this game. There was a prequel.The "prequel" was Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket Powered Battle Cars or SARPBC on the ps3. I stumbled upon the demo in the ps3 stor years ago played it a bit and was instantly hooked. I sunk countless hours into the game. The only downside I ever thought of was the fact that it was multiplayer focused with some single play and split screen. By the time i stopped playing the game there were very few people playing online so there were only bots to play against in normal games.Rocket league fixes every issue I had with its predecessor. There is now a season mode where you go up against teams of bots in games. From what time ive put into it so far (7 games out of the 27 or something week season number of games is changable along with teams in season end tournament) it passes the time when Im not in the mood for multiplayer (I have an issue with lag for most online games so i tend to stick to split screen or single player games although lag hasnt been terrible for me). Theyve also further delved deeper into your cars customizatoin from just chasis and decal you now choose chasis wheel decal colors for which team and style of colors hats (yes hats) boost color and antenna. All of these different parts track different stats like goals saves and so on. I participated in the Alpha for this game and I would have recommended the game at that point but then they took it further.So if you want a great multiplayer experience with an extremely fun game this is a must buy.See you on the pitch!

It doesn't matter what game mode you play the anonymity a player has and the lack of punishment that this game gives has bred probably the worst player base out of any game I've ever experienced playing. The report button is a joke and it's well known by players. Other than that the mechanics take more than a little bit of time to get used to but once you get past just throwing your car at the ball the game becomes a lot of fun. Game is most enjoyable when you have a group of 2 or 3 players. Reccomend to buy only if it's on sale or if it was gifted.Will change review of the game to thumbs up once theres a system of punish implimented for extremely toxic players which it is currently very much lacking.

review: Rocket League is an incredible game with tons of replay value. There are several different game modes like Dropshot Rumble Hoops and Hockey and there's also competative modes for 1v1s 2v2s and 3v3s. There are microtransactions for keys to unlock seasonal crates that you occasionally earn as well as a bunch of DLC but the content is all purely aesthetic.Overall it's definitely one of my favorite games to play with friends online and I would highly recommend it to anyone interested in buying it!Also it's decently easy to get every achievement! Now I'm not sure if there's already an achievement guide on Steam but if you're reading this and you currently need help getting any achievement(s) in this game feel free to comment on here or my profile for help and I will gladly do what I can to get you those achievements!

You play the game You level up in Rocket Pass level (which is not worth it unless you buy the PREMIUM) beside your normal level And items(really really bad and useless ones if not Premium and you get those items every 4 5 levels Premium has every fancy Exotic one can dream of every level). I could accept it if there wasn't a HUGE CLIFF between the premium and the normal but you literally get nothing valuable or beautiful except Ciphers that opens chest but you only get a few of them if you gain all levels in the season. NOTE My problem is not even Rocket Pass even though im completely against it in a PAID Game. My problem is that this is just the BEGINNING of a wrong way that will end in a complete premium game even though it's not free to play.

review: Do I recommend this game Yes!I bought this whilst 50% off... I would of gladly paid the full price if I'd of known how addictive it is.I don't like football never have never will (as much as I "tried" to get myself into it) But dear God I like this game I like it alot! As you can see from the store images it's football but with cars rather than humans it's standard mode is 3v3 there are no rules such as "off side" "corners" or "penalties"....Just smash the car into the ball and try to get it into the net!The thing is there appears to be alot of depth in the game the more you play this game the more you will learn. I'm only 7 hours into this at the moment I'm getting a good grasp of aiming and scoring but can I hell fly up to the ball and smash it in the back of the net like some players I've seen.Just knowing that with practice I will one day be able to perform the same feat drives me to learn the games mechanics further so.Throw in a fantastic soundtrack that plays whilst on the menu/customization screen and you've got yourself one hell of a game.Maybe this is the game that will pull me away from my usual fix (Counter Strike)... Maybe.

review: A lot of toxic people say that their teammates play even worse than these toxic people. (the only way to play worse than these toxic people is to play against their own team so they are actually lying) Also some teammates intentionally bump into me (even in the beginning of the game) steal goals/boost orbs let only their friends get goals/assists etc. Other than the toxic people brought by the free weekend (they'll leave soon though) the game is really good but there aren't a lot of tutorials. I got Expert/Veteran in another team as Semi Pro though but it's all ok. The only reason I don't recommend it is because the developers are going to remove exp/item gain in singleplayer mode for the purpose of fighting "farmers" (they do no harm to the game) make uncommon items gained by leveling up and make the levels infinite. They already have lootboxes too so I guess the devs suddenly thought this isn't a paid game but a REALLY bad and &amp *?%ty f2p one. I mean that they always had these DLC cars that are worth more than the game itself and now they thought it isn't enough. The devs here aren't the only ones who got greedy on paid content for paid games though so they are not the only ones to blame. Play it if you want to play a game about playing football using cars and getting ranks for it and don't even think about it if you play it for the plot expect car customization (other than using ugly random items)#DontRemoveSingleplayerExp
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is somewhat unique and I'm here to be a critique...When you give me a sports game most likely a football game like Pro Evolution Soccer or FIFA I will take it and smack you with it. Not that I hate sports or sport games it's just I kind of don't like it and it's not that much of a fun for me. If you give me an arcade racing game I probably won't smack you but I won't be your best friend either. I do like some of the racing games but It's not exactly something I'm looking for.And then there is Rocket Leaque. A nightmare for anyone like me. Sports racing hybrid. The idea sounds so bad I simply had to have this game. And believe it or not it's probably one of the best game of this (or similar) genre I have played in a VERY long time. Why? Well because it's fun goddammit and that's what counts for me.The point of the game is to score a goal and eventually win. Either in 1v1 2v2 3v3 or 4v4 modes with 2 teams Blue and Orange. Now you're thinking with Battle Cars. Each of the players will have his own Battle Car. That's... a car. With... rocket and... antenna... And a hat. You can't forget a hat. Anyway you can score by hitting the ball into goal (I know I know it's a very shocking game mechanic no one could foresee). It doesn't matter if the ball flies in the air or just sits around eating its hotdog and yelling at you "Hey! Hit me with your best shot!". If you DO score enemy players will be angry and teammates will use the very convenient quick chat offering 12 of different chat messages you can use instantly. And then spam "Sorry! Sorry! Sorry!"All you do the entire game is controlling your Battle Car that offers various different things that may and may not help you in achieving the ultimate 'winner status'. The car obviously has four wheels so you can move into any direction. Yes ANY. Next gen at its finest. You can also boost yourself jump double jump dodge fly or destroy other cars by ramming them so hard it will rip the time itself (or by simply moving at 88mph). It's up to you to choose your position in the team. You can be mindful attacker or needed goalkeeper if you dare. And that's basically it. You move you get some goals you give some goals you win or you lose and again. After each win you also unlock new customization items such as said antennas colour types decals booster flame and hats... You REALLY can't forget a hat.There is tons and tons of little details and tactics you can use. But it's something you need to learn yourself. The game also offers very detailed and intuitive tutorial. And then there are visuals. Very colourful very nice and very clear. You see what you need. In options you can also find little but nice things like FOV camera height and others which will definitely makes everything better.Soundtrack is also a thing that deserves noting as it is very nice and very well done.But there's something that no game can avoid. Something that is missing or is simply bad or worse then the rest of the game. I personally think that the problem of the game is in minimum of maps each with basically the same standard field layout. This should however be changed with upcoming patches and updates as promised and siad by developers pretty recently.Other problem could be camera when it's locked on the ball and you are under it. It's coherent to some degree but sometimes you see nothing. In most cases you can get destroyed or pushed by another player without knowing he's going for you because you need to see the ball.And let's end it with third problem replay. There should be an option for naming them. But it's just a detail.I could go on and on with problems but everything else is just little things. That means that this game is really good almost perfect in its own way. And it's really really really... and I mean REALLY (like REALLY REALLY REALLY) addictive game. Really... Once you sit to this game you will not get up. I guarantee it. You will beg the god to make this game boring but I'll tell you a secret there is no god! (That grants this wish at least).And now if you know math a little you can very easily calculate it Fun + low price + addictive gameplay + nice audiovisuals + free updates + my recommendation stop reading this review and go buy this game goddammit! Go go go!
title: Rocket League®

review: tl dr Steam controller is not working in Rocket League for macOS (but working fine for other games) and Psyonix has 1 intentions in fixing this albeit being aware of this issue for quite a while.I got Rocket League for free when I bought my Steam Controller but I've bought it multiple times after that for friends who couldn't afford it or didn't feel like spending the 20 bucks for it. Also I am playing under macOS which technically is a "beta". However the beta note isn't really visible and Steam promotes this with Full controller support even for macOS so I feel like this is appropriate.It used to be great since the game worked fine. The Steam controller worked great cross platform multiplaying worked fine everything was great. Fair enough they were some occasional crashes in certain maps but that's expected from a beta version. We had a good laugh restarted the game and everything was fine.And then December 2016 happened. They released an update which simply broke the Steam controller. No input nothing nada regardless of the configuration. That's fine happens and we all expected it to be fixed soon.It's now the end of February 2017 and it's still broken.Even worse they released a few patches since then adding more DLC content and other stuff to increase their revenue. That's fine but addressing stability issues would be another nice concern. In addition their support simply does not care. I've opened a ticket which got closed claiming that they are ware of it but the game is a beta and so I just have to deal with that. To make matters worse they didn't even manage to replace the placeholders in their response template the response literally started with "Hi Insert Name ". They even included a link to their subreddit so I can check the community for help! Funny little boilerplate response.So it's fine. Their decision. Apparently the portion of macOS users is just too small to provide any development resources. I don't blame them but if you think about buying this game for using it on a Mac be aware of that.

review: The morons at Psyonix opt to ban players from playing the game simply because they don't like what players say in chat. Instead of disabling that persons chat abilities they put them in timeout like they're a little 3 year old. I bet when they aren't writing buggy code they are out hugging trees and saving whales. The broken matchmaking is also annoying as hell. You queue up a game wait for it all to load then one player can't join and you have to sit there and wait for the game to decide 'aww shucks' before it lets you return to the main screen and start all over (instead of just waiting for another player to join). The servers tend to run like crap most of the time... you can always tell when they reboot them everythign is buttery smooth... then slowly but surely gameplay goes to crap.Despite all the problems they have no shortage of DLC releases. Instead of making the base game better and more functionally sound they opt to pump all kinds of exciting garbage into the game to try and keep the interest of the 12 year olds they're also trying to protect from bad words. Keep sending them your money kids.

review: The very best time waster there is to relax and pump yourself up at the same time. When you want to have an adrenaline rush big enough to pump you up and have a great time but small enough to keep you relaxed this is the game. Unlike say CS GO or StarCraft 2 Rocket League brings the best of both worlds casual and competitive play and blends the two together to give you the most fun possible. The skill cap in this game is incredibly high and you can never stop learning and getting better. It's fun to play it's fun to watch and also it's fun to fool around in additional modes (currently there are basketball and hockey variations along with Rocket Labs game mode with custom funnily twisted maps.) Oh and did I mention how much fun it is to customize your car? It's crazy. Pick a model paint it in different patterns pick the wheels boost pattern add a hat an antenna (or don't) and you can roll around in your awesome pirate or Holy Religion Jesus Something themed vehicle.You can really feel the speed of your car and the adrenaline kick is enough for a dopamine rush compared to getting high on chocolate flavour after workout pizza weed straight from the best weed plantation on the face of the earth.Buy it if you want to lose your 15 hours from your week every week. If you only want to lose 5 minutes of your day every day still buy it since this is the length of an average match. But be warned you're going to quickly develop the "one more game" syndrome (if you haven't yet.) You have been warned.But seriously buy it.
title: Rocket League®

review: EDIT Going to change this review to a pros/cons review because I got all into it.PROS+ Gameplay is very different from any other sports game which in this case makes this probably the best sports game out there. (No hate on sports fans I'm just a lazy er sitting on his desk all day long)+ Soundtrack is great+ The car customization it's really wide and you have a ton of options to choose from. (More coming )+ The game runs on my pc really well. Can play it on ultra with fps rarely dropping below 60.+ Unreal engine+ Game's price is spot on+ DLC is worth buying if you're interested in having more customization options. Since the DLC is cosmetic only it won't affect gameplay and thus is really well done.CONS Can get a bit grindy for some (personally idc) Community has become pretty toxic lately but what would you expect from a competitive game anyways. (Huge thank you for the small heroes who aren't being toxic I love you all!)And to sum this review up this game is 100% worth getting. I personally try to avoid becoming toxic myself but sometimes it's unavoidable xDFinal verdict 10/10GOTY? yea it is

review: Rocket League is a amazing game with simple ideas behind it hence it is "Easy to play Hard to master". The Game offers more dimensions to it then I first initially thought when i started playing rather than just mastering the skill behind hitting the ball(quite harder than you think when you first start) more aspects start to appear as you progress through the game. The Pay2Win effect is minimal in the game where cars do differ in terms of hitpoints/turning speed/control but is not a big deal. I would say how you get better/stronger in the game is from your own determination and practice. Even so you can still have some fun when you start playing and it will only get better from there when you start mastering more advanced aspects.Lastly the community is alright though it is still better than most. If you learn and understand the key aspects behind how teamwork works in the game such as Positioning and rotations(these should be fundamental) then people in your team shouldn't be giving you much trouble. However the game may get bit too competitive in which players may start throwing insults especially if your beating them by alot. Nonetheless there are still people out there that will always complain about stuff but its tolerable in this game.In Conclusion there is more to this simple game where it creates more enjoyment as you become better as a player. Understand key concepts and you will enjoy this game. I apologize for the large body of texts perhaps dot points may have been better.
title: Rocket League®

review: This is an awesome game it's one of my favourites. The matches aren't heavily time consuming so it's a great game to pick up and kill a few minutes. It also has a great competitive system if you are into ranks.Lastly I highly reccomend a controller to be used. I played this with keyboard and mouse for a long time and I could definately see the difference in performance once I started using an xbox 360 controller on my PC. It just makes the gameplay smoother.

review: Rocket LeagueIf you think this game is about cars You're wrong. If you think this game is about soccer You're wrong. This game is about fun. Endless fun and the satisfaction of getting better and beating your opponents.Estimated time to 100% 30 60 Hours (Depends on RNG and Skill)Estimated difficulty EasyPros+ Easy to learn hard to master.+ Good for casual and competitive gameplay.+ DLCs are only cosmetic.+ A good variation of game modes.+ Constant content updates.+ Multi platform (Windows Mac Linux &amp SteamOS)+ AchievementsCons You have to buy some of the DLC to get all of the achievements.Verdict9.5/10A must buy for every gamer looking for fun no matter what age.

review: Basic is Beautiful Rocket League is a basic yet a complex game Concept wise it is pretty simple you have 2 Goals and a ball you can already see where this is going but don't be fooled by the simplicity because you are Controlling an R/C Car that has a Rocket booster attached to it which you can use to fly and make acrobatic plays with a Rank up &amp unlock system Let's Dive Deeper Pros Very Intuitive You Don't need a sporting background to enjoy or understand the game Friendly community Extremely fun! Has Casual &amp Competitive Options And Matches Ranging from 1v1's to the Chaotic 4v4's Full Controller Support Cross platform play (PS4 HUGE player base Crazy addictive / has the "One more game" Charm to it. Runs on the Unreal engine Great Graphics Cons. Servers are a little bit Wonky Lack of Content i know that they release the DLC but i'm frankly not sure if the new Customizations/Cars are worth the Money Game issues where you can't rejoin a game if you disconnected from it Verdict It's a Simple Masterpiece and a classical example that games don't need to be complicated they just need to be fun it has some rough edges but these problems can be annoying sometimes but they're not enough to bring this game down. Rating 8.8/10

review: At the time of me first getting the game and posting this things may change such as fixes..(pros)+Really fun+Addictive with unlockables and ranked+competitive ranked play+You can have fun by both try hrading or just messing around+Its non stop action keeps you engaged+replay value+multiplayer (with friends)(cons) There is currently a bug where if you are in a party the owner will enter the game but some/all otehr party members wont. There is only 2v2 ranked for peopel who want to play with friends so if u want to play with up to 3 4 people online the only way is normals because you can only solo ranked for 3v3. The servers quite honestly at the moment are pretty bad about every 1/3 games the server will be bad and then the game is unplayable because you cannot control your vehicle or the ball because you slide around randomly. not able to invite people cross platform (not a massive con as most games are unable to do this)I would reccomend buying this game as it is one of the funest and most enjoyable games i have played in a while. Yes there are soem bugs currently that ruin the game but it is still worth playing even through these bugs so when the servers are better and the host bug is fixed this game is a must have.

review: Over 250 hours in now and this is still the game that keeps giving. I don't see myself stopping soon. Whatever price this game happens to be it's more than worth it.This is the kind of game you go to play 10 minutes of and wind up playing until 3AM when you should have been in bed hours ago. It is now the only game I play consistently and it is consistently fun never a chore.As a bonus Psyonix are some of the coolest devs around. Most of their updates have been great so far and it looks like they'll continue to be that way. They listen to their fans.The only complaint I have at the moment is that the report button seems to do nothing. It's a minor complaint.

review: I'm here to tell you all about the positions in Rocket League.Striker You're job is to score goals and keep the ball on the opponents side.But whatever you do DON'T MISS A SHOT. You will be hated on until you want to uninstall. If you score a goal hope you don't have that one guy who spams "What A Save" after every goal. You will get hate.MidField Most People don't even know that this is a position. You're job is to keep the ball from going too far back. You want to try and set up your Strikers for goals.Unfortunately the second you miss an Ariel or any hit you're going to get hate.But it feels so good when you hit an Ariel. So keep calm and waste that boost.Goalie/Keeper This is probably the most important positions in the game.You're job is to keep the ball out of your net and to clear it up to your midfielders.But be warned the opponents and sometimes your own team will constantly run into you and get in your way.Missing a Save results in a goal and your opponents getting real mad at you. Oh and don't be that guy who gets the best spawn and stays back. Just don't. Well that's it. My review on Rocket League. Hopefully this boosts your interest in the game. Frost.

review: Ahhh. Rocket League a game recommended by my friends. To be perfectly honest it's probably one of the best games i've played so far it can be competitive and it can be a fun game to mess about. Though one thing that needs to be adressed is the RL servers. Over the recent couple of weeks they have been going down or became overloaded with mass amounts of people playing at the same time. Thanks to the developers there are no problems with the RL servers recently so that's good. D All i am going to say is that the developers of the game' psyonix' are doing a great job at updating the game by improving its aesthetics performance and overall gameplay. keep it up! One thing i love about RL is the humour(or salt in some cases) of the quickchat (Nice Shot! Great Pass!) all that craic. It's the irony that also makes it a fun game to mess around with your friends and just trigger some players. To finish this review i will be straight the 15.99 did not go to waste it's the hours of my life( you spend too much btw).__________________________________________ I'd give this game a solid 9/10 don't ask why.

review: This game is a blast. I wasn't sure if I would like it because I am not a soccer fan but I was looking for something for my wife and I to co op together and she hates soccer and car games so it took some convincing.You know what she loves it! We played for 3.5 hours last night and we can't wait to play again today. It is so much fun. We are playing with her and I on the same team against bots and it is a blast. title: Rocket League®

review: All the fun and emotions you can imagine with an ordinary soccer game like dreamgoals last second comebacks "kicking" the ball off the line (also accidentely of the enemy's goal D) combined with the fun of a fast arcarde racing game. In the beginning you will be laughing your off only at the look of the small cars jumping and spinning around often out of control trying to prevent the ball from rolling into the goal.Then add the included and important rocket technology which will give you the needed speed advantage over your opponent or enough power for long range shoots or if you have learned it ability to reach balls high in the air. Air control and flying are crucial elements in higher skill areas and certainly raise the skill ceiling a lot. Then there's the possibility of good team play with friends or or your random assigned teammates that can decide a game against equally skilled opponents.The graphics are colorful and well made with nice physic effects especially regarding the visually customizable cars that said the game also runs good on older machines too.Matches are quick (5 minutes maybe + the golden goal like "overtime") you'll find one (1on1 2on2 3on3 4on4) in seconds (!) and you can choose between just for fun mode or elo ranked matchmaking.I really can't find any reason not recommend this game It's good for some in between matches but you will certainly find yourself and your mate(s) saying "just one more we cant stop just now" and shortly after an hour will have passed by..Now that I've already had so much fun with I can fairly say it's become one of my few alltime favorite games!
title: Rocket League®

review: My video review for the game https //www.youtube.com/watch?v Qk_Sri2SK6IPRESENTATIONRocket League has all the polish of a full triple A release but still with the price point of a normal indie game. Unreal engine 4 makes this game an absolute joy to look at while also still being relatively easy to run. The texture quality is gorgeous down to every last car and stadium. The environments are quite amazing to look at they do a great job of immersing you in the match. Combine that with the sound design of the cars and the crowds and you actually start to think you are inside of the arena driving the car. This game also has some of the best particle effects I ve seen in a game. Every spark every engine trail effect and there are a lot of them just look amazing. This is easily the best looking game I ve seen this year and definitely up there for best looking games I ve ever seen. CONTENTRocket League has enough content to keep entertained for a long long time. With seemingly endless amounts of ways to customize your car including decals boost trails paint colors types of paint wheels HATS and antennas. Add all of those with a good selection of cars you can have millions of different combinations. I ve been playing this game for a long time and I still haven t unlocked everything in the game. Another great thing this game offers is competent AI to play against. Rookie mode gives you an excellent way to practice at the game while All star mode gives a challenge to the experienced Rocket League players. Pick your team in season mode or grab some friends to play online and be entertained for hours. GAMEPLAYRocket League is a very unique game by nature. There are certainly not a lot of car soccer games especially not with boost power ups and jumping cars. Even though there aren t a lot of games like it Rocket League nailed their gameplay. It s an arcade racer at heart which is perfect for the fast paced action of the game. The cars handle very well on the ground gliding on the walls or in the air. The gameplay can be very tactical and team based at times. You have to utilize your boost at the right time you have to make sure you get the right angle on your shots and passes or they will go in every direction but the one you meant. Teamwork is incredibly useful it s the difference between winning big and losing big. The gameplay also takes some unique twist when you add or take away players. You can have 2v2 3v3 or 4v4 or even an unfair mode where you play by yourself against multiple AI players. Overall this game is incredible fun to play with friends or by yourself.
title: Rocket League®

review: "Yo wanna grab a beer and kick some on Rocket League?"That is the kind of game this is I cannot imagine how people can play it for hours on end but I get around 1hr enjoyment a week on this game. The DLC can be quite poor the only one that looked good (personally) was the "Back to the future" DLC. However it is cheap so if you love the game then you will enjoy the add ons they are providing on a monthly basis.8/10 could use some extra functions in game but very entertaining and extremely competitive when with friends.Would recommend.
title: Rocket League®

review: I bought this game because my friends were all hyped about it. I bought it a few days after they did and I am not dissapointed. This game is extremely fun and has hours of competative soccer/car badassery. This game is so fun it makes losing almost an enjoyable experience.Pros Great single player game play Easy to Party up with friends Fast match quesGreat game mechanics and physicsGreat for all age groupsCons Takes about 5 to 10 games to get the hang of positioning boosts and so forthI wish there were more than 2 different camera angle optionsNo penalty for quitting a game The games are 5 minutes and people quitting after being down 2 goals is way to commonNo different game modes (yet)ConclusionGreat game to buy. Its worth every penny. Its one of those games where soring an average goal makes you feel like a boss. Hopefully they add more game types and customizable features. This game exceeded my expectations and I hope that they capitalize on the potential this game has for future development.
title: Rocket League®

review: 'Rocket League' is one the purest multi player games I have ever played. It rewards individual skill teamwork and takes a step away from the upgrade systems we're so used to seeing in competitive multi players. You will not be rewarded with upgrades over time to give you an edge over the competition however you will be given cosmetic upgrades as you progress and build your skill at the game. This promotes skill based team focused gameplay and discourages relying on performance upgrades that you truly haven't earned to best your opponent. It's simply one of the most enjoyable multi player experiences I have ever had. Buy this game. Now. Do it... do it.
title: Rocket League®

review: I'm addicted. As soon as I heard about the game I wanted it. So I got it. But that was back before the beta version for the Mac. I was sad I couldn't play it. As soon as Psyonix released the beta version on sale I got it again. I got my money's worth. The game is absolutely amazing! It deserved 2015 Indie Game of the Year. Sure soccer with cars doesn't sound all that fun but once you try it you just CAN'T STOP. In about a week I've already racked up 20 hours of total play time. Awesome! YOU HAVE TO TRY THIS GAME. review: Very good game. Whether you are looking for a competitive game or something fun to mess around on with friends Rocket league is great. Different game modes like hoops dropshot and rumble add a new fun spin and im sure there are more modes in the works as the game updates regularly. Competitive is optimized well and they are always tweaking it. Competitive can be frustrating but that is the same with any game. Overall i would say this game is a solid 9.5/10. I would change it to 10/10 with more game modes but that is being very nitpicky.
title: Rocket League®

review: Amazing amazing amazing!! This is the best game I own period. Been playing it for 2 years I got it for $9.99 when it first released. It started when I saw my friend playing a game called "Rocket League" at first I had no idea what it was but the title seemed interesting so I had to look up gameplay on YouTube.Cars. Playing. Soccer. I was like...oh man! This game looks pretty good! So I bought it and started playing season mode at first. I still remember I lost my first match with rookie bots 3 1... but man!The first thing I noticed about this game is that the field format is like that of indoor soccer except with no out of bounds and rounded walls so you can ride up them. Having played indoor soccer for real before along with ROBLOX sports that gave me a general feel for positioning I thought it was awesome.This is the best game for someone who has wanted to play competitively but hasn't found something that mimicked the feel of real sports. It is the perfect title for you. I recommend starting out with season mode like I did with bots maybe on rookie for your first match and then set them to Professional that way they will be using boost just like you will.But here's the game's greatest accomplishment Online mode. There hasn't been a game on Steam or Origin or on any other platform period that has had the longevity and competitiveness of this game before. There is a mode for everyone in competitive play 3v3 in a group 2v2 1v1 or 3v3 solo. You can join any of the modes on your own but for 2v2 and 3v3 in groups (called "Standard" in game) I highly recommend you have friends/teammates in a party. Of course there is a casual mode as well but I love to play in a competition context.Every car although some have their differences ("Octane" being the most popular) feel pretty much or nearly the same in terms of handling. There are no real "statistical" advantages with any car wheel or any item a person using the car Octane can be just as good as someone that uses Grog for instance.Some of the cars are DLC you can buy in the DLC section of the game on Steam or inside Rocket League. The amazing thing is the DLC does not provide any advantage to your car. Rocket League is 100% free of any pay to play strategy. The only factor is the skill you have playing the game yourself.There are also "Crates" and "Keys" that have been added about a year ago these offer exclusive items that can only be found inside said crates. The keys cost real money however with enough time you might be able to save up crates to trade to someone for a key. There are websites specialized for finding Rocket League trading including the official /r/RocketLeagueExchange on reddit. There are also specialized sheets you can find for market valuation on the items inside crates measured in keys. I know it has already been mentioned several times in my review but no these also do not provide an advantage to people that have crated items. There are even different modes in casual play for someone who is looking to play a different sport Basketball hockey (the ball is replaced with a puck) and even a specialized "Dropshot" mode where the ball has to be slammed on the ground in order to score.In summary Rocket League is the perfect game for everyone. Those looking for competitive play for rewards at the end of the season or those who just want to have a good game to play together with their friends. I highly recommend this game for me it's filled a competitive void in my life.
title: Rocket League®

Seriously great fun all around.There are ranked modes for the competitive player but also single player experiences and unranked online for the more casual gamer. Psyonix also just added cross platform private matches and plans on adding cross platform online soon which is awesome. I don't know how to recommend this game as highly as it deserves. I had to mutilate my roommates so that I had enough hands to give this as many thumbs up as it deserves.

review: Recommended for all gamers.Fun and addictive best to play with friends. Pros Customizable cars. Unlockable customizables. Variety of maps. Variety of settings you don't have to just play a regular game you can change gravity ball weight ball shape etc. Good soundtrack could use more but not complaining. Keeps you busy for hours. Awesome DLCs.Cons I believe they made it so you can only get some drops if you play online matches rough for those who dislike playing online. Playing online tends to force you to turn your graphics quality basically all the way down depending where you connect. The AI sucks when starting out on Rookie. They tend to score on their own goal. Extremely funny nonetheless.
title: Rocket League®

review: I played this during the free weekend because I was honestly sure I wouldn't like it.But hot digity damn this game is addictive!!I will say as many others have said before me This game feels more like football than football games.Because you control one character yourself! And you have to set up goal chances for your teammates and dribble like nobody's business!I don't usually enjoy football either IRL or in games like FIFA but this game can be enjoyed by anyone doesn't matter if you're not into sports. I will say that knowing the way to set up goal chances as they actually do in real football games really help and just knowing how to move around at all.During the free weekend I went on skype with a friend and all off a sudden we had played for over four hours.You will most likley just keep playing game after game after game.And the server search is so ing fast you won't have time to sip from your drink between matches!All in all love this game!It's extremly fun to play with friends while communicating.Hectic and hella fun!PS When I say "football" I of course mean the real football not Hand egg.
title: Rocket League®

review: First of all from starting using controllers I've handled them wrong having my index fingers on the LT/RT buttons rather than the LB/RB ones. This game once I wanted to evolve my skills further made me overcome the resistance of 15 years of wrong handling to actually start using the controller as it was intended. That being said this is a game that is built on skill but not impossible for anyone. A good matchmaker that eventually allows for even and good matches no matter how skilled you yourself are. Go ranked and get a rating that will set the matchup or play unranked and get set mainly based on your experience the amount of matches you've played in total (I think). The game also includes various options to play by yourself against bots (including a league) and for unranked games if the teams are uneven in number of players a bot will replace until someone else joins. On top of that the DLC's are all about skins basically you can get different cars but there's no difference in performance so there's no pay to win in any way. Overall it's easy enough for some quick enjoyment and if you like you can develop some pretty serious skill and work your way up the ranking system. For the ranked games you start of with 10 games as unranked before you achieve a rank in the appropriate division.For me this game has given very good value for the money and I recommend it strongly.
title: Rocket League®
