review: There is no doubt in my mind this is the perfect game for me. Whenever I want to hit a ball or have nothing else to do this game is what comes first. I have never played a game more defined by "easy to learn hard to master" than this because after almost 300 hours I've still barely scratched the surface of what techniques can be used to win. The addictive nature of the game clearly comes from it's simplicity and with about 100k players on at a time there's no shortage of people to play with. It can run on a potato with ease yet it still looks great on higher end systems.Pros Easy to run Technical prowess off the charts Fluid and smooth gameplay DLC is cheap and is definitely worth it Cars controls and camera can be highly customized Looks great on higher end machines Potato can play with no problem (had an intel hd 620 igpu and still ran fine) Devs communicate with community on r/rocketleagueMixed Community can be toxic at times but like with many popular games it is bound to happen No easy way to obtain crates (unless you want to farm but don't do that)Cons Many items locked behind crates Report system can be abused

review: Over 1000 hours invested now... and Rocket League has fallen into the trap that most games of this era seem to have fallen into. They are growing too fast for their own skin and are trying to juggle too many things at once.When it was launched Rocket League was an extremely solid game that had little to no bugs or glitches or connection problems. It was just a reliable and fun game that I could count on. Now that it has blown up in popularity and has become an offical "E Sport" I feel the developer Psyonix has lost sight of its roots. Like every single solitary game that's available today Rocket League decided that microtransactions in the form of randomly obtainable crates that require keys to open for $1 each was the way it was going to make it's income. This is a good business model with the exception that they don't seem to be focusing on the core aspects of the game anymore namely the rock solid continuity that used to exist in the game before it's extreme popularity. More and more I find myself going for a shot and the ball travels right through my car like it was never there. This is even backed up by the in game replay of goals showing the trail that's left behind the ball after a player makes contact being skewed showing that something happened at that point but was ultimately ignored. The most recent Championship Series had a $250 000USD prize pool which leaves me wondering why they don't spend that money on keeping their servers maintained and in perfect working order. I really do love this game more than any game I've loved in the past and I want to see it continue to grow but I fear Psyonix is on the wrong path currently. They seem to be trying to emulate Counter Strike Global Offensive with the way they are doing things now. Focused more on creating more avenues for microtransactions than actually ensuring their game is playable by the people who will keep coming back.All in all still a fantasic game and I will still try to keep a positive attitude towards the future of this game. I just hope they realize that theres more to it than microtransactions. 80hrs later and I finally write a review of this one. If you haven't played it yet then just do. It's such a fantasic game I can't even explain it in words. Sure I hear you "It's soccer with cars" and yeah you're right. BUT! It's soooo much more than just than. If you're either a soccer fan a car fan OR BOTH you'll know that neither is simple yet both are awesome in their own right! So imagine that both are super awesome and are colliding like 2 huge galaxies of epicness making a massive spectical of amazing..... that's Rocket League. Buy it. Play it. Love it. See you in game D
title: Rocket League®

review: I never expected this game to be as good as it is. At the surface it looks like a football game with cars that would get boring after 30 min but it doesn't. Even though the levels are pretty much the same and the cars can only be upgraded on their cosmetics its the simplicity and depth that make this game shine. Matches of 5 minutes make the game very intense and scoring some skill goals or blocking some insane shots are satisfying. For me its worth the price. Definitely recommend this hidden gem.

review: Rocket League is a highly addictive game due to its mix of football and cars it isnt specific in its audience so anyone can enjoy it. Car customization is great allowing for a unique player look. It is quick to pick up and it takes time to build up the skill to be great at timing your shots and doing tricks etc. I would say that it is more of a game you would play for half an hour or so rather than long runs as it can get repetitive but it takes time for the novelty to wear off and it is something I seriously recommend playing for a laugh with friends.

review: Rocket League is easily one of the best games of 2015. I've never had this much fun in a game in awhile. Rocket League brings something totally new to the table soccer with RC cars. Pure Genius.Rocket League is such a simple game to learn but such a hard game to master. There are tons of different moves you can learn how to do and master. It would seem by the idea of hitting a huge ball with an RC car that is all a bunch of randomness but there actually is a method to all this madness. Rocket League also does have a ranking system there are ranked games and un ranked games. You also have your own personal level that classifys you as either a Rookie Semi Pro Pro Veteran Expert Master Legend and finally the Rocketeer.Rocket League also offers tons of different visual upgrades for your cars thatr you can earn by completing games. There are many different types of bodies to choose from as well as different boost trails flags toppers different types of paints and decals.Rocket League offers so much content for such a low price and has many different DLC to get also which can improve your experience even more. Rocket definitely deserves a 10/10 and a recommended from me!

review: Product received for free. Rocket League is an amazing game. You should totally buy it if you have the money. Even though I don't have it I will buy it if the price goes down. Otherwise 20$ is a little expensive for me but most people in this world are rich so they will probably buy it right away. Once you get good at the game it's totally fun but if you are new to this game and keeep on ball chasing then it may not be as fun. You need to be willing to put time into this game but if you can't put that much time into this game then don't buy it. I really reccomend a controller because it ehances your experience. Keyboard and mouse was very confusing controls but that's just me.
title: Rocket League®

review: Even if you don't care about sports or racing this game is so fast paced and zany that you can't help but want to play one more match. It can be difficult to pick up at first and I really do recommend you do the practice sessions first so you can acquaint yourself with how to move your vehicle around the best way. You'll probably fumble a lot trying to hit the ball at all let alone accurately. The great thing about this game though is that it's always fun even if you suck. Playing the game with friends is highly recommended too as it absolutely doubles the fun and I really like how matchmaking takes parties into account to assure you'll be on the same team as your friends in online play.The one thing that I'll complain about is that the AI can still do really dumb things even if you're playing at higher skill levels I have seen some bots just casually drive the ball into their own goal for no reason. It can be quite frustrating to play offline if you're essentially carrying your team.I should also mention that if you're ever starting to get bored of the standard arenas I highly recommend you try some of the rocket lab arenas to completely change things up. It seems right now that not many people play on them but I promise you they are worth it and demand a whole new strategy and style of play.

review: I hesitated a long time before buying this game i thought how fun can playing soccer with rocket cars really be?The answer was A whole lot of ing fun.It is easy to pick up hard to master. Beginners will have fun but when you start pulling off crazy moves like rocket jumps and saves it gets pretty exciting. The game has tons of unlockables to keep you interested but honestly it's just extra because the gameplay is where this game really shines. It's fun to play alone but a blast to play with friends plus it has split screen co op if you have multiple controllers and while you can play with a mouse and keyboard i highly suggest using a controller.Graphically the game looks amazing sharp graphics and effects vibrant colors. Plus it is optimized really well i'm pretty sure you could run this game on a microwave.Don't think my 11 hours played mean anything i bought the game 2 weeks ago and i'm going to keep coming back to it for a long time. It's a nice change of pace from killing stuff and shooting people in the head.Do yourself a favor and buy this okay?

review: Rocket League is super fun for everyone! It can be as rewarding and challenging as you and your teammates make it for yourselves. Learning to fly is the best part and it pays off with great shots and the sort of big memorable highlights (of teamwork or that solo goal) that make playing rocket car soccer somehow seem way more exciting than it should be. As someone who is not into sports games I was pleased to have this to play with my friends. Some complaints would be the server issues so far and the grouping system. As well as some of the very frustrating traits of the AI. But all in all 5/5 D

review: This game has grown a lot from the bottom to the top. Its so addicting!! It needs a lot of practice tought. But once you get it done you can score some good goals like i have! Also if you want to learn things quick you can watch videos that help you a lot! Those guides will help you out there. And if you want to watch entertaining videos check our JHZER's youtube channel! He does some overpowered stuff. There are more things to do aswell! You can open crates and get stuff to costumize your car with. If you want to give your friend a useless item you can trade him the item. You can also buy dlc's that give new cars and costumasation. Buy the game. You will love it and you will meet new friends to play with!
title: Rocket League®

review: Fair warning I was mostly just thinking out loud when I wrote this down .Seriously there's zero learning curve. (XBOX 360 controller) So to perform a proper kick flip in rocket league you hit A to jump angle yourself by pressing forwards or back on the joystick and hitting A again. For an air boost. if you're ever out of boost simply kick flipping repeatedly can get you going just as fast as full boost and in a shorter distance.I thought a kick flip was just a front flip until I experimented with it. Pvp is stupid easy if you kick flip all over the place. Someone added me to steam earlier cause "you play like a lunatic" Apparently it's not normal to see someone kick flipping for boost speeds and blocks or shots. I have yet to run into someone who uses their full boost at first ball and kick flip into it.10/10 so far able to get first touch by kick flipping out of boost. Sometimes I get solid goals out of first touch cause they don't expect that kind of power behind the ball. Kick flipping straight out of boost is so OP. You can basically travel with the ball and air whip it with x a second time to shoot it anywhere you want. People leave so quick when they see it. The rage is real.I thumbs up this game cause it's a lot of fun the challenge is decent the graphics are pretty and the gameplay is top notch. I will however voice that I wish there weren't so many people who shoot the ball into our own goal. I mean c'mon guys...
title: Rocket League®

review: This is by far my favorite multiplayer game on any platform. I first took site of this game in september of 2015 when i saw it basically "storm" the youtube gaming page so i looked and saw it was only on Playstation/PC. I was distraught because I only had an xbox at the time. I wanted to see if there was a way to port it over but no dice. I eventually just decided to wait until I had enough money to buy a gaming pc so i did. D around january I had enough from christmas with the relatives and my savings to buy an Alienware and what was the first thing I did? Sent it back because it had a faulty server connector but what did I do when i got the second computer? I went onto steam and got Rocket league D I played it for I believe 10 hours before going to bed then playing it again the next morning. I played it for about a month when low and behold Rocket League comes out on Xbox which both made me mad and made me laugh. I had JUST got the game (for a month or so). I just laughed it off and played more and more. I got enough money to buy all the dlc (all except NBA flags which wasnt out at the time but who cares). The game has gotten better ever since with hoops Rocket Labs more cars more maps more awesomeness! This game gets an 11/10... ney a 6 stars out of 5... ney an "I r8 9/8" from a tumblr addict.... NEY it gets my gratitude and my respect (plus all the stuff i said and a thumbs up recommendation). This game has inspired me to make a trickshot vine (It's_MagicRL) to which im not very good but I'm at least trying and I have hit decent things. I love this game and I dont think I'll ever stop playing it. Cheers! D It's_Magic/MagicBraden1

You go into casual with lvl 1 and you are gonna get called a noob even tho you have never played this game before.Pros Pretty graphics car customizations and colors of trails competitive matchmaking Not only soccer/football but basketball hockey and loads of gamemodes Download custom created map types or create your own 1v1 2v2 3v3 4v4Cons The community is bad like in CS GO seriously these guys will make fun of how you play even if you just started to play it in casual you make one wrong move and your mate will leave the game immediately saying "noob mate gg"Buy this game only if you want to be very competitive and can handle other teamˇs trash talk. Rating 8/10

The system they have for finding a game is really good. You normally get into a game in around a minute or two. Overall a very good game just wish they wouldn't make the DLC's 2 Dollars EACH jeez Rocket league.

review: Devo's dropping the mike...AGAIN!http //steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id 619868298Title Information Review Title Rocket League Review Date 9th of February 2016 PC Release Date 7th of July 2015 Developer Psyonix Publisher Psyonix Genre Sports Series NA (Previously made title Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket Powered Battle Cars) Single Player Yes training/bots Multiplayer Yes Ratings Category Score Story NA Single Player Gameplay 10/10 Multiplayer Gameplay 10/10 Graphics &amp Art Style 7/10 Replayability 9/10 Overal Rating 9/10 (See bottom of the page for ranking descriptions)Devo's Seal of Approval? Yes absolutely. Anyone who is interested in a multiplayer focused sports game that is easy to learn but difficult to master is in for a treat! This game will be living in my Favourites list for quite some time.PROS Easy to learn but difficult to master Great tutorials A great physics engine A challenging yet rewarding multiplayer experience Huge variation in avatar customisation Addictive short games Ample game type variation Both ranked and casual playlists Season events Free post release content CONS As with all online titles this one is not exempt from running into faces CONCLUSIONS...An exceptional game. Worthy of either investing in seriously and attempting to master the game mechanics while competing in seasonal events or to just play casually by yourself or with friends. Rocket League truly is in the league of other E Sports titles and receives regular updates free and paid for content and has seasonal events. Rocket League has it where it counts gameplay gameplay gameplay with a huge helping of replayability.http //steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id 619868458http //steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id 619868539_______________________RANKING DESCRIPTIONS Score Description 1 This pile of c%$p made me want to take a break from gaming! 2 Avoid this title like a fat man on a diet avoids cake. 3 Why did they even bother? Oh wait...they didn't so niether should you. 4 I wouldn't play this unless I was really really desperate or the biggest fan alive. 5 While there are some interesting aspects of this title there are just too many faults to recommend it to anyone. 6 An "average" title which has some redeeming qualities however be warned that it also has its fair share of flaws... 7 A good game and it probably shouldn't be missed by fans of the series or genre but be warned there are better games out there which are more deserving of your time and money. 8 An excellent title which shouldn't be missed if you can help it. I found it hard to put this game down and I hope you do too. 9 A master piece! As close to perfect as any title can get. You are truly missing out on an unbelievable gaming experience if you do not play this game. 10 PERFECT. Nothing more needs to be said All ratings and opinions expressed in this review are subjective and therefore are effected in part by my own preferences &amp predisposiitons. I have not received any gifts or gratuities from any party for this work.

Line up at the start. The running speed starts slowly but gets faster each minute after you hear this signal. beep A single lap should be completed each time you hear this sound. ding Remember to run in a straight line and run as long as possible. review: Rocket League is a fantastic game simple as that. As a whole the community you find is generally supportive the devs are kind and the product is unbeatable. I can't say enough good things about RL from the matchmaking to the customization to the indescribable feeling of joy when you hit that Long Pool Shot in Overtime to take the win for your team... it is exhilarating. The learning curve is steep but you can FEEL yourself getting better and making plays that you wouldn't have been able to make just a few hours prior.It is absolutely without a doubt worth the $20 price point and you will get way more out of it than some $60 main titles.**I would highly reccomend picking this game up during the fall sale! An absolute steal at just over 10 dollars. The new item and crate system is very simple and fair and it supports awesome events like the RLCS which I for one greatly enjoy. With the new rumble mode arena and achievements there is always something new to do because the game is still under expansion and everything is done perfectly. I have since recruited three friends into playing as well... and that is pretty extraordinary.

More maps and variety of terrain boost points proportions and numbers of players. Bouncing ball / random sideways moving ball starts to reduce the repetitiveness of the dash and crash deadball start. Personalised / unique car customisation.

review: Oh Rocket League the game I love more than I love my son. Maybe that's because I don't have a son.Everything I hate about it makes me love it more.Football (soccer for the ones who think that fahrenheit feet inches and miles are valid options of measuring things) and cars.Football and cars are made for middle aged people whos having a midlife crisis and recently got a divorce so they drench their sorrow in those things they watch people half their age playing football and are fullfilling things they never would.Or they watch other middle aged brits driving fast cars like they are teenagers.Those things I really do not like like at all but when its combined in such a way as Rocket League it makes it interesting and fun.10/10

review: I have read some of the reviews complaining about matchmaking. Some are right there are times where you go against people who are really good and have a higher rank but that has not been a reason (at least for me) to not enjoy the game. I play with friends most of the time and I think that's the best way to play it but still if you play solo you can still have fun or eventually find people and make friends to play together. Overall this a fun game to play while you learn how to get better everytime.9/10Update Been playing this for almost a year now I think and it is still super awesome. They make new maps new skins and stuff. I always have a lot of fun! and it has a lot of people playing which is good.

review: Great game you really should try Apple Pie. RecPIE For the filling1kg Bramley apples140g golden caster sugar½ tsp cinnamon3 tbsp flourFor the pastry225g butter room temperature50g golden caster sugar plus extra2 eggs350g plain flour preferably organicsoftly whipped cream to serve ( Really recomend the whipped cream)1.Put a layer of paper towels on a large baking sheet. Quarter core peel and slice the apples about 5mm thick and lay evenly on the baking sheet. Put paper towels on top and set aside while you make and chill the pastry.For the pastry beat the butter and sugar in a large bowl until just mixed. Break in a whole egg and a yolk (keep the white for glazing later). Beat together for just under 1 min it will look a bit like scrambled egg. Now work in the flour with a wooden spoon a third at a time until it s beginning to clump up then finish gathering it together with your hands. Gently work the dough into a ball wrap in cling film and chill for 45 mins. Now mix the 140g/5oz sugar the cinnamon and flour for the filling in a bowl that is large enough to take the apples later.After the pastry has chilled heat the oven to 190C/fan 170C/gas 5. Lightly beat the egg white with a fork. Cut off a third of the pastry and keep it wrapped while you roll out the rest and use this to line a pie tin 20 22cm round and 4cm deep leaving a slight overhang. Roll the remaining third to a circle about 28cm in diameter. Pat the apples dry with kitchen paper and tip them into the bowl with the cinnamon sugar mix. Give a quick mix with your hands and immediately pile high into the pastry lined tin.Brush a little water around the pastry rim and lay the pastry lid over the apples pressing the edges together to seal. Trim the edge with a sharp knife and make 5 little slashes on top of the lid for the steam to escape. (Can be frozen at this stage.) Brush it all with the egg white and sprinkle with caster sugar. Bake for 40 45 mins until golden then remove and let it sit for 5 10 mins. Sprinkle with more sugar and serve while still warm from the oven with softly whipped cream.Recipe from Good Food magazine October 2004
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League just scratches that itch y'know? It hits that point of bite sized gameplay that's not too long to get boring but long enough to feel satisfying. Then it takes that bite size polishes the ever loving hell out of it and publishes it.I believe that most people will enjoy this game. I have never enjoyed Football Cars or highly competitive games and yet when the three are combined in this mental moshpit of a video game it just works.Is it worth 15? It might not seem that way at face value but if you trust the game enough to buy it you'll recieve an incredibly rewarding and hilariously satisfying game that you can just keep coming back to.It's not without it's negatives. The AI although challenging to entry level players becomes hilariously inept after a good 50 or so hours in and I do disapprove of the crate and key system but my hundreds of hours in game should prove that it hasn't really bothered me enough to make me stop playing.Rocket League is fast paced addictive and definitely worth picking up ESPECIALLY on sale!

review: After playing this game for 2 years across PC and PS4 the fact that I've never written a review is a real tragedy. Not that this game needs any more endorsements but it by far the most fun game I've ever played in my 22 years of gaming. There are so many great things about this game and I'm not that into sports. The sheer amount of ways to play this game are incredible and I don't feel like it ever gets old. Flying around the field trying to hit a ball seems mundane but it once you get the hang of flying it becomes so much more. I follow this game as an e sport I watch pros play it when I can't I play it with my son and I generally think about it when I'm not playing it. The biggest criticism I'd have of it is the crate system. I'm not a huge fan of gambling and trying to get a crate with something good in it is like trying to win the lottery. The drop rates are so low that you'd be better off just trading keys with other people for items you really want. But lately I've just been playing stock cars because flashy items don't make you play better. This game is constantly getting updated with new stuff and the stadiums are always free. They support is very good and I don't foresee myself leaving the game any time soon.

review: Rocket League is a game that I didn't even know that I wanted.The games premise couldn't be more simple play a game of soccer while piloting a car with a rocket booster strapped to the back. While that may look and sound gimmicky from the outside I can all but guarantee you just five minutes of game play with your favorite controller will turn even the most stubborn skeptic into a believer.The game succeeds because it is easy enough for anybody to pick up and play but the unbelievable skill ceiling will keep you coming back to it. Since the game is entirely physics based your demonstration of timing and skill will be what sets you apart from your opponents. If you play enough you will actually feel yourself becoming a better player.The game features a quick play option as well as a robust ranked competitive play option. And if you don't feel like competing against other players the game also has a "season" mode where you can play by yourself or with AI teammates against other AI teams in a tournament style system.With a dozen different cars and (potentially) hundreds of cosmetic items you can even customize your car to fit your unique personality.There's a reason you've heard about this game. You can believe the hype 100%. And if you haven't heard of this game do yourself a favor and pick it up. In a world of pixel based RPGs and repetitive first person shooters Rocket League is refreshing palette cleanser for your library.EDIT it's roughly six months later and I still think this game is amazing.
title: Rocket League®

review: This game is truely amazing. At first when you start playing its hard to follow and even hit the ball. Many own goals will pass (and still they will come at a higher level) once you figure out the controls and how to hit the ball in your advance. Then comes the first goal. Feels amazing doesnt it? It will only get better from now. Its when you make a series of goals that you think i could do this prettier...There where goals are are goalies to defend the goal from happening. It might be even more important to keep goals from happening on your side than to score on the opposite site. Hitting the ball out of the goal isnt enough the opponement might still be able to hit the ball you just cleared towards the goal unsaveable for you... shame... The trick is to not only defend the goal but also to defend the rebound. Its always easier to keep a tie than to work your way up from a possible defeat. This defending however might require the following Aerial gameplay comes in now. Not only hitting the ball in the air but using that hit to your advance to play to a teammate or perhaps even to yourself that you will continue the aerial play. Defending aerially isnt too hard... Just try to shoot at your own goal but way too hard and high works for me every time.Now that skill is aquired you can perfect those skills to your advance and work your way up the ranked ladder to eventually hit grand champion. Every win feels deserved (kind of) and every loss... well a loss. Be mindfull of your teammates as they can be a little unpredictable.After 1300 hours i can truely say that i enjoy the game and still look forward to play a game every single day.

review: I had this game for the free weekend I noticed a few bugs and glitches while playing it. For starters if you are playing rumble and get the spike power up if you catch the ball on the side of your car you cannot move. Another one is if you happen to get disconnected from a game and you are in a party if the game becomes full you have to leave the party and join back in. If you try to wait it will show that you are not in the party and you cantuse the group chat also. The last thing I found was if you are using a controller and you accidentely hit one of the keys on the keyboard your car will stop working with the controller you have to go to the menu and hit controls than hit any button on the controller for it to work. Overall the game was very well set up and designed and I would definetly buy it (if i wasnt a broke scrub)

review: What is a review if not the writer's personal opinion on the subject so here's what I think about this game after //30'something hours later into it. Started to get used with the standard mouse+keyboard controls it's possible to play that way and have fun so don't get dissapointed if you don't have a gamepad. Kept on playing with the Ice Charger DLC car I got so used to it I simply switch it to other car without having a feeling weird. But... I'm starting to get irritated by some things that keep happening... The item drops for example. I did get a nice pair of wheels and booster from that pay to open boxes but that's ALL that I can use on my car from like 10 boxes I've opened so far. Also most of the time I get these common items again and again and again. The rewarding system feels empty after a while.Also the player base... I mean rarely you find someone that curses in the chat but every time you have that player in the team that hits your car all the time f**ks up your shots and your experience over all. I'm getting tired of that please if you read this be carefull about your team mates.

review: Rocket League is a great game because of two reasons. First is that the game itself is fun to play for both newbies and experts. More importantly though is that Psyonix is a great company. It seems that everytime I think of something that would make the game better it gets added. "Sure would be nice to get infinte boost or change the ball for some silly games"Psyonix Done"I would like to choose different hats skins and boostes depending on which team I'm on."Psyonix Done"Man being able to make and share training courses or even have community maps would be awesome."Psyonix DoneAnd that doesn't even cover half of all that Psyonix has added to the game since release. Rocket League is one amazing game because Psyonix is one amazing company and I buy every DLC regardless of if I'll play that car because I want to keep supporting them and letting them know to keep up the great work.

review: +Great graphics and visual effects+A wide range of customisation options unlocked as you complete matches+There's a season mode if you wish to play solo so you don't have to just play exhibition games repeatedly the season mode is actually pretty good and features a number of different options which make it more interesting+Local multiplayer supports up to four players (providing you have enough controllers)+A number of different maps each with several time and weather variations+Cross platform multiplayer with PS4 players (though the party system currently doesn't work when doing cross platform matches)+Rocket League features some quick messages which get assigned to your controller's hat switch allowing you to communicate quickly with your teammates+You can save the replays of your matches to watch back later+Obviously it has full controller support for 360 controllers as well as Xbox One controllers and the controls are fantastic+It's even entertaining for those of us who aren't keen on playing sports games+Your car's top speed is considerably higher on a pitch made of tarmac compared to a grass pitch it's not a major feature but it's certainly a nice touch+As mentioned earlier you can play unbalanced matches when playing offline exhibition they provide and extra layer of challenge and are great fun when playing local multiplayer

review: Awesome game if you have like 400h to spend on. You really feel your progress mostly at the beginning and it's always great to manage the first cool moves &amp aerials.You can also make a match with different options like square balls boost x10 etc hell lots of fun incoming !Defaults the people (lotsa taunts swearing but meh just 10 0 the outta'em and it's ok) and unranked where people come and leave without warning. Better play ranked when you have learnt the basics.Excellent jeu sur lequel passer plusieurs centaines d'heures (fa ci le) bonne courbe de progression on progresse vraiment d'heure en heure au début et c'est toujours jouissif de faire des moves de fou ses premiers aerials et j'en passe. Possibilité également de faire des matchs en changeant les paramètres genre ballon carré boost x10 des barres de rire en perspective !Dans les défauts la commu est pas toujours top (beaucoup de taunts les insultes sont pas rares suffit de bloquer les rageux ou de leur coller 10 0) et le mode non ranked voit souvent des gens arriver et partir sans prévenir. Donc je conseille de jouer classé une fois les bases apprises
title: Rocket League®

review: Game about rocketpowered near to fully customisizable cars playing over the top soccer with non of the usual rule strings attached. It's a blast. Singleplayer offers Training/Exhibition and a long Season mode against bots who are actually fun to play against. Played 1v1 2v2 3v3 (standard and in my opinion best) 4v4.Multiplayer ist the meat of the game though. Creating parties lobbies with friends or juust playing with random people works amazingly well. Left open spots can be filled with bots. This game allows cross platform play between PC and PS4.Worth the 20$ asking price and FREE on PSPlus if you are inclined that way and just want to try it out or play it for 2 hours with the Steam Refund Policy. It should not disappoint people one of the most fun games of 2015 yet.
title: Rocket League®

review: I remember playing soccer once and it was amazing. I was on a run on the counter attack breaking ankles and hearts left and right when out the cut I see this 6' 7" 300 lb MF come at and slide tackle me. Along with getting the ball he got my virginity and my legs. I had to go see the doctor and the doctor slowly said I'm sorry but we are going to have to amputate your legs. At the moment my heart was crushed just like my legs and I started to cry like a lil . But however when I got home my friend told me about this game called Rocket League. I was like what is a "Rocket" what is a "League" he told me to buy this game because it was on sale and I said oh well if I can't use my feet might as well use my hands for better things besides busting nuts. When I first got into the game I knew exactly what I wanted to be. I wanted to be a CAR. I found the game so exciting and the concept was so thrilling that I wanted to be the game itself. As we are speaking right now I'm having a engine surgically put in where my heart should be and in 10 months I'm having my final big operation so that I can transform into my dream car the Merc.
title: Rocket League®

review: I love rocket league... its a sad day because up until 2 weeks ago i couldnt get enough. I know this post wont fix anything but i feel like i need to do something because my heart is broken. Until recently this game has been my favorite game of all time and i wanted to make a run at playing competitive. i have around 44 ping in every game but the "rubber banding" has made the game unplayable i have great internet and "specs" on my computer are solid af but im still experiencing some serious packet loss in this game alone. I dont know if it was a recent update or if the servers are on thier way out but it used to run perfectly and now i cant play the game at any competitve level. I say this in hopes that if this is a problem others are experiencing and it is in fact not on my end. than the boys and girls in charge of this game will make an effort to fix this problem. I'll put this game over any other game ive played in all of my time on this earth but unfortunately its unplayablity has made it a dead game for me. Otherwise thank you for the fun and i would reccomend anyone to get this game.

review: When my friend recommended a game that involved both football (soccer) and cars two things I'm lukewarm about at best I figured this game might be fun for a couple hours and then would be forgotten in the depths of my Steam library like some artifact that an underpaid archaeologist might find amongst all the other garbage and waste. So flash forward to 37 hours of gameplay at this posting and...I was wrong.I'm not in the habit of giving games 10/10 reviews. In fact I can't think of a single game deserving of a 10/10 aside from those gilted by the mystical touch of nostalgia. The thing is though that Rocket League sets out to do one thing one simple thing and it does it perfectly. There are elements to the game that I find superfluous like the add on car bundles and different game modes (but I can avoid those). However the physics of the ball and vehicles are top notch and the multiplayer experience is absolutely spot on. Playing with friends is a blast particularly when you come up against some whiner that decides that the best option when loosing 5 to 3 is to rage quit in the last 10 seconds. That's ace. Few games have such memorable moments of scoring ridiculous goals or making a crazy series of events transform into something unexpected and wonderful. It's the only game I've bothered saving a replay of for instance.Anyway there are other things to be said but if you need much more prodding just think about the productive things you COULD be doing instead of playing this game and then be like me procrastinate and tell yourself 'just one more round'.
title: Rocket League®

review: I would really appreciate if you guys switched this game to F2P any my opinion doesnt count but here's why I would happily sacrafise the 60 dollars I paid at released (I bought 3 copies) for the amount of players to rise. This is a very selfish want of mine it's simply because I want the upper hand on the new then competitors. I'll continue to buy the new cars and keys. Happily. )To aspiring new players this game is a lot like martial arts. You'll become hooked on the feeling of improvement you get and you won't ever stop. This game is one of my favorite games of all time to play online.

review: Rocket League. It's safe to say that the boldness of those behind this game pulled through magnificently. One of the most enjoyable friendliest and team encouraging games on the market ever since release. A drawing board concept which two years ago would've made triple A developers wince at such a game.Witty far fetched shiny and above all charming. Who would've thought giant car football could be so wonderfully welcomed in today's generation. For the price gameplay and playability (both specs wise and game wise) alone this $15 piece of gold studded originality can and should be cherished by all ages.

review: For start I recommend it to everyone. It is not age restricted literally anyone can have fun with it. It's just like a sport. No money involved no "pay to win" / "no pay no play" an that stuff. Sure you can buy items to look better but no items affect the game. As I said it's like a sport meaning the more you practice the better you get so the game is fair and everyone is equal. Mostly for that reason I love it because the only thing that defines your skill is the number of hours played and practiced. Every match is 5 minutes of pure fun unless you're salty in which case I recommend you some fries instead of game lol. The only thing I dislike is community because the vast majority playes the mind tricks trying to get you angry so that you can't perform at best but that's not developer's fault so no problem there with the game itself just the people who can't really have fun. Remember it's a game it's meant to bring people together to smile together. If you're looking for fun and not being 100% competitive always this is a game for you! Enjoy it!

review: The joy of Rocket League rests on the countless plans that are conceived and discarded every other second in any given match. Trying to predict where and how the ball will bounce next is a game within the game. Despite the use of cars Rocket League emulates the emotional surges typical of The Beautiful Game such as the rush of an unexpected fast break or a well timed header into a goal. With Rocket League the promising concept of combining two wonderful things cars and soccer is equally magnificent in execution. You can't say the same thing about say combining cake and fruit to make fruitcake it is in a league of its own. Extremeley enjoyable both solo or with friends.

And trust me once you start to consistently hit aerials and start to score some "sick" goals you're definetely not going to stop soon.Long story short If you wanna play soccer but you're tired of FIFA then this is a real nice approach on football highly skill and team oriented and here for hours over hours of enjoyment. Give it a try if it's not yours you'll see it in the first hours already so you're still able to give it back and get your money.

review: Rocket League is a quality game that everyone can have fun on. I picked up the game a year ago and I can say that im addicted to this game. First may I say that the game is a very different experience when you play with a different skill group. Starting off from most shots being taken off the ground to crazy aerial shots being taken! The more you play the more you will become better. There is dlc addons etc but it hardly has an effect on the gameplay. It's mostly for looks or if your just collecting all of the battle cars/decals. The community (for the most part) is friendly but a few times you could run into somebody who has a bit of a "character" but thats any online game. Personally this game is really good and i would rate it 9/10.

review: DISCLAIMER This game is amazing +recommend for the unique concept of car soccer and endless customization options. However what's not so great is players like me. I'm the one your friends foretold of when you were considering getting this game the one who you will either carry to victory or tell them they're **** when you inevitably lose the match. I will try my hardest to pass the ball to you or make a shot on the goal but unless I'm extremely lucky it will always up in the hands of the opposing team or in our own goal. There will also be times when you're about to make a shot on the goal and I'll try to prevent the other team from knocking it out of the way and end up doing that myself. Sometimes I'll even attempt an aerial hit but will miss the ball by mere centimeters and be left scrambling for boost while the other team sets up a shot. Don't even think about passing the ball to me either my extreme case of hesitation will result in the ball either flying past me or going straight to the other team. If we ever cross paths I apologize in advance that you couldn't get a better teammate. 10/10 I'm a disgrace _

I've added quite a few friends to my friends list just from playing this game... It's addictive it's fun and I also like how you can do 4 player local split screen and then go online and play against 4 other players for an ultimate match of 4vs4... This game is flexible for multiplayer on so many levels and with the ability to customize your game and change variables it never gets old. BUY Rocket League you'll never regret it!

review: At the time of this review I currently own 742 games in my library. About 95% are games I got for dirt cheap from a Steam sale (or other) or part of a Humble Bundle (or other). If there was a recent release I would get it discounted from GMG. However If there were ONE game I would pay FULL price for this would be it!Ever since it's release I noticed it was consistently #1 at the Top Sellers in the Store. Decided to research it and watch some videos. Was immediately intrigued by the concept of cars playing soccer. Based on all the postive feedback and reviews I immediately purchased it and zero regrets after. It's ridiculously FUN and can easily be played it short bursts due to the 5 minute matches. It's easy to learn but hard to master the physics and whatnot of the advanced aerial shots but so satisfying when you pull off a crazy goal or save.I highly recommend to anyone that enjoys fun multiplayer games. The polish and quality reminds me of a AAA Nintendo game. The ability to play against PS4 players is pretty cool too. I won't hold my breath at being able to create Parties with friends on PS4 but it's definitely better than being separate. You can play with your friends in a party of 4 or if they're cheapskates you can play locally with 4 player splitscreen as well. Aside from server issues from launch and lack of cross platform party creation this game is very well done and worth every penny. That is all.

review: 440+ hours later and I still have not gotten bored of this game. I logged 400 of the hours on a potato laptop so if you are worried about not running it you shouldn't be. I myself have played mostly private matches with a friend on PS4 (a nice addition although you can't have a cross platform party online) and Hoops. If you are on a horrible computer I do not recommend playing in standard or competitive since there are beefy maps such as Neo Tokyo Aquadome and Wasteland. I played Hoops most of the time which helped with aerials and it did not lag. Although I enjoyed playing Hoops and now have a new PC to play the other game modes I wish more people played Hoops and Hockey since they are sort of overlooked. Nonetheless this game is an absolute blast to play and I have no doubt I can get up to 1 000 hours of gameplay now that I can play the other gamemodes easily.

review: Rocket League One of the best online multiplayer games of 2015 and one that took many by surprise including myself. The game gets a solid 9.4/10 rating from me and will stand the test of time as it already has many players online and its community is constantly growing. An absolute must buy! The game has many strong points not limited to but including Very high skill ceillingFun and addictive gameplayGreat matchmaking and overall good netcodeMany customisation optionsMultiple periodic updates of contentPersonally my favourite part of Rocket League is the way it feels once you finally manage to score that awesome aerial goal you've been working at for the past 2 weeks. It feels very satisfying to observe your progress and to become more and more successful. It's also very cool reproducing maneuvers you see from other great players moves you wouldn't even think were possible. Great game. Highly recommend buying it especially if it's on sale.

review: Honestly what can I really say that has not been said before about Rocket League? The game looks silly on the outside but once you start playing it something unexpected happens. It surprises you with being a lot of fun. It's a bloody rocket on a car afterall! Admittedly it's far more fun with friends.The game is simple enough for your casual player to pick up and play and still have fun. At the same time it has a high skill cap... and everything about the game is skill based. None of the unlocks in the game affect how you play. All of it is simply cosmetic which is really neat.I love this fame and highly recommend it.

review: This game takes fifa and turns it upside down into a sport game that can be enjoyed by gamers that can't even stand football. Why? the game is simple. Cars and a football. There are no progression advantages that will make the game easier to play. Therefore the game requires skill and teamwork instead to win instead of micro transactions. Micro transaction are starting to be become the norm with the likes of heroes and generals and war thunder. Game companies could learn a lot from looking at this correct method of implementing micro purchases. I hope the game continues to expand with more beautifully created maps and adding plenty more hours of fun for me.

review: The basic premise sounds pretty terrible. I mean soccer with rocket cars? Dumb. If I had realized what the game was before I bought it (as part of a package with a Steam Controller) I would not have bought it. However having played it I have no regrets. This game is fabulous. The gameplay was beautifully tuned to perfection. Get the game.However it's not perfect. The servers tend to be down or slow more often than other games. And slow servers are a major issue in this game just slightly discernable latency will turn pro players into bumbling idiots.On a side note I strongly recommend a gamepad but the Steam Controller is a poor fit for this game. The controller just feels too clunky in my hands and I perform noticeably worse when playing on it than when using a PS4 controller. Get a PS4 controller and just plug it into your PC with a USB cable it's plug and play and the game recognizes it immediately as a PS4 controller.

review: This game pretty much gives me the competitive work on skills everyday feeling I need from a first person shooter or sports game. The game has many mechanics to keep it interesting. Highly competitive yet can have a lot of fun with friends at the same. I hate reviewing but this game is actually tight enough to do so. Rate this game 7 out of 10 which is probably 10 out of 10 for most peoples scale. My few suggestions would be to not only allow you to change the colors of your car for each team but also allow for different attena and toppers. Hard finding color schemes that go both ways. Also the hidden 1.5 second jump mechanic should at least be hinted at in the tutorials. I've been playing for 3 days but find the game easy to pickup if you've ever played fifa or have knowledge of ball physics.

review: This game may look easy to get the hang of but oh boy it is not.Getting near to 200hrs in this game im still learning new little techniques and improving on others people wasn't kdding when they said it will take hundreds of hours to master or atleast get good at this game so if you do want to become a pro be prepared for commitment if not good luck.Graphics and Optimization I dont have the most beasty computer actually no where near and i can still max this game out and still get 60fps which amazed me but there are many settings you can ajust in game to fit your needs.Gamemodesthere are lots of gamemodes to choose from from the standard 1v1 2v2 3v3 4v4's to hockey basketball and now dropshot(which i may add is very fun and addicting) there is also a ranked section which is more competitive which only include the standard game modes except 4v4's.Multiplayer and playersThere is many servers and many regions to choose from so getting into a game wont take long at all but do choose the correct region becuase you'll end up with 300ms ping and thats just unplayable.The players can differ from very nice well communicated teammates to complete morons who will blame you even if they score in there own goal oh and be prepard for mum insults theres alot ) but if you do get good teammates the game is very enjoyable.
title: Rocket League®

review: This is a Superb Game! Being that I never had an interest in cars or soccer/Futball when I first heard about it (on youtube) I skipped over it "Soccer with cars?" I thought "LAME!" But over the next couple of weeks I kept getting messages from my friends "Dude you gotta try this game!" "Shaggy this game is re DONK ulous buy it and play with me!" "Hey have you tried Rocket League it's f**king addicting man!" and a sleugh of other things all revolving around Rocket League so I caved if my friends were playing it then I'd give it a shot even if I didn't like it at least I'd have another game to play with my friends and it wouldn't be the first time I'd bought a game I didn't like so I could play with my farther out friends. And then I played it. And Played it. And Played it. And Played it. And Played it. And Played it. And Played it. And Played it. If I wasn't working or at school chances were I was playing Rocket League.It was a simple game with simple rules and (if you weren't stuck using a keyboard until you were level 20 like I was) simple controls but there was a finesse a grace that you only got by earning it you could be instantly inherently perfect like some games yes there were other games with similar mechanics and similar controls but this game wasn't about Racing or really even about fighting this was about soccer in ROCKET CARS if you spent the whole game blowing people up you'd never win so there was more to it that going fast and hitting hard you had to PLAY THE GAME.Is it the best game? Maybe Maybe not. But this game has something that not a lot of other games have. And that is Evolution. Because Rocket Leagues Base is so simply yet eloquent it can be looked at and understood by just about everyone and it has the ability that someone whose never played before can pick up the controller play for a bit and think "You know what would make this game AWESOME?" And say just about anything and it could make a solid game mode!Just to name a few I've seen that would make fantastic secondary game modes just in case you don't feel like normal Rocket Car Soccer Zero G Obstacles Power Ups Mutators Boost Only Just to name a few. This game will only get better with time and you can't say that with a lot of games.

review: Rocket Leauge is a racing game mixed with soccer. Instead of playing soccer with humans this game is all about playing soccer while controlling a boosting jumping car. Thanks to the boosting and jumping mechanic you can get into the air and make wonderful aerial goals.At first my brother bought the game because he really is into sports games. He always begged for me to join and play splitscreen but I wasn't into sportsgames at all. I knew that Rocket League wasn't an ordinairy sports game but that didn't make me want to play it. Someday I joined my brother on Rocket League and after the first game I was already addicted to the game. I have to say Rocket League brought me into the sports games genre.Conclusion I really recommend the game especially to play with friends. The competitive side really finishes the game and makes you want to play more.JaronTu

review: I love this game however ranked matches have ruined it for me to be honest I'm not a bad player last season just finished i finished on All Star but getting there and staying there was a struggle not so much because of the competition but because similar or higher class players on my team have either just not been trying or trolling barely being able to hit a ball and just not playing to their ability so I've been continuously promoted and demoted no matter how well you play as an individual you will still go down in rank.I have to admit I do have bad games everyone does but this has driven me to uninstall the game several times and vow never to play it again only to pick it up again days later for this I applaude you Psyonix you have mad a simple and truly remarkable game that is simple to play and very difficult to master.These ranked matches though just do my head in sometimes yeah sometimes you get great team mates sometimes it's different playing styles that doesn't click but it's the ones that don't bother when it matters that riles me for example just now I'm playing the 10 matches to rank in this new league 2 Grand Champions are playing on opposite teams even the team mate i'm playing with says yeah our Grand Master isn't even trying even the guy on the opposing team even said "out of all the matches only one Grand Master has even tried to compete properly so far from what he's seen in this match with two our Grand Master was just watching and laughing at us while he didn't even try no blocking purposefully missing and then mocking us this I absolutely hate this bulls**t youtube twitch &amp game fame is full of cu**s.My advice don't bother with competitive i was much happier before i tried it.

review: Rocket League is one of those games that's based around a concept so bizarre that it works. And it works let me tell you. I originally bought the game to mess around with friends on but after the first 50 hours I knew that it had so much more to offer than that. It's skill cieling is so astonishingly high that not even the best in the world have reached it yet. My favorite thing about this game is that new ways to play are constantly being discovered. Unlike in a game like Counter Strike where the only new things you're going to find are a certain place to throw a flashbang or a smoke or something there's always something new top discover in Rocket League fast kick offs pinching the ball dribbling bounce dribbling power shots air dragging half flips and the list just keeps going. Get this game if you want your life to be sucked away by a seemingly simple yet endlessly complex masterpiece.

review: The problem with this game isnt the gameplay graphics or the controls it's the connectivity issues. In my experience I can't play a multiplayer match without having error 59 (Reservation timed out.) appear on the screen. There is a way around this of course which is to ALT+TAB as soon as it says "joining in 3 2 1..." and open the game after 5 6 seconds but this is very tedious over time. Not to mention the occasional rubber banding and connective issues. Since it is a great game with a unique gameplay style and smooth controls (for the controller I dont know about keyboard) I will recommend this game. But they better correct these issues if they want me to play anymore than I have.EDIT Its fixed and its fun

review: This is a must play. Pros Incredibly addicting gameplay with a Civ 5 like "one more game" mentality. Very active devs that continously put out new content on a regular basis. It's playing soccer in rocket boosted cars it's simple in its design but hits the mark. Cons Cosmetic systems with crates and keys always feels weird to me. I understand that they don't affect gameplay but I also feel like it feeds into the gambling mindset and can sometimes be toxic. However I understand the need for it. review: This game is just perfect but a few more things could be added to make it even more better.Pros Simple yet Addictive Gameplay Great Customisation Colourful and Marvelous graphics Cross PlatformCons Noobs joining ranked matches. A level cap would fix this problem for example you have to be above level 10 to play ranked matches. People leaving ranked matches without any penalty hence making the rest of the match unbalanced and difficult to win for the team. I dislike the off ball camera because controlling it seems stiff and difficult. It would have been great if you did certain challenges to receive items instead of randomly receiving them through experience. Example Score 10 goals to earn the crown.Suggestions More gameplay modes would be pretty cool. Online Tournaments

review: TLDR At almost 200hrs in so far and not even liking cars or even soccer for that matter Rocket League hits the nail right on the head. The game is fun and a joy to get better at. 10/10 would Soc car again! Rocket League is a game I wasn't expecting to like going in. It's a car game but it's with the addition of the Soccer element that makes Rocket League stand out as a must play. First of all don't expect to be good at this game during your first matches in the game is certainly tough to wrap your head around ESPECIALLY if you're like me and have little to no experience with any games of similar genres. That being said once you get over the initial hump of learning the mechanics and the importance of team placement the game is a BLAST to control! You would think an idea as complex as cars with rockets playing soccer would be a nightmare to control but that's just not the case here! Controlling your car feels great and pulling off a flashy goal for all of your teammates to watch in the post goal replay feels even greater! After each match finishes you also have a small chacne of unlocking cosmetic items for your rocket car like hats antennas even decals! These items give no boosts to stats and are simply cosmetic. In addition Rocket League does a phenomenal job at keeping the game accessible enough for more casual players as well as complex enough for more competitive players like myself to keep coming back for more!
title: Rocket League®

title: Rocket League®

review: A fast paced physics based game where you try to play soccer with a decked out rocket car while navigating a field of 14 year old drivers and grown men pretending to be 14. Games last 5 minutes making it great for both casual and competitive gamers. Being both amazing and addictive I highly recommend it.Edited after extensive amounts of competitive gameplay ranging from All Star to Challenger Elite solo 3s que so solo players can have an idea of what to expect.Prospect rankings Players have little or no knowledge of field spacing. More often than not the entire team will clump on the ball. Players exercise little to no field awareness. Plan on teammates bumping you off the ball or hitting the ball just to hit it rather than letting a teammate with a better angle clear or progress the ball Whiffing. It's a whiff fest. Don't plan on players always making connection with the ball. Rare aerials. Most game play will be on the ground Tip off roles. Players will most likely all rush the ball on tip off Empty goals. Players will rarely play goalie or rotate field position. Most often when there is a goalie it's a dedicated player who is passive more often than not. Many trash goals and long range goals happen as you can shoot from almost anywhere on the field with 3 playing forward. Players only play the ball directly to the goal the majority of the time with minimal usage of the corners/walls. You really don't have to worry about players blocking angles with their car or demolishing other cars idling on the field. You really don't have to worry about too many players at this level anticipating the angles of the ball whether it's leaving a car or a wall. Players are generally uncomfortable playing backwards and change direction awkwardly. Spatial skills. You don't really have to worry about people using the ball cam and exercising solid mental mapping of ball and player positions.Challenger Rankings Hit or miss on player spacing up until Division 4+. Players often clump to the ball and leave gaps in the field. Players exercise *some* field awareness up until Division 4. Teammates will often bump other teammates off the ball or hit the ball just to hit it rather than let the teammate with the better angle take the touch. Players will most likely have an understanding of position/role rotation at this point. Whiffing. Doesn't happen nearly as much once you're in Challenger division and more often than not it results in an opportunity for a goal. Aerials. Expect players to fly. Tip off roles. Players generally know their role at tip off. Forward/side challenges on tip off one plays mid for the second touch one generally plays goal. It's hit or miss on if the goalie goes to the corner to grab the full boost often resulting in trash tip off goals. It's been my experience that the stronger goalies collect the boosts within the goal box. Empty goals. Players still tend to over extend from time to time leaving empty goals. Furthest one back should hover half field and look for cleanups on centers or to play the ball forward when it is pushed towards them. Count on there being a goalie or someone near goal however. You will find that many of the goalies do not challenge tackles the success of a passive goalie isn't consistent. Players are more creative with shooting at this level. Players no longer only play the ball. Plan on being demolished for idling under a ball while it falls to the ground or while playing a passive goalie. Plan on players anticipating the angle of the ball leaving a wall or car. They no longer play directly to the goal especially if the box is loaded. Anticipate high balls off the wall for centers as well as players playing on the walls and flipping it to mid/goal with a well timed jump. Players are comfortable playing both backwards and forwards. Spin someone out? Plan on them seamlessly transitioning to reverse/forward. Demolishing them completely is your best bet. Spatial skills. It's been my experience that good players use the ball cam. Plan on them having a solid mental map of ball position car positions and field position. Speed boosts. Players will now be strategically pathing through boosts. Rarely will they strategically steal the other team's boosts in front of the goal while applying pressure on the goal.Challenger Elite+ Expect anything. From players demolishing idle cars to strategically removing boosts from the field it's gonna happen. Passive goalies are generally a thing of the past here. Expect any lead touches to be challenged. Players understand position roles and are skilled when it comes to spatial skills and anticipation. Whiffing *rarely* happens and most likely results in a shot on goal. Anticipate connection on every challenge. Control. Once at this level players have an initimate understanding of how to use their car. Plan for them to play the most advantageous angle when it comes to near/far post on shooting. Crossing/center can happen from almost anywhere whether it be from a high spot on the wall or from a defending goalie box.While this isn't everything I hope it gives players an idea of what to expect. This is a great game!
title: Rocket League®

review: Literally my favorite game to play 10/10.
title: Rocket League®

review: Soccer is boring. Soccer with cars is boring. But soccer with cars with rocket engines and the ability to climb walls and fly is amazing. Also incredibly addictive. Every match lasts 5 minutes so it's basically just highlights of a longer match.Rocket League is also easy to learn and get into but really hard to master.If you have friends that you like playing co op games with I strongly recommend this even if you don't care about soccer at all.

review: Fun Review I hate Soccer/Football. I also hate Racing. But for some reason I like this game... I think theres some thing wrong with me.Serious Review Alright let's get started. Rocket League is a fun fast paced game where you're in a car and drive in a dome to play soccer. Sounds fun right? It really is. Coustomizable cars fast pace action and awsome graphics.Pros 1.) Graphics are beutiful.2.) You can play 1v1 4v4.3.) Coustomizable Cars. (My car has a top hat D)4.) You dont need feets D!Cons 1.) Wonky Camera. Theres no freeroam camera which I'm a little upset about.2.) Theres a chance where you can get match up with some really good people... On the other team.3.) The controls are ify it's perferable on Controllers.Overall Score 9/10 Freeroam Camera Please? Otherwise Good Game.

review: I'll give you a list of what it has so you can decide if you want it or not.HAS Explosions.Cars. Soccer. (Or Football if you're weird and/or British.)Hats.Paint Jobs.Progression System. (No "Pay2Win" crap. Any player can be as good or bad as any other player It's all skill based.)Customization System. (Super in depth and super free.)Fun. (You'd be suprised how many other games don't have this...)Wallrunning (Or I guess "walldriving")Flying.Rockets.Good CommunityGood Teammates. (Can you believe it?)Great potential for "Party Night" type gameplay. (local splitscreen capabilities group system and online crossplatform play are all things.)DOESN'T HAVE Hocke oh wait no it has that...Jump no it has that too...Um... Hackers? Yeah no hackers. Huh.PERSONAL OPINION If you like cars explosions or soccer then you should buy it on sale or otherwise.
title: Rocket League®

Always a (rocket) blast.WHY GET IT Addictive as hell 21 9 ultrawide support yay Connection is stable many state rubberbanding is a huge issue but I have seen this only when MY CONNECTION is bad. Great graphics Absolute best for playing with friends DLCs are pretty cool Splitscreen support Crossplatform (PC &amp Playstation)WHY NOT TO GET IT Why not?If you have this in your wishlist (or not) don't be wishy washy like I was and pick it up now!

review: "Just one more game"One hour later"Just one more game"I don't normally write reviews but this game deserves it. 10/10.It's a lot of fun with friends or even solo play. Minutes turn into hours and next thing you know you're late for class. Rocket League is one of the few games that I'd say has been crafted perfectly only a few minor things wrong. The best part is that the devs are constantly adding new things to the game such as the ice rink or the upcoming basketball court all for free too. There are two downsides to RL though.First there's a map called wasteland. Pretty buggy and kind of disappointed it made it to the competitive (ranked) gamemodes. Secondly licensed vehicles e.g. the batmobile are not customizable. It was only $2 so no biggie but it would have been nice to to at least have been able to add a flag. The pros outweigh the cons. Expect to spend hours on this game especially if you have friends to play with.

review: Do you like cars? Do you like Football? If you answered no to both these questions then it's probably time to come out of the closet. However if you answered yes to both questions then Rocket League is the game for you! This game brings cars and football together (minus the poncy haircuts and ridiculous salaries).In multi player mode you can play competitors from all around the world there is nothing more satisfying than humping a team from Argentina while safe in the knowledge that no matter what the outcome of the match is the Falklands will always be ours.In addition to multi player mode you can also upgrade your car. This includes tyres decals and for the more adventurous gear head why not stick a wizards hat on the roof for good measure....I tried putting a wizards hat on the neighbours cat with slightly less success. Needless to say the cat looked rather fetching but still didn't have any interest in football. My mate Steve put a halo on his car and his exhaust fumes were glitter. Dispite the fact he scored four goals in 3 minutes we all agreed that he was probably sitting at home in a dress whistling the tune "The hills are alive with the sound of music."
title: Rocket League®

review: h 10/10 HAPPYHAPPYGAMEGAME REVIEW Rocket League /h1 HHGG's GAME OF THE YEAR 2015I simply love this game. The new hockey mode is sweet and I just can't believe how deep into my gaming rotation it's gotten. I've played over 900 games (almost entirely online multiplayer) and it's just a blast! It's become a bigger time burglar than Civ 5 and that says something. I've been dying for a new PC NHL hockey game and oddly enough this has really helped to fill that gap. The skill level really scales up. It's simple enough that a 5 year old could pick it up in a matter of minutes but the skill at the highest levels is pretty spectacular. This is one of the first game where I've ever befriended strangers to play with. Thanks Psyonix!UPDATE I love they way they are growing the community and the esports. Rocket League is one of the best sports games on Steam today. I declare Rocket League to be HappyHappyGameGame's 2015 game of the year (Narrowly defeating GTAV and Fallout 4)

review: So we all know Rocket League is a pretty decent game playing chaos is fun as hell and matches seem balanced at first sight. Then comes the bad side of Rocket League where apparantely the devs thought it's a fair system to put up a really high ranked player and a low ranked player against 2 others that are the same level between those two ranks. Probably the most idiotic logic I've ever seen in my life. The only outcome of that will be that the high ranked player is going to do all the work and carry the out of the other. This is not fair at all. I've seen people do tricks and that I've never seen before everytime this happens. I'm challenger elite and 75% of my matchmakings consist of a Superstar/Champion (highest blue rank and first purple rank) and then a guy who's prospect elite (highest of silver) And these guys are pretty much a magnet for that ball since 90% of the game it's just the high ranked guy hitting the ball constantly.The devs probably won't do anything about it anyways they got their money and we got this.In the end I like playing with friends but not competitive it's broken as hell.If you buy it remember the competitive is not as fun as it looks like. It's better to find 3 other friends and play chaos.

review: UPDATE Rocket League has since added plenty of additional modes and ranked features that make this game an absolute necessecity for any gamer out there experienced or otherwise.To put the base concept of Rocket League out there it s a simplified version of soccer involving up to 8 total players driving rocket powered RC cars. You pick up boost on the field launch yourself in the air and drive up the side walls it s a casual simplifield take on the soccer experience. However it is absolutely astounding how much the game will grab you and how exhilirating it is to expereince the chaoticness that can happen. How much this basic concept has such strong legs that the game is able to get away with a lack of features compared to other sports games. It hardly needs them. That s not to say the game lacks features at all. For starters you have 1v1 2v2 3v3 and 4v4 standard modes all of which can feel significantly different when it comes to field control and teamplay. There s ranked modes as well but these are far more limited you have 1v1 ranked duo 2v2 and solo 3v3. A game like this is definitely needs ranked 3v3 teams and possibly 4v4 teams but don t worry lads within 2 days of release the game was picked up by ESL. In fact the first EU cup for the game is taking place today including and I you not a team named PlsHaveMercy going against No Mercy. I know who my money is on.Outside of the online play you have an exhibition mode for quick games against bots a season mode drills to hone your skills a replay mode to edit your favorite victories together and your garage to customize your cars. You unlock parts as you play such as new tires cars paint decals boost trails and hats (you didn t think you could get away from hats could you?) that you earn nearly every game from playing. The customization is a nice touch but the majority of time you will be playing this game will mostly be online going to the garage inbetween matches. That isn t to say you will never stop playing online since the game s servers can occasionally be extremely laggy but to be fair there s good reason for this.On Tuesday Rocket League launched for $20 on PC of you have PS+ on PS4 you can play it for free right now add in Twitch and you had a game that went from 0 players to over 120 000 players in just a couple of days completely overwhelming the developers expectations and thus their twitter their forums and of course their servers leading to some significant outages. The game has completely taken over twitch and is now the one of the top sellers on steam. What myself and many others will be wondering is the lasting power of this game. It has significant potential to be a big esports title despite its casual nature. But current lack of support for ranked 3v3 or 4v4 teams is a pretty major disappointment. We will have to see what the developer does down the line their new found popularity is bound to have some development changes outside of the already announced customization DLC.I know the sports genre is a tough sell on PC probably the most difficult but few will be disappointed in the gameplay that Rocket League offers. It s highly addictive gameplay has already been noted by many and ESL s presence will soon spread its way over to PC. Today s tournament is PS4 exclusive but PC support and tournaments will soon be making its way to PC and yes Deadly Gaming will be competing. Calling now we re not gonna be a squad we re gonna be Team Rocket.8/10
title: Rocket League®
