title: Rocket League®

review: Scorecard http //i.imgur.com/4eoXnuC.pngFull review with screenshots http //www.techfreshness.com/game review rocket league Feature Y/N/Rating Aspect Ratios 4 3 21 9 Good Small Issues for Taller/Wider * Triple Monitor Yes * Framerate Cap 120 144+ * FOV Yes 60 110 horiz + Distance/Height/Pitch SLI Yes Performance Great Options Great 2 Conflicts Key Rebinding Yes (1 Slot) Issues Controller Support/Rebinding Yes Yes Local Co op 2 4 Players Local &amp Online Matches Vert or Horiz Split * Needs Basic UE3 Config Tweak See PCGamingWiki.com/wiki/Rocket_LeaguePC Port QualityYou need to whip out a text editor for a quick edit or two but nothing substantial. Uncapping the framerate can cause an issue with vertical camera movement while jumping repeatedly. I don t believe this has been fixed but I never really noticed it during actual play at 120hz. It supports SLI well from what I can tell and performance is mostly solid outside of small dips from time to time usually right after spawning in. Nvidia Adaptive V sync does force properly with the in game setting off as it should and I don t recall seeing a single tear. The game is very scalable for low end systems and only a 3GB install size.Numerous graphical options including toggles for Motion Blur DOF Bloom etc. However if Bloom is enabled the DOF effects are turned on automatically even though the DOF check box remains unchanged and they are on the same level rather than in a parent/child layout. In addition to that their DOF implementation adds noise to the entire image. There are over 100 lines of graphical settings in the main .ini file so I need to do more testing to see if either can be solved by edits there. Many resolutions and aspect ratios will need to be set manually in that .ini.The HUD scales to the corners which will make them out of view on wider than 21 9. The wider the resolution the closer the camera in the menus. At 21 9 the car almost clips out of frame and on triple wide setups a good 30 40% of the car will be out of frame. During gameplay this is not an issue as the vertical space is equal (set by your FOV setting) regardless of how wide the resolution. The HUD has a safe zone setting which consequently makes the HUD smaller but there s no standard scale setting to reduce huge console tailored sizing while sticking to the edges of the display.For both the PC and console releases there are extensive camera configuration options. Sliders for FOV from 60 110 horizontal degrees distance pitch height rotation speed stiffness (the speed of response to both following the car and your inputs via the right analog) and toggles for hold/toggle camera mode and UI indicator inverting and camera shake.Both KB/M and Controller can be rebound though both only have a single bind per action and some questionable choices make KB/M unusable for high level play. Mouse movement can be mapped to the camera but it acts like the analog stick requiring continuous input in one direction otherwise it jitters around or snaps back to center and not in a usable way like Saint s Row 3/4 s implementation. It s inexcusably bad especially considering much older games Rocket League is trying to emulate did far better.I was extremely happy to see local 4 player split screen play online and off with horizontal and vertical splitting and per player camera FOV/position settings. The only real issue is that the game won t let you specify a player s input as the KB/M. You either need a controller for each player or need to use a workaround to trick the game into thinking you have a controller filling the first slot so that the real controllers fill 2 4.GameplayThe core gameplay is an absolute blast. Even if you don t like soccer or racing/cars you ll likely still have fun. Traditional sports games offer relatively vague control over a player or entire team and Rocket League plays more like a racing sim or first person shooter in the sense that every single movement is deliberate as it would be for a participant in a real sport. The rule set is no more complex than to get the ball/puck/cube in the goal 1 4 players on either side most goals in the time limit wins. Such simplicity means players only need to concern themselves with the movement system reading the situation and working with your team. Sometimes you want a competitive experience without memorizing every inch of a complex map or the pros and cons of every weapon choice and Rocket League is exactly that.In addition to the online modes (1v1 4v4 Ranked and Unranked + 1 Mutator/Hockey Lobby) you have 3 other that you can play purely alone and offline. Exhibition is essentially free play with control over all sorts of modifiers player counts AI difficulty etc. You can play with up to 4 players locally or online and can play unbalanced match ups (1v3 2v4 etc) using the unfair difficulty. Season is a single player only tournament mode with control over difficulty length team size and team number. On the cosmetic side you can choose a team logo (which effects the paint color and coloring for your half of the field) name and the vehicles your teammates use. Adding the ability to add local/online teammates would notably improve the lifespan of this mode. Finally Training offers a generic free play a basic movement and controls tutorial and 3 advanced trials (with 3 difficulty settings each) for goal keeping striking and aerials. The top levels are extremely challenging but it s great that this mode is here as it presents the opportunity to constantly practice advanced moves where real matches rarely do.PresentationAside from the noise with DOF enabled the rendered image is very appealing. Fantastic use and variety of color in the effects and fields. I found it slightly lacking contrast and saturation for my tastes but that's nothing Reshade can't fix up.The soundtrack is only present in the menu and is a nice selection of up beat electronic and trance music. The dynamic crowd reactions and general sound effects are very well done and can be adjusted in the options.ConclusionIt s such a simple idea executed to a surprisingly high level of quality. Every time I started playing I ended up putting in another 4 5 hours. Even solo with random players online the game is tremendously engaging and a joy to play. If the content stopped coming entirely I could see myself getting bored after a while. If however they keep on their current path some new items here a new map/mode there I could easily see myself playing off and on throughout all of next year if not longer. In terms of raw content I don t think the game has reached its most compelling price point. But with more content being added and its price gradually coming down it ll happen soon and I d urge you to give it a shot. I d have been quicker to put money down if a demo was available because of how great it runs and feels so It would probably benefit them to implement one. Till then there s always the Steam refund system in case you don t like how it feels or if it conflicts with your system. You can definitely get the gist in an hour or two but if you like it you ll be begging for more.

review: Psyonix have created a masterpiece game in which football meets racing cars Rookie You can't hit . You are a disgrace to your team and the game.Semi Pro You can now sometimes hit the ball. Don't even try to hit it in the right direction or think about your positioning. You're only Semi Pro so you can just go ahead and hit that ball! You also made a bicycle hit that one time but yeah nah you're still .Pro You have learnt how to shoot the ball accurately from the ground. You're the best! Late into Pro level you would have likely looked up advanced tips for Rocket League. Worst mistake of your life. You now know what aerials are. You think you can fly. The ball comes up high and you go for an aerial. Once you jump you fly straight into the ground and continue to do frontflips until you land on your back... What the happened there? Oh. You're using keyboard. Yeah nah time to get a controller head.Veteran You now have a controller and go for terribly unlikely aerials. You think you're good. You can hit the lower aerials consistently and you can now be considered an addition to your team. Congratulations!Expert You can now consistently hit aerials accurately at any height. This game is now your life. You can also score off a wall every now and then. Good times.Master You are now a god to every level lower than you. You have perfected the art of wall shots. You are an extremely cool person. A nice little bonus is that everyone under the level of Pro will now spam "Sorry!" every time they do something wrong to you.Legend The most badass looking title you can have. Rocketeer. You probably now have an extreme case of false confidence. Once you get used to the badass title you'll wreck anything and anyone with ease. You can also pull off freestyles consistently. Nice job! Also be sure to prepare for an endless stream of "You're not good enough for Legend!"Rocketeer You can now 720 freestyle backflip reverse backwards aerial air dribble off a wall with ease. You probably boosted for that Rocketeer tag but if you didn't Still prepare for another endless stream of "You're not good enough for Rocketeer!"
title: Rocket League®

review: This game can be fun a lot. If you can play this together with your friends. Playing alone is a good time consumer but playing together with friends is much more fun. I often play it when I have to wait for about 15 minutes for a friend to come back from dinner so we can play a round of dota or smth like that.In the current state of the game I would call the matchmaking system broken. It wasn't until recently that I got queued against players with much higher ranks then I have. Following that I got annihilated by them which let me put the game aside for a while. And no one really wanted the new microtransactions either but hey you don't have to buy them if you don't want to.In the end it's a pretty fun game to play. If you are experiencing high ping don't even try to play it. The game behaves really strange (ball glitches around player moves left and right completely random etc.) like nothing I have seen so far. Pros + Fun to play+ Fluent gameplay+ Graphics+ Price+ Matches are short (7 8 minutes) Cons Matchmaking system Microtransactions

review: This game overall is excellent. The simple to learn hard to master mechanics lend it a very realistic feel and the main con I have so far is in the occasional (reasonably rare but getting more common as time goes on) bad matchmaking. The DLC items are purely cosmetic and the game is not pay to win in any way. The DLC items IMO are cool enough to pick up though despite that. My personal favorite is the Takumi from Supersonic fury and also the included carbon fiber paint type. This brings up the subject of customization. It is quite varied even in the base game with no DLC the only lacking area being the paint types. There are plenty of toppers (Top Hat anyone?) and the variety of antennas wheels boosts and actual body types are quite good too. The gameplay itself in writing sounds like it would get repetitive quickly but especially when playing with mutators is always fun and entertaining. This has to be one of the most addicting games I have ever played if not the most. The gamepad controls are excellent and logical and are remappable. The keyboard controls are reasonably intuitive but I personnally vastly prefer the remote for the analogue sticks and triggers. The physics are quite good too they feel very realistic in mass but the cars handling and boost mechanics are very arcadey which gives the game an overall arcade feel. I enjoy this game quite a lot and can see myself playing it for quite a long time.EDIT Why is wasteland in comp? pls no psyonix. Also I have no idea what people are talking about when they say you need a superboss titan Z i7 5960X origin PC for this to run at max. I use an ancient i7 (averaging around 20 40% usage) and a gtx 960 4 gb (average 50% usage 1680x1050) so running it at decent settings shouldnt be hard.Overall 9/10
title: Rocket League®

review: Freaking amazing.Even though it is the same thing over each game This game never get's old the thrill and experience of getting that epic save just before the ball goes into your goal is amazing and NEVER get's oldTimes when you do an impossible aerial goal that stuns everyone.This game is a amazing and doesn't really get old. Playing with friends makes the experience much MUCh better._______________________________________________Cons the only con i can think of is that matchmaking could be better sometimes you'll get matches where two rookies verse a pro and a veteran but most of the time it's fine.(UPDATE) The matchmaking is far better now but could still use a little tweaking._______________________________________________All in all I find this game to be a brilliant experience one that will last ages if not forever I highly reccomend anyone who is thinking about getting this game to buy it.

I've seen that if you play with random people you'll be team up with 4 toxic players in 10 matches.2. Servers For latin people as me some servers might lag your experience. review: 10/10 Game for 5 minutes of action packed fun.10/10 Game for rage inducing team matesSo here's how not to suck complete at Rocket League1. You have 2 Camera's. Watch the ball AND watch where you goddamn drive. Bumping Team Mates is BAD2. Don't play under a bouncing ball this is BAD. 95% of the time you won't win the exchange circle around to defense and let your team mates charge ahead.3. Don't play dead balls. If it's rolling around slowly and you're next to it... Leave it and go to defense.4. Don't chase the ball all game this is BAD. You're more likely to mess up a set up play for someone who is trying to actually win than be helpful always being on the ball.5. Defense play is GOOD. When your whole team is crashing back to defend you can break out and get the ball back to the other end and score an easy goal.6. Your game sense will come. But if you haven't gotten the idea of how to not be complete garbage from the first 5 points i'll say it again. DEFENSIVE PLAY WINS GAMES.7. Practice Aerials and Wall shots in Freestyle/Training. Like game sense this will come in time.TL DR You shouldn't buy this game you impatient moron.

review: Rocket League This is a positive review this game is amazing and is definitely worth the price tag of 14.99. It's a car based football game. In Rocket League you get behind a wheel of numerous cars and face off against up to 4 of the opposition using team effort to hit the ball into the back of the net Theres solo play multiplayer and even online matchmaking you can play 1v1 2v2 3v3 and 4v4.Here are some of the pros of the game great graphics and visual effects It has a wide range of customisation options to unlock as you level up. There's a season mode if you want to play solo so you don't always play online with different options to make it very interesting. Theres local multiplayer which supports up to four player (if you have enough controllers) A number of different maps with different weather variations. It's Cross platform so you can play with PS4 players but theres no party system for Cross platform yet. Has quick messages which you can communicate with quickly with your teammates. You can save your amazing goals with the save replay button so you can watch them later. Full controller support so you can just plug in and play PS4 or Xbox. It's even entertaining for those that are not keen on real life sports like me. Theres physics so your cars top speed is different on other maps if the floor is made out of tarmac it's alot quicker compared to a grass pitch. It's no a massive thing but It's definitely a great touch.This is a pro and a con the game's bots aren't great but the game's full experience is by playing multiplayer.This is the only con. the Solo play gets very repetitive and boring overall my rating is a (9.5/10)Overall Rocket League is an incredibly good multiplayer game with awesome visuals loads of customisation options and numerous amounts of different maps with different weather on each one. If you're looking for a new multiplayer game or just something a bit different you've come to the right place.

review: A bug Psyconix can't fix.Win 3 Rank up 1 divisionLose 1 Rank down 1 divisionSettings reset each time my PC restarts.Gameplay 4/5 The gameplay for me has been decent but there is various bugs here and then but they don't affect the gameplay too much. The bugs include when the boost counter sometimes dissapears however this does not happen very often. The gameplay is fun and enjoyable without bugs and bad teams.Updates 3/5 Psyconix updates the game alot (maybe too much) and I personally think they are adding new items too fast e.g. Turbo crates and Nitro crates were both added in under 2 months which is too quick in my opinion. Also the updates aren't that bad but they have NOT fixed the servers in Asia and Oceania yet and they have been faulty for a long time and haven't yet fixed bugs e.g. hotbar bug terrible casual matchmaking and more.Matchmaking 2/5 Once upon a time there was a scrub named 'Timmy.' Timmy was addicted to Rocket League after spending 5000 hours on the game in 1 year. Timmy joins a casual match after a long hard day and joins a game where the score is 6 1. Timmy's reaction is "oh crunch " then he leaves the game and joins another game. As he enters the game the score is 12 0 and the it is an xp farming game with bots. Timmy then decides to leave the game. Timmy joins another game. Timmy takes a sneaky peek of the score and it is 2 5 to his team. Timmy decides that he wants a fair matchmaking game so he leaves the game. Timmy gets some milk and comes back. He carefully sips up the milk and decides to join ANOTHER GAME. 4th game now and Timmy is getting a bit triggered. He joins a game and it ends as he joins. He then gets angry and screams "AHHHHHHHH." Timmy looks for another game. Timmy joins another game. When he joins the game everything is fine and he decides to say "hello" in chat. xX_Shrek420_Xx replied " you get deported " Timmy replies "reported " xX_Shrek420_Xx replies "that's it I am selling your IP on eBay." (His IP later was sold for 0.99$ on eBay. Timmy at this point has contracted crippling depression and various other STD's. Timmy tries one more time to join a casual match. His router fried and his house burnt down. The end?Yeah when they fix the matchmaking (and the bugs) it'll be a higher rating )

review: At the reccomendation of an awesome person with great taste in games I decided I'd give this game a shot. Let me start by saying I hate watching most sports and playing most of them irl or as a game is kind of meh as well. Racing as both a spectator sport and as a gaming genre is total ballsack and I would never waste a dime on that kind of junk.For some reason when you rub these two genres together hard enough you get that magic gaming spark. This is a rewarding adrenaline fueled nitro boosted hellsport that will make you curse your own lack of skill one minute and have you almost on your feet cheering for yourself and your buddies the next.Making a car go fast is boring but learning to make a car jump juke and borderline literally fly at the perfect angles to bounce a ball your friend lobbed to you into a goal? Most exciting thing I've done on the internet in a long time.I reccomend playing with at least one friend and with a controller if possible cause keyboard and mouse are meh for this one.

review: I've had trouble writing this review mostly because I couldn't think of anything to say besides get this game.But for real buy this game. It's such a fresh breath of air. Let's start off. The community is bustling beyond expectations. I just saw like 200k players online. Obviously it wont stay that way forever but that is a solid community for a non AAA game. Once this game gets on some steam sales players are never gonna have to worry about finding games. For those seeking a competive experince this is also the perfect game. They have ranked playlist but also have normal ones for people like me who just like a chill game.Also this game runs and plays fantastic. I haven't encountered any real technical glitches or framerate drops. That's just really nice. I heard there were some issues with the servers early on but since I bought it I haven't encountered any.Oh and lets also mention that despite being a game that has a ton of cosmetic options there isn't any microtransactions. When it comes to cosmetics that is never really a big deal to me but it is still nice to see. If they ever add them I wouldn't mind though.And finally to the gameplay. This gameplay is non stop fast paced action. I'm not one to play tutorials I didn't need one. I just hopped into a bot game learned the ropes and boom I was ready to play. Even the bot matches are crazy fun.So yah buy this game. I'd say it's well worth the 20 dollars but it's also a perfect sale game. Just make sure you play it in your lifetime mkay?Edit for the badge

review: Review as Casual GamerThe Game is fun in the beginning and with friends that are on your level. Playing against others online is fun but the whole ranking system is broken. This game is nothing for casual gamers who just want some fun matches. The reason behind this is the ranking system no matter what you will rank up. With time you will become Pro or Veteran and you will play against people who actually know how to play and fly around.Since I do only play it casually I get killed on the playing field. While the game brands me as a Veteran I am basically only Semi Pro (lower end) but I have to play against other Veterans Masters and Legends some. Eventually your rank will increase (with time) to a point where this game is unplayable for casual Gamers. I wish the game would give negative points for losing (or quitting when you are behind) so that I will not automatically increase my rank with time. Good players will still become legends and Veterans and casual gamers will be in their own League remaining on Rookie or Semi Pro and have fun playing against people are on their level.

review: It is extremely difficult to describe the joy of crossing someone on a mad drive to the goal. The entire opposing team is throwing all they have at you at every turn there s a revving engine and burning rocket motor trying to get in between you and your fleeting but oh so enjoyable fame. With every juke you shatter the opposing team s hope of victory (as well as your teammate s hopes of ever touching the ball) and end up just yards from the goal (meters in people that haven t been to the moon units.) You let loose with the most savage double jump crossover on the goalie as you can. The ball screeches into the goal and detonates sending all on the pitch careening across the field in a frenzy of jumps and spontaneous boosts celebrating your play. You ease back in your chair and realize after getting all those white stars in Upward you can finally become the Soccar star you ve always dream to be

review: This is a fantastic game. I have 130+ hours and it's still just as fun as the first time I played it. The developers Psyonix add free new features constantly (new maps new game modes new toppers/flags) and cosmetic paid DLC such as the Batmobile. Plus Cross play ensures a huge playerbase at all hours of the day.However Psyonix seems to only consider the eSports scene and the high level players. They added three new non standard maps which is great but one is heavily focused on aerials (Underpass) and another is heavily focused on walls (Utopia Retro). Both of these are incredibly hard for new players to learn. Now it's fine to have these new maps as they are in their own game mode (Rocket Labs). However they did announce that they will consider putting these maps in the Competitive rotation. I've played games on these maps (Prospect III/Elite level not very high but not lowest of the low) where it was 0 0 the entire five minute game and 2 3 minutes of overtime.This game is awesome. But it's not friendly to newcomers.

review: The best "foot"ball game of all time. Huge learning curve tons of actual skills to obtain and master. Adrenaline boosted gameplay in the tightest of matches and crazy stuff happening on the gamefield. Probably the most efficient euros &gt fun ratio on steam especially when on sale. Most people use controllers and I also recommend using the xbox 360/one/elite or ps3/ps4 controller (the one you are used to or more comfortable with) to play this game. After trying out Xbox elite and Razer Wildcar (xbox) I must say the Wildcat is the best controller so far to play this game. Steamcontroller would be a bit cheaper solution with extra buttons in the back aswell. Wildcat takes it over Elite for me just because of the technology (microswitches) behind the actual buttons.

review: Before I get into the details of this review I first off want to say that if your not a big soccer fan don't be scared to try out Rocket League. The mechanics may be similar to soccer but in no way feel the same once you start playing. keep in mind that this my personal opinion and may not apply to other people Either way let's get down to bizz. (I say that like bizz is still something people say xD)The pros are.The ball may be sensitive but isn't that how it would work?A neat variety of modes.Customization that you unlock from playing.Good variety of vehicles.Maps that are the same as their normal variants but have different weather.Cons.The ball has a tendency to get stuck in the corners until everyone stops hitting it and let's it drop to the ground and then hits it or someone hits it in midair.Can't do full donuts (What I would like to see.More maps.maybe a mode where you have mounted guns to shoot the ball and players with.Make custom teams in season mode.4 team ffa.A rumble ability that places a wall would be interesting. (maybe not xD)Zombie mode.Music while playing (not just in the title screen)And that's all I can think to put here for now.

review: Rocket League is by far the best competitve multiplayer game I have ever played. One of the many great things about this game is how accessible it is to new players despite having a very high skill gap. Not only is it very easy to get into and very addicting but it is incredibly hard to master. The dilemna between the game being accessible and the game having a high skill ceiling has been handled perfectly. Additionally there are both casual and ranked playlists as well as private matches. No matter how casual or hardcore you are as a gamer there is almost certainly a place for you in this game.The game is also incredibly rewarding especially during those moments where you make those goals you never thought you would. In gaming one can only derive satisfaction from achievement if the achievement was difficult to attain. Not too difficult but not so easy that the sense of accomplishment fades after a few hours. This is another thing that Rocket League has nailed. Dribble goals double taps off the wall aerials and freestyle goals (to name a few) are all incredibly satisfying to make. The controls are tight and responsive and mechanically the game is near flawless. The physics are also very accurate for the most part. Hitting the ball feels satisfying due to both visual and audible feedback. The sound and graphics are both well done and serve their purpose well. There is car custimization as well as player trading and cases. I tend to ignore these things because I'm not big on cosmetics. The game plays faster than most and can even be chaotic at times. This is something that I enjoy although I could understand others not appreciating it as much. It is very engaging and hands on. Matches are only 5 minutes making it easy to quickly jump into for a game or two. Another thing I believe is commendable is the commitment the developers have shown to continually updating their game. They have introduced several new and fun gamemodes since launch including Rumble Hoops and Mutator Mash Up. All of the new maps and modes are free. It seems that Psyonix is more interested in the overall longetivity and quality of the game than making as much money as possible. The same cannot be said for many triple A games these days.That's not to say that everything is perfect. There is no shortage of player toxicity in this game and unfortunately until recently the report system pretty much did not work at all. I am glad to hear that this is slowly changing though. Also the game's matchmaking can feel somewhat frustrating at times. There are micro transactions although they are much less prevalent than in many other games. They are there though so If you hate that kind of thing keep that in mind.Overall I cannot overstate how great this game is. I feel confident in saying that if you enjoy completitive multiplayer games at all you will enjoy this game.I would give numerical rating but I don't feel that a number can fully capture how high my opinion of this game is.
title: Rocket League®

review: One of the most fun and addictive games I have ever played. Absolutely a must to play with friends (or even pubs). Single player is fine for learning the mechanics but multiplayer is where this game shines.Others will explain the details of the game far better than myself but basically this is a game of soccer (1v1 2v2 3v3 or 4v4) where people are replaced by cars. While the cars can appear different (a lot of cosmetic customizations) they handle identically. You collect boost from highlighted areas on the field that automatically regenerate after a few moments. You can use the boost to give yourself a burst of speed to try and catch up to the play drive the ball with some extra force or even blast your car way into the air (some people are amazing at that). You can also jump/hop/flip your car a bit which can benefit you by giving you a little extra oomph.Once you ge the hang of the basics the game will start to really come to you. After your first MP goal you will likely be addicted. The matches are only 5 minutes long which actually seems like the sweet spot for keeping the games tight and white knuckled.If you are looking for a fun relatively inexpensive multiplayer game to play with friends this will likely scratch that itch for quite a while. Simply put the game is outstanding fun. Also due to it being a cross platform game the amount of players is FAR greater than what Steam will show you. That number just represents the PC crowd. For example Steam was showing around 5600 players during my last game but there was over 70 000 people playing the game. This should certainly help keep the multiplayer servers active for quite some time.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket powered Soccer cars. What's not to like? Simple mechanics fun gameplay.
title: Rocket League®

review: This game is pure genius. The simplicity of this game makes it so much fun. Everything about this game is enjoyable. The team play and the setups you can make with friends/teammates are unreal. When you score a goal it feels so satisfying as loud goal horn goes off and the ball explodes blowing everyone back. Making UNREAL saves flying through the air and saving the game for your team feels phenomenal.This game is absolutely worth every cent it's asking for. When I saw this game was only 20 dollars and free on PSN this month I was astonished. This could easily be charged as a $60 AAA title. Why even play Fifa anymore when you have this. Pick this game up seriously. The devs even say that they plan to make free DLC in the future which is a big plus in many players books.10/10
title: Rocket League®

Since playing on the PS4 and enjoying it so much I felt so bad that I got the game for free that I had to come over and pay full price on Steam for it. Yeah I know the devs get some cheese from Sony for the PS+ promos but still. Rocket League is a beautiful fast and fun pick up and play arcade style sports game. The controls are simple enough that you'll feel like a badass playmaker your first game or so. Oh and the addition of local co op and cross platform play is really nice to see too.

review: Rocket League is two different things to different people either it's a fun game you play with your friends to have a good time or it's a uber competitive game demanding intense skill to rise to the top of the rankings. Know that I write this review as a gamer looking to have a good time.This game is beautiful in its simplicity. It's easy to learn difficult to master and it has a way of making a good deal of your shots feel epic as hell. Playing with friends hasn't brought forth behavior I'm used to from games "built for eSports " maybe my friends are more laid back than most people are but mistakes are nothing more than mistakes and good plays pump everyone up regardless of who made the play. This game is really fun if you want it to be if you're in this game for the ranking you're subjecting yourself to the negativity every single eSport gamer complains about. If you just want to have fun you will love this game.
title: Rocket League®

review: its gud
title: Rocket League®

review: It goes without saying that I love this game so far I've spend over 135 hours playing it.The review in short Pros It's fun racing and trying to score It has active developers New updates (like cars maps and gamemodes) released every now and then Not paid to win.Cons None.Long review When this game was first released I purchased it before the hypetrain took Rocket League to the next level. Back then it only had the standard gamemode and a number of cars. The developers quickly released some patches for bugs that needed fixing but it was a very well made game upon release.The DLCs released by Psyonix are definitely worth their money if you're interested in new car models wheels boost designs etc. No DLC is paid to win and microtransactions have only been introduced recently crates and keys containing more visual items there are no paid to win items at all so that's a big plus.As for the gamemodes it started with a pretty simple arena and you just had to score. Soon after they released the hockey gamemode where the ball was turned into a puck which actually behaved like one. After that they released the hoops gamemode which is similar to basketball. You have hoops which are elevated and you score by making the ball go through the hoop from above (it doesn't work from below I've tried). Just recently they released the rumble gamemode in this gamemode you play in a random arena (from the default gamemode) and you get random powerups every 10 seconds. To get a new powerup you have to use your current one and wait for 10 seconds. Powerups can include teleportation (you vs. an opposing player) force boost on an opposing player a magnet which attracts the ball towards you from a certain short distance and a lot more. It's quite fun and refreshing.Other than the abovelisted gamemodes you have regular and ranked gameplay. Both try to match you with players of your skill level as best as they can and they quite often do a good job of doing so.This game is definitely recommended because at first I did not think I would be playing this game as much as I do.
title: Rocket League®

review: Are you bored of FIFA and constant EA BS? Have you ever wanted to fly cars and play soccer at the same time? Or just take flying bicycle kicks to the next level?! Don't lie you potato! You want to! Divisions! Seasons Ranked Server Lag (Okay maybe EA and Psyonix have this in common....... BUT its less laggy....?) Physics like no other BOOOOOOOOST Flight (Some skill required) AddictiveGet it you dum dum!

review: Rocket League is a great game for three reasons. Firstly it has stunning graphics and physics. Secondly it is something you can always come back to and play with friends. Thirdly the skill ceiling is sky high you can excel in many ways.Psyonix have also made great efforts at implementing tutorials training modes several fun game modes as well as a competitive ladder system and stunning cosmetics with endless possible combinations.Rocket League is a game where you'll start off laughing at your frustration and struggle to play properly but you'll eventually grow tired of the chaotic fun and instead strive to find clarity in the chaos.8/10.

review: Honest Review Review is based on current state of game.Game Pros Highly Addicting Split Screen Multiplayer 60 FPS (Its capped but unlockable if you really want more frames. But 60 is just swell) Supports In game voice/text chat Low ping (Make sure to select your region in the server filters) Clean Interface Smooth Gameplay Customizable cars (You can even give them hats!) In game replay recorder (Just hit "save replay" after any match) Incredible visuals Controller support (The game suggests to use a controller but honestly the keyboard works perfectly. All preference)Game Cons Slight lag after letting go of the VoIP button (F) No punishment for players abandoning a match Reports of crashing/freezing while watching replays Has the chance of crashing/losing connection after a round if you're in a group and not the party leaderRelateable Games Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket Power Battle CarsConclusionRocket League is an amazing game. You know those games that you play while you should be going to bed? That's this game. Only 90 minutes into the game and i've already had so much fun with it. I would honestly reccomend this game to anyone. Unless you REALLY hate soccer and you simultaneously REALLY hate cars.(If you found this review helpful consider giving it a thumbs up!)
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket league is a game that combines both football(soccer) and driving cars.The game is suitable for both casual and competitive players.But is the game simple and is it easy to be mastered? Somehow I do not think so.It takes hours and hours of practice and when u have 100 hours u realized that you can finally shoot the goal.(On the ground) To start with the game has a really good performanced ranking system which as I said is good for the competitive players. However sometimes you can have a match vs way higher level opponent which is sometimes annoying but it is still fun.I'd say it's better to practice a lot and then jump into the competitive scene of the game because sometimes when you play 2v2/3v3s and you make a lot of mistakes your partner(mostly) will flame you which isn't really nice.But if you do not care ofcourse you can play instantly ranked. In audition I have to say that the community of the game is mostly positive and friendly.But you know there are always s that will be toxic. There are many types of modes that can make the game even more attractive! I would like to say something for each.So there's 1v1 mode which is mostly based on luck but ofcourse you must have skills to have this luck.If you are not a teamplayer and you want to climb the ladder alone this mode is perfect for you! Ok so there's 2v2 too. Here's required to have more teamplay spirit and you need to know where your partner is in each situation so you can pass him and luckily score a goal.That makes 2v2s a teamplay mode. 3v3s are even more teambased mode.Just like 2v2s you need to pass a lot have a strategy and score a goal but ofcourse you can always join alone and be with 2 randoms.(NOT RECOMENDED) In conclusion I'd say that this game is really fun in any aspects.It's definitly worth it to buy.There are not dlcs that add extra power speed etc. which is great.Everything is based on skills and rarily luck.If you found this review helpful thumbs up. )
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League the sequel to Superpowered Acrobatic Rocket Powered Battle Cars is a game that fuses soccer and driving to create one of the most addictive games I've ever played. Right off the bat I can't praise the developer enough. Psyonix is perhaps the greatest developer I've come across in terms of listening to community feedback keeping them up to date with regular posted updates and patch notes and constantly reinventing the game to keep it fresh. Major bugs are always fixed within the day minor bugs don't take much longer to fix. They are always releasing new game modes customisation options and other features that make the game easier to play. Psyonix is a reliable and trustworthy developer that isn't going to abandon the game or just use it for money grabbing.The community itself is rather hit and miss. Generally half the people in your game will be friendly and show good sportmanship the other half will be the salty kind that flame you blame every goal conceded on you and challenge you to 1v1s if you happen to beat them. It's internet gaming this aspect is an inevitable one. Although being a little too trade oriented (just look at the comments of any popular Rocket League guide for evidence) the community is overall one of the friendlier that I've come across most games end up being pleasant experiences.Matchmaking is rather flawed at this point in time however Psyonix recently posted updates on the Rocket League website and on social media addressing the issues involved with matchmaking and laying out their plans to fix these problems. Skill range has increased quite significantly in ranked play following the start of Season 4 and the introduction of a new ranked system while the amount of time it takes to find an online match has at times significantly increased also. It does seem as though these issues are to be short lived and this review will be updated accordingly but at the time of writing it's probably the game's biggest flaw.The game's controls are simple comfortable and responsive. It is vitally important that you play with a controller not keyboard and mouse due to the precision needed on the part of the player during aerials and other maneuvers a keyboard setup just does not offer the same accuracy or comfort as a controller does. The button mapping is very easy to remember but is easy to edit as well should you find the need.Customisation options are initially limited and due to the presence of an in game 'economy ' some options are limited to those players that can invest money into obtaining them. Regardless the default options obtainable simply by playing games to completion are still plentiful and flexible with thousands of different combinations available here alone. The player can change the colour of their car and the decals they apply to it as well as choosing from a huge range of car body shapes wheels and 'toppers.' It does not take long for the player to be able to create a car that looks incredible.The price is more than justifiable. Assuming you spend nothing on keys and other items then you're spending 15 maximum on easily 100 hours of consistently high quality gameplay.In short I'd recommend this game to anyone. I'm not a huge fan of soccer but I'm beyond addicted to this game. The futuristic yet realistic approach works absolute wonders.

review: This game is awesome it's totally worth its full price if you are able to get it on discount don't think twice. JUST. DO IT. It's football with (ROCKET) cars I mean. Does it get cooler than that? A very large learning curve don't be mistaken by thinking this is a simple game. It's logic is simple but performing takes A WHOLE LOT of practicing. Now you decide whether that is a good or a bad thing IMO it is definitely a great thing. You can and you should play it with friends it is like so much fun to do it especially if you both suck in the beginning (which is totally understandable). If you are not the type of guy who likes to play with friends (2x2 3x3 4x4) or for that matter in a team you can always play 1x1 matches. So yeah you've got that covered. It has a LOT of customization including low priced (4euroish) DLCs so you can create your very own distinguished vehicle.Why are you still reading this? It is a 10 out of 10 (YES 10/10 GUYS) buy it install it play it if you are not the kind of guy who only plays games you instantly get to be great at you probably won't regret any of it.

review: Rocket league is a magnificent game.It can be a game just for fun to play or you can play it competitively.The DLC's are 100% not needed to play the game and are simply to improve asthetics of your car.It is definitely an original game that involves Insane goals Amazing asthetics Very little glitches And ALOT. Of salt.The progress of ranking up usually takes a while as you tend to gain 1000+ xp every match. The ranking system is actually quite good as to be the Veteran rank it takes a lot of time to get from level 20 to 30. It fits since Veterans are people that have put a lot of time into the game.It is a game that gets me insanely into it because I love getting goals and especially when you score an aerial goal. Such a sense of accomplishment.As of now I own all DLC and have unlocked all of the achievements. I have put 100 hours into the game and every single one has been worth it. If you're thinking of getting the DLC and put a lot of time into the game I recommend purchasing it if you care about what your car looks like. I plan on purchasing all DLC released (except from the soundtrack) as i love the game.I don't remember the price off the top of my head but i believe it was 15 and that 15 was MUCH worth it. This game is a must have for any 'football/soccer' lovers. In my personal opinion it is 100% better than any other football/soccer games such as FIFA and PES because you can fly. FLY! So a quick review? Yes.Buy it. Now.

review: So a friend of me asked me to do a 1 word review for Rocket League... Which words could you use while describing/reviewing Rocket League... Fun? Great? Nah that wouldn't do justice to the game. Awesome? Not correct its better then awesome. I would describe the game as EPIC! Might be a cheesy word to use but it really does justice to the game. It is even fun for people who don't like soccer. It is fun to play alone but is even more fun if you play it with friends. Sometimes you all will be rolling on the floor laughing of things that happend during the game.There is a great selection of free cars where you can choose from with special livery's for each of these cars. They really created a good solid base of the game with great range of cars/hats/rims and other things you can add on your car. Ofcourse like any other game you can buy DLC's. These DLC's will give you extra cars and some other things for a reasonable price. Great thing is you don't need to buy any of the DLC's to be better or to gain an advantage. In no way this game is pay to win. You don't even have to like soccer/football or cars to like this game. It is fun for everyone!

review: Believe the hype. While I'm typically not a big sports game player this wild combination of driving physics and soccer absolutely has me hooked. The game is fast intense unpredictable and a lot of fun. I've also so far been extremely pleased and impressed by the overwhelming majority of players I've had the pleasure of playing with and against they've generally been extremely polite and supportive interested in having some challenging fun and not losing their $#!t when someone ends up making some mistake (with the nature of the physics uneven car surfaces and speed precision ball control at all times just isn't going to happen). Well worth the price of admission a very pleasant surprise and truly a value even at full price!

review: One of the most fun games I've accientally bumped into a few years Rocket League is one of the few games I'll always have installed everywhere and easily slipped into my 'favorite games of all times'.Rocket League is also one of the few games that you really have to try in order to see how much fun it is (especially when using a controller) so I recommend you to watch some videos and if you feel interested by the gameplay definitely use the refund time to try it out. Videos can't really make justice.With the addition of the "Rumble" gameplay mode it made the game 10x more fun chaotic and dynamic. A must have for anyone looking into Co op experiences. There are a decent amount of updates that come out on a reasonable amount of time that may add new game modes arenas cars or items to customize your appearance. Sometimes it can really change the experience and bring you back into it.Be aware that there IS a learning curve. But you can take your time and practice in the tutorials or with bots (or even play co op against bots) in order to get the hang of the game. Don't expect to be a legendary player in a week and don't rush the experience it's a lot of fun to notice your improvements!I'll definitely be following Psyonix they did a great job with this one! EDIT I initially forgot to make any mention regarding the (somewhat) addition of crates and keys to unlock customization items (in other words addition of microtransactions). I'm against microtransactions and random loot crates in PC games especially in a game that sells DLCs sucessfully. It's extremely weird that Psyonix even took a step in this route. I really hope this gets changed in the future.

review: A better football game than FIFA Rocket League masterfully incorporates pseudo realistic physics and cars and enormous footballs into a whimsical yet highly competitive game worth all the attention and praise it's getting and more. Whilst the game doesn't showcase anything spectacular it is admittedly difficult to set such high expectations for Rocket League which aims to be nothing more than car football and they do it damn well. Its developers have maintained a close relationship with the community and built on the game since launch releasing free content alongside cosmetic DLCs and consistently providing its playerbase with QoL changes. With Psyonix's careful attention and support Rocket League has thrived and matured well. As it continues to improve with modular training coming soon there has been no better time than now for me to recommend this game with all the enthusiasm it deserves.

review: Great fun game. Suitable for solo and multiplayer player types. One of those easy to play hard to master games that provides a different experience every round. New content every now and again introducing new game modes and ranking systems. Only downside is the xp scaling and levels required to reach the highest rank Rocketeer (73+) seems like an impossible feat. 200 hours in and I'm barely scraping Expert.Overall Great game worthy of a buy sale or not.Addition 700 hours in and still aiming for that sweet sweet rank of rocketeer. For those new to the game you will encounter a variety of toxic players (which at the gold/plat rank are very common) but if you can ignore them and focus on your own game and your own fun you will still have a blast as time goes on you will find a decent partner or group will be a massive difference.

review: Product received for free. So let's say you just bought Rocket League.Fantastic.What now?Well let's go try the tutorial and see what's up.Controls seem pretty simple easy to figure out. Cool.So you've finished the tutorial feeling pretty good about your ability to play the game.You search for your first online match. Let's say Standard to feel out the game a bit.You get matched up with a few players who much like you have only recently started playing.You hit the ball a few times but realize it's actually a lot harder than you thought.You get a little bit better at predicting where the ball will beSuddenly you've scored a goal!You scream at your monitor in excitement!You jump out of your chair and celebrate to yourself grinning like a madmanThe game resumes and you're still grinning.Your opponents score a goal and you're still grinning.You lose the game and you're still grinning.You search for another game and you're still grinning.You realize that it's 6 00 AM and you panic because you have to go to work in 2 hours and you haven't slept all night.Was it worth it?yes. Yes it was.
title: Rocket League®

RL makes me a better husband and a better human being. Buy this game if you too wish to be a better human being. Also $20? Ez decision to buy.

review: I love this game and honestly can't find any flaws with the game at all. Games are decided on players raw talent and teamwork. I find this game very different from others in one particular way reward. Sure getting cosmetics is cool and all and you get those win or lose mind you and yeah you get some cool titles to show off your in game play time but i think that the real reward is your progression as a player. Going from barely being able to hit a ball and getting lucky goals to being able to fly through the air with only the grace a rocket powered car can portray and scoring an insane ariel goal is an amazing feeling.Pros Fairly priced DLCUnlimited Skill capMultitude of game modes and mapsFresh content monthly.Cons Cases (understandable though they need to make money)Ranked can be janky sometimes

review: I have been playing this game for a long time now so i think i m ready to give my full opinion about it.HERE WE GO!This game is a masterpiece! The game is very addictive competitive and fun. You ll have such a good time with this game if you play with friends but it s also fun on your own. Psyonix updates the game regulary so you will always have new cars/maps to play on. The game looks very good and you don t need a beast pc to run it. the controls are also easy to pick up but hard to master which makes the game a big challange. First you ll struggle to hit the ball but after a while you ll be able to perform aerials (flying goals) and dribble the ball around like it s nothing. It s also great that there is a competitive mode where you play to get a higher rank.You ll talk to your teammates and work together as one team. Teamwork is a big part of Rocket League so don t forget about it )To finish this review get the facking game you won t regret it. I promise )

review: Crashing into other players so they explode? Check. Crashing into the ball or puck (yes people there is a hockey arena for this game) so it flys away? Check.Is it fun? HELL YES!I literally got so addicted the first 5 min on this game that it was insane was I hesitating to buy this? Yes but trust me it's worth every penny. If you like games where you can have a big laugh with your friends and combine any sport you like then this is the perfect game for you!!It brings a lot of cool stuff and matches where you can really have some intense moments. Sure this is much more fun when you play with more friends but it can also be pretty fun to play alone. The extra DLC's are mostly cosmetics and just for the look for new car content and cars. So if you really like the game and want to look extra pretty to beat your enemies then sure buy some their isn't any "car improvements" on the DLC's then those in the game. But it sure does feel different to drive. It's very well balanced even though some players can be pretty good at what their doing so it feels like their cheating when they actually don't. Hope you enjoy this game!! And I hope this review helped out choosing it.I would give this game 8/10Lilith out.

review: This game is ok.... But on the real This game is absolutely one of the best games I have ever played whether you want to play this game casually or competitive this game has it all. From a season mode to freeplay to multiple maps and things called "Mutators" Which you are able to add effects to the game such as gravity ball size and much more. Gameplay One of my favorite thing about this game is the huge learning curve and skill cap. It takes time to learn how to aerial dribble hit it off the wall just right and just practially everything. Now lets get into how we could explain the gameplay...Well just compare it to soccer but if your playing a high level game OMG the ball can legit stay in the air for multiple seconds it's legit the only game I sweat while playing YES SWEAT it's so fast paced and I love it. Every game is different for the ball won't go in the same place every game has different saves different shots I think thats one of the best things I love about it no games are the same. Your always in to learn how to save new stuff shot new stuff in a new style of D and just multiple things. ESPORTS Yes ESPORTS this game has mega potential. MAJOR potential. But just like every esport it comes with time. Multiple people in the community are upset about how they have done with ESPORTS. I am actually not cuz I know it will come with time and will grow. It's actually very enjoyable to watch and another thing there's no shooting no blood no death. Why I'm saying this is it's "family friendly" Which could bring in more viewership. Not only that it's simple. Ball goes in goal thats a goal whoever has most goals wins. People can easily understand it. I think thats one of the biggest reasons I see this thing growing in time and I can't wait to see what it brings there's alot starting to be multiple tourneys pop up now. So if your looking to get into the ESPORTS scene DO IT. The scene is small right now it's YOUR CHANCE. I believe 99% this esports will become big. We just have to give it time I do think after RLCS more orgs will start picking up teams all it's gonna take is one org such as cloud9 or LG picking up a team then it will drag in more. Now this might be BIAS because I just want to see it grow. But I do believe it will come in time. Again if you want in the esports scene JUMP ON THE TRAIN NOW. "Ranked" I mostly play ranked because I want to improve my game and matchmaking IS so fun! Sometimes we'll get put against pro's LEGIT PRO'S and get penetrated like I've never been but sometimes we get close and win. Anyways lets get into discussion about the current state of matchmaking. I do tend to get salty at it at times ever since the reset for season 3. Reason I tend to get salty is it sucks being stuck in shooting star/all star FeelsBadman But this is because since the reset if the "Good Players" haven't played much there down in this rank as well we just gotta give it time and the system will fix it self. Also the hardest rank for me TO EVER get out of was Challenger Elite and I think that is the same for everyone since it kinda takes you to the next step of being in the "Blues" Rising star ECT. Conclusion This game is really great multiple aspects single player ranked a small but growing esports scene amazing gameplay multiple updates new dlc's AND SOON CRATES. If you guys want to learn about the crates go check out the reddit there's a really good post on it and I am personally happy for it. If we want the esports scene to grow we have to help so I won't be upset about crates but rather excited. I know this review seemed to show only the "Good" but I honestly can't find something I don't like other than the ranking system a little bit AT the current state. I know it will change but I'm being honest I can't find cons except maybe the community a little bit. But only in "Solo Standard" if your a higher rank and you have a bad game people gonna call you out or just be toxic. But thats only in solo standard which your not forced to play. Well that's about it for the review hopefully this helped you to buy or to not buy the game. If I messed up anything or you have a different opinion I would love to hear it! Thanks for reading.

review: Rocket League is the most creative game ever made!FIFA 16 + Burnout 3 + Starfox 64 Rocket LeagueGameplay You drive your own customized car around a pitch while trying to put a metal ball twice the size of your car into it.Customization You can put hats on your car!!!!!!Community Mostly friendly!Replayablity I have 9 hours as of the 13/2/2016 and I have only been playing it for 5 days and I'm not even close from being sick of it!Graphics AMAZING!Physics Unrealistic but I don't care!!! The stupid physics make the game ten times better!A.I. System If an online player leaves during a game he/she is replaced with and A.I. Bot. The Bot is stupid as Hell. THey usally end up scoring own goals and crahing into the back of you just as you are about to score an awsome goal. Overall they need to improve to A.I. but it does'nt take away the enjoyment of Rocket League!To be honest it is very expencive for how much it contains but its' replayability and the fact that it is so addicting will make anyone want to come back and play it. It can get really competitve too which can make up some really intense gameplay. Like I mensioned earlier regarding the A.I. it can be improved. It is extremly annoying/frustrating when someone leaves and a mentally challenged bot replaces him/her.The game can have random lag spikes from time to time which is odd for a game that has maps that do not require too much rendering. The physics engine is laughable but so fun!Due to the bad lag spikes and frustrating bots I'm giving the game 9.5/10. It is so much fun and I have not even got the chance to play it with any of my friends yet! Friends make games like this so much better!!!!

review: I bought Rocket League noticing my friends enjoying the game a lot. Personally I don't find anything wrong with the game but there is always room for improvement. I also enjoy opening crates as you can get some rare stuff from them. The game runs smoothly on recent PCs and even low to middle end CPUs can run it. I personally have a AMD FX 4300 (upgrading) and a ZOTAC GTX 1050 and run the game very smoothly at max settings! Onto the gamepaly the game has its casual style and competivive style as well. Even at the Casual level the game still manages to maintain the intensity a COMP match has. Also a good side to the game is that you can soo many games and still have time for more! If you are playing with a group of friends perferably 3 including you play the game with strategy and looks who plays the best position and play corresponding to your results. Overall good game with short timed games!

review: This game is highly addictive and worth every penny. This game is basicly a game of soccer with Rocket Cars. Each team has oppossing ends of the field. The objective of the game is to knock the ball in to the other teams goal on their side of the field as much as possible untill time runs out. There are different modes to play including a seasonal mode that you can compete to be the league champions. They also have events the current event that's going on is snow days. In snow days the ball is replaced with a puck and the field is ice. As you play you can unlock more car types rims color types toppers and more. You can play with your friends via Online Lan or local co op. Note 2 gamepads are needed to play local co op ( 1 player can not use the keyboard and mouse while the other uses a gamepad you must have 2 gamepads to play local co op)I give this game 9/10 for its addictive gameplay and replay value

review: Really great fun. It's extremely accessible but also has a startling amount of gameplay depth. This makes it silly and rewarding as you start to get better. I love how short the matches are and how varied they can be and that it's easy to play with friends. Excellent game and definitely worth picking up.
title: Rocket League®

review: This game is a must own. It is easily my favorite/most played game. The controls are great. I do recommend using a controller. The AI is pretty good when playing single player or as fill in on the non ranked multiplayer. The Multiplayer is pretty much always fun and I find that no matter what rank me and my teammates are at its always competitive. There is also a consistently large player base so finding a match doesn t take long.The best way I can describe Rocket League is it capture the feel of a sport like soccer street hockey or pretty much any fast paced competitive sport better than any sports game ever has. On top of that it is very accessible to everyone both in game play and theme. I highly recommend this game to anyone who likes good multiplayer.

review: Okay I figured I would get some hours under my belt before giving a fair review of Rocket League. Currently I sit at 24hrs and I will simply say this game is pretty AMAZING. This game takes me back a decade ago when I really played the "stuff" out of the Hockey minigame of ATV Fury 2. This is that part game but with superior physics and on a much larger scale. For reference I'm a 36 y/o PC player and have only played 2v2 matches. There are 1v1 2v2 3v3 modes. Here is a list of Pros and Cons PROS Multiplayer Open Play or Ranked Play A phlethora of vehicle accessory unlockables Plug and Play controller support. I currently run the Logitech F310 Supports Steam Broadcasting In game verbal and text chat Single Player Season Mode. This is my favorite playmode. Easy to join multiplayer sessions. Automatically places you into a random game unless you wish to join or start a private session. Tutorial is spot on Easy to learn controls Each match is five minutes in length allowing for multiple games during one gaming session There are two camera (View) modes Ball cam on/off. Ball cam enabled is difficult to master... this is a pro because of the folly's you and others will make... adding a lot of humor to the game. The graphics are humorous and robust The ball will be your nemisis but I can't stress how awesome I find the physics. I can't tell you how many times I've seen the ball hanging in the air right in line with the goal... a perfect look.... I slam on the gas and fly into the air... only to epically fail and miss the ball by miles... smiling the whole time. This is a simple game in which you use motorized rocket cars with some serious jumping abilities guiding or hitting a giant ball into your opponents goal. Once you've mustered more than a few hours you realize there is nothing simple about this game. The controls physics camera views take a lot of time to master... I'm no where close. You hit a point where you realize how strategic this game really is. You must predict your oponents every move while trying to be a master of your own. A fast paced high flying chess match where all players pieces are always in motion.CONS Multiplayer. In my sessions I've played a lot of multiplayer ranked matches. You will have issues with teammates having latency issues due to a poor ping... Thus meaning your partner will be sitting still as a ball he doesnt see on his/her screen goes right over their heads and into the goal. You will be partnered with someone with a winning complex and upon being two goals down for whatever reason will leave the game leaving you to fend for yourself. Hopefully they will update eventually to place in a substitute player or even an AI entrant. If you are already losing you are all but guaranteed to lose a 2v1 match. There will be those teammates that are ball hawks.. always leaving the goal unattended when on defense.. and always blaming you for any misfortune and upon every look at the goal you miss will take the time to let you know how incompetent you are and how they could have easily made that shot... only for them to go on and score a goal for the opposing team and rage quit )I really haven't found anything significant to dislike about this game. My dissatisfaction comes from the multiplayer aspect but that's more on the poor personalities of certain players then the game itself. The player drop problem needs to be addressed though for ranked games to be any fun at all. Half my matches had my teammate or an opponents drop the game more than likely because the game wasn't going their way. I highly recommend this game... and if you are a mature player looking to get together for a match sometime feel free to give me a shout.

review: At first the game is a little awkward. You feel like a child taking its first steps. You can't really move like you want to. It's hard.And then there's that magic moment where you score your first goal... and you get it. The thrilling explosion of dust and the crowd going wild and pretty soon you're getting the hang of power sliding flipping and really taking control of your car.And then you learn how to rocket and this game becomes something else entirely. It is a brilliant concept and truly one of the most fun and interesting pvp experiences I've had in a LONG time.10/10

review: Time to make this the new League. This is one of the most amazing games I have ever played. Grab some friends grab some Controllers (not the ones from Logitech there seem to be a lot of issues with that one lately) and have fun!Only pointing out the bad things here tho 1. The matchmaking system sucks. 2 Rookies one Semi Pro one Pro against 2 Veterans and 2 Pros? No problem.Mostly it's kinda fair tho.2. Sometimes you are put in a 0 5 game. There should be some kind of auto ending a match that's 5 0 or so when none of the losing team's original players are still in the game.3. Man the DLCs are expensive.4. As mentioned above certain Controllers don't work with Rocket league. My XBox Controllers are working fine tho although it won't take long until Steam thinks of something else to make us buy their Controller lol5. Sometimes it takes ages for you to find a match as most guys are playing Double Rankeds. And I don't have friends. jkOne HUGE additional! Plus for the game is the option to play local Splitscreen (using two controllers of the same kind) on TWO MONITORS! Get in the game choose "Borderless (window)" quit the game right click on your desktop go to your monitor options and choose that "advance this screen" or whatever it is in English to make your desktop viewable on both of your monitors. Now go on "Documents" "MyGames" "Rocket League" "TAGame" "Config" and open "TASystemSettings" with an Editor like NotePad++. Now search for "ResX ____" and "ResY ____".Change the number at ResX to the sum of both of your monitors' width and ResY to the lower of your two monitors' height. An example I am using two full HD monitors so my options are "ResX 3840" and "ResY 1080" as 1920 x 2 3840 and the height of both monitors is equal and 1080. Now start the game it should work. If you want to change back to solo screen just choose "Full Screen" in the Video Options. You are welcome.

review: Best game in the universe (my opinion).I've had so much fun flying about in rocket powered battle cars flinging a huge ball in to each others goals.I've never really liked football but this is just on a completly new level its so fun.You can even make your own games and play with friend like hide and seek or tag just go to mutator settings and make it your own.There is such a variety of maps with their own uneque shapes and sizes and there is even a basket ball map for all those people who are more in to basket ball or even ice hockey.One of the best parts is the freedom of customizing your own car but you just can't create a car it's only the colours antennas and even hats.i also love the rumble mode its absulutly amazing you can use all different kinds of abilitys like spikes and grapple pull .These two abilitys are probobly the best ones because the spikes make the ball stick to the car and it lasts quite a long time and the grapple pull brings you in untilyou hit the ball.When you hit the ball it flys of in the direction you hit it with extreme speed.I personally think it's the best for the goalies.
title: Rocket League®

review: So after playing 60+ hours on this game and played everysingle game mode it s time for me to write a review.This is a really fun/good game but if you want to play seriously be ready because you got to put a lot of effort in order to get good at this game.This game as really good graphics but if you haven t a really good pc there s no problem turn the video settings down a little bit and the game still looks awesome.The cars has a lot of modding even without DLC s and like that.Rocket League has kinda good servers what I mean by that it s like some players don t connect for some weird reason and you just stand there with your car on the field for quite some time and you have to start the queue all over again.The game has really short loading screens which I like a lot.The Community itself has made maps for training like flying with your car defend that sort of stuff which is awesome in order to get good in this game.Totally worth it to pay 20 bux for this game even without your friends it s fun AF!
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League My Favorite Multiplayer Game of 2015 Overview Rocket League is an incredibly fun game to play with friends easily being my favorite multiplayer game of 2015. The game is great fun regardless of whether or not you like sports. It's also receiving plenty of support from the developers with new maps and game modes being added for free and the only paid DLC being cosmetic. Pros Great fun for both casual and more serious players Cross platform multiplayer Splitscreen local and online multiplayer Very good performance even on lower end hardware A majority of the game in multiplayer is handled by dedicated servers so cheaters are rare if there are any All DLC is purely cosmetic with plenty of free cosmetic unlocks available in the base game and all new maps and game modes being completely free Steam Workshop support coming soon Cons No support for resolutions 1440p or higher without an INI edit Limited anti aliasing options

review: So having played this briefly in the free weekend I fell in love and had to buy it. Such a simple game but yet so brilliant. Awesome fun time with friends. Even in the current 14hrs I have when writing this review I can see that its an amazing game. Good points Simple yet fun Hats Good graphics (Unreal engine) Good physics for an arcade game Plenty of customization options to make your car stand out Devs are consistant with updates adding new things like different arenas/game types Loading times are quick and the servers seem very good no connection issues yet Soundtrack is really goodBad points (really had to nit pick to find bad points) Hate your friends when they steal your goal Could do with a little bit more to the progression other than just customization but I'm ok with this Maybe more vehicles could also be added in the 14hrs I've played I've already unlocked all the cars (other than DLC) The game is also heavily controller based I haven't personally tried playing with the keyboard but I'm guessing it probably wont be easy Everyone who plays online are extreamly salty even if you are loosing by one goal all your team leaves this is by no way the games fault just the stupid people of the earthThis is one of those games that is really easy to pick up and play but harder to master. The replayability of the game is also good found myself always jumping on just for a quick game to then find myself playing 5 6. So yeah buy the game play with friends have a lot of fun...

review: I don't always have time to play online multiplayer games with my growing number of responsibilities. Rocket League is the first game I can remember in the last 5+ years that I just can't get enough of and what's great about it is that the 5 minute matches are perfect for someone like me who can't always commit to a 45 60 minute game. Easy to understand and hard to master this game is amazing from casual splitscreen on the couch to competitive 3v3.
title: Rocket League®

review: By far one of the best games in my library. I recomand trying it out with a controller though. So I will write an in depth review of this game called Rocket League in wich I spent around 270 hours going trough many ranked leagues.Graphics Awesome! I'm not looking for graphics in a competitive game which comes with a lot of action so I don't spend that much time looking around but I am satisfied about the looking of the cars which come with soooo many options to pick! Boosts are awesome decals are awesome (if you can get a animated one OMG IT LOOKS SO GOOD) car models are of all types and affordable that you can get for a really cheap price and you will 100% enjoy!Physics Collisions and hitboxes can be improved but those are good enough to not have a game breaking impact you miss a goal because you hit the ball in a wierd possition and it jumps across the map with 10000 kmph but that's ok it happens )Once you get the ability to fly you will be so satisfied when you score an aerial goal omg it's so exciting! All the wall jumps and freestyles that you can do bring so much excitement only if you try you can jump off your chair! Even after 270 hours I am still learning and enjoying this game!Community Surprisingly good! Many of the guys that i've met in 1v1's even came with me in a private practice to teach me how to hit an aerial or such there are often guys that bm you with a "What a save!" when you miss but other than that you are not going to see game after game "kys" or flaming non stop. It's definetly a great community that I love a lot! You can find so many friends that you can play duo's and have fun.Personal enjoyinment 9/10.I don't know if it's just me but I start winning around 4 5 games in a row I get in a good division (about 2 3 rank ups) and after I get matched with a whole new level of experienced players! *and I start dropping ofc*Ranking system can be a little bit improved you win and lose a lot 2 wins can get you a division down and 3 wins can get you a division up so in 30 minutes you can even go up a league! (or go down one ))But I love this game it's 100% worth the 20$ and the DLC's I just love it and I play it daily.

review: A very fun game!Its extremely entertaining when playing alone and even more entertaining when playing with friends! Seeing each other fail and/or score sick goals is really shining in this game. Its fast paced and loaded with action. You will hardly get bored even after many hours even though the game does not change. Its still never the same game. Every game is different and is special in a certain way. The esport scene of this game is also amazing for everyone that is interested. You can learn a lot from all the pro players and I found rocket league to be even more entertaining to watch than most sports!On top of that as long as you dont tryhard in ranked games the frustration level is very low. If you win or lose in normal games doesnt really matter since you get XP anyways. In my first 50 hours of play I had so much fun even when losing since there was something to giggle about in nearly every match.Now after more than 100 hours the fun is still there no doubt! But since starting in ranked games (mid ground blue star in every category) things get a little more salty. Players can get very toxic and shout at you for not playing the way they want but I guess thats a typical thing every game suffers from. All in all this is a great game to kill some boring hours and have great fun with friends!

As simple as it is (which some people whinge about) I am still quite unskilled at it after 40 odd hours which does indicate it has some depth.One of the most exciting games to play for me in my library and always a great choice when im sick of everything else or a bit too buggered to concentrate on something more serious.
