review: An absolute blast. Fun to play and even more fun with friends.It plays like you're controlling radiocontrolled cars with boosters who can jump and then flip while airborne. The best and most streamlined variant of a kind of "Mario Kart 8" meets "Fifa XX".Add to that a streamlined interface customization clear design that gives you the information you need while you play and a huge 'income stream' of customization items that gives you loot after almost every single round whether you win or loose and this is easily worth you money.One of the most fun I've had with multiplayer games in a long time showing off both the game designers itself and what an excellent tool Unreal 4 seems to be. About one dozen people made this.I've yet to play the singleplayer and don't see a reason to do so yet. Still worth it.

review: Bought the game sometime in 2015 and thought it would be a good game to play here and there on my own. Then it became so addicting that I played it pretty much everyday. Then I got a friend to purchase it as well and he enjoyed it to. Now still playing with the same person I have clocked over 200hrs into the game and am still bad at it.Pros Easy to pick up but hard to master Replayable (for hours) Reliable servers Lots of customization Cheap DLC cars if you want to buy them Good crate system as it feels you will always get something goodCons Triggers easily Sometimes you get unfair matchmaking where it will be an Expert Veteran and Pro vs 3 Experts and you get destroyed Different for everyone but I have to use a controller to play so you will have to get a controller to play the game well unless you are mad with a keyboard and mouse Can't trade in Very Rare items which I really want in the gameOverall this is game is my favourite on steam and I am sure going to be playing it for many many more hours. So I recommend this game to anyone with 15 chilling around
title: Rocket League®

review: I saw a lot of hype for this game recently sinced it released so I decided to buy it because it was only $20 and I can say it was a great $20 well spent. The game is essentially soccer with cars that can jump and boost. With that being said it offers short and sweet matches around 5 minutes long. Those 5 minutes are crazy fun and hectic. When I first played online after the training I was having so much fun when I scored goals or demolished another person's car. In the game there is also some cool car customization but in my experience the crazier your car looks the more is stands out. Overall I really like this game and I haven't had this much fun with a game in a while. I will be recommending it to my friends and hope this game gets more recognition!
title: Rocket League®

If you wanna have mad fun go for standard/special modes11/10 would teach grandma againPS grab some friends

Not having the ability to chose all locations (I dont want a person with 500 ping on my team) Ping Limit (set at 150) If ping spikes it's fine set a timer of 1 minutes and if it doesn't go lower then limit it kicks them Ranked Gameplay now has Banned for 15 minutes if you leave AFK timer

review: This game is a great game physics is being perfected with the updates variety of cars to choose from with differences to hitboxes and turn radius and some fun game modes like the rumble hoops and snowday its easy to pick up hell of a lot of fun to play and very addictive.Edit retracted the previous points of why i didn't recommend this game which was smurfing broken matchmaking and ranking system much of these have been fixed to an okayish level the ranking system was revamped smurfing has been made harder to do on ranked play at the most part.Cons right now are the ones below for me and it only applies to my region.In Asia the servers are still bad we get some good days but most of the week pings are way over 300+ and the blame should be equally on the companies in Asia they are choosing to host these servers and themselves still okay for the casual player because the EU servers are a good compromise which give 200/250ping and this is as good as its gonna get i suppose.Edit 28/3/2017Been approximately six months maybe more that the asian servers have broken lags random high pings on some cheap servers and plain broken servers in the mix that no one can play on that becomes a battle of who forfeits first on competitive after the recent dopshot update the NA EU and OCEANIA servers came under trouble and lo and behold the racist mfkers issue a written statement on why its unreasonable to have lag and long matchmaking times with an end note saying Asia will be fixed when pigs can fly more like. ASIANS stay away from this money grubbing craphole made for the white skinned people. stay away.The letter in question https //www.rocketleague.com/news/server performance a letter from our ceo/

review: This game is a very well done combination of football and awesome rocket powered cars.If this review is too long i advise you just skip to my verdict.PROS*Lots of vehicle customization i.e hats paint jobs car bodies *A variety of unique game modes such as the fairly recent basketball one *So much fun to play against/with friends*The graphics are really nice everything looks detailed and very polished*The lack of bugs i've ran into is amazing *The tournament league mode where its you with a team of bots playing in a tournament is very enjoyable*Its fun even if you're like me and don't like football or car games that much *When you're new to the game and you get expert team mates CONS*Sometimes the game goes a bit laggy and makes you feel like you're using McDonald's WiFi*The feeling of your team mates head lights beaming into your soul when you score an own goalVERDICT With the many more pros to cons i'd say this game is excellent and would recommend it to absolutly everyone. The graphics are superb there is a wide range of customisation and multiple different game modes none of which i dislike.I will give this game a....10/10 would score own goal again

review: Ok so rocket league is a pretty damn fun game so let's go over the pros and cons PROS Great gameplay with very few bugs Very well optimised had no trouble getting 60fps on ultra with my gtx 750ti Amazing Graphics Great soundtrack Active developers that make regular updatesCONS The AI in singleplay can be a bit stupid sometimes scoring own goals and the like Matchmaking is messed up. The game will often be unbalanced with newer players on one team and much more experienced players on the other. Not to mention a lot of players who are Masters often create new steam accounts and play the game on those as a rookie therefore making it hard for legitimate new players to get points (though this is more of a problem with the community not the game itself)Overall a great game and worth the money but be prepared for frustration along the journey to Master level
title: Rocket League®

review: This is *literally* the most fun game I have ever played
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League. The game combining cars soccer and rocket boosters. The funnest game (and I'm not exaggerating) i've ever played probably in my life. Easy to start and figure out as you play against other people but can be very challenging and stylish as you go on. When I found Rocket League I was a tad skeptical but VERY enthusiastic. I am so glad I decided to spend $20 on this incredible game and would've spent more on it if it was more expensive. Now there have been bugs and very frustrating times I have experienced and have seen others experience but it was all worth it in the end. And with new features being added constantly new maps new gamemodes new cars and now cases the game has become all the more better (although some people dislike the crates system). Overall I'd give this game an incredible 9.5/10 for amazing gameplay amazing multiplayer nice soundtrack great community hundreds and hundreds of hours of fun and just being overall an incredible game. The only thing I think may need some work is maybe some more Singleplayer features but besides that incredible game get it try it it's worth it. Note though alothough I think this is an amazing game you may not think so so try and look at more reviews to get more of a perspective of what this game is worth and how fun it is. D

review: Have you ever gotten the feeling that some videogames feel more like chore than actually fun? Well Rocket League is msot certainly not one of them. Regardless of if you're amazingly good or you suck at it you can easily have a ton of fun at it. It's one of the most refreshingly new concepts for a game.For some people it feels like it allows you to finely tune your skills to the game. Every time you play you can feel you're getting better at it and developing these awesome techniques. And for others it's none of that! It's one of the sillies funnest games out there where suddenly you're about to score an awesome goal and your team mate bashes into your car and launches you across the court. It's all good tho beacuse 20 seconds later you can do it back to him. In a matter of hours you're already making friends and my experience with it is that if you're generally relaxed and non toxic the community really comes forward. Players are eager to find teamates for fun games. I've made some of my best friends in this game.Oh and did I mention the developers? They are constantly hearing the players and working on ways to get more in touch with them and offer them tools and solutions to problems.The only problems with it are firstly it's matchmaking which functions in a way only understandable for Nazis or demons. Also if you have friends in XBone don't expect to play with them any time soon because Microsoft tends to have a similar minset to that of Hitler. You also might find the occasional bully who will belitle the noobs and insult everyone but that's expected in any multiplayer game.Tuly my favorite game of all time. And I'd type more about it if I weren't as lazy. But to sum up it's a fantastic game for it's refreshing gameplay combined with great skill allowance open non toxic comunnity and in touch developers.10/10 must buy.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is hard to compare to most games due to its nature. The short 5 minute games allow you to play back to back for hours or just a few during a study break. There are so many different skill levels and even though i still remember not being able to fathom actually shooting a ball into the net now aerials and dribbles are second nature. Matchmaking has its flaws although overall it can never be perfect. My only critism is the report a player feature I've encountered the same player many times throughout my near 1000 hours and he is the most toxic and outright disgusting player. I have reported him nearly every game along with many others and yet nothing is done. This leads me to believe nothing is actually done in regards to these reports. Psyonix please do something about D'Alessandro.
title: Rocket League®

review: Be careful buying this game. Once you pick it up you will get one more game syndrome. It s really that fun to play. The games are quick and even if you lose you watch every score replay and try to see what you did so you can get better. This is a fun game solo but it s even better with a group of friends! That being said you can play local or go online with a split screen group and have a great time if your system can handle it!Rocket League is easy to pick up and with a little bit of work you can really do amazing things in this game. The skill cap is as high as you want to take it and trust me this is one of those games that you will see yourself in the training section practicing because you want to get better!I have not really run into any highly toxic players of note just people that give up and quit out. On top of that it also has cross play with the Playstation Network and has been rumored to be headed to the Xbox One so I don t see the community fading away quickly on this game.For the $20 this game currently costs I would highly recommend it. You will definitely get your money s worth!

review: PROS Love this game!! I was a little skeptical at first because after all it's a game about cars but it was highly recommended to me by a friend so when I built my first PC I decided to give it a try. I AM NOW OBSESSED! It's never ending fun trying to improve your own skills and work with teammates to grind to those higher ranks. There is also an awesome trading community which I love. It's so much fun to try and collect the best looking and rarest items. There are so many fun gamemodes which are all hard to master but can be really fun. CONS People in this game can be kind of toxic. Scratch that VERY TOXIC is what I meant to say. Sometimes you will have nice competitive matches with respectful players but other times (at least at my skill level) there are players who wont hesitate to make fun of you with the very sarcastic chat commands. When I first started this made me question if I really did suck at the game because 75% of the time I would completely whiff which is actually normal for new players I later found out. Don't get discouraged when people spam you with What a save! when you miss the ball or Nice Shot! when you score an own goal. For the first about 15 hours I had on this game it wasn't very fun but after you reach a certain level this game is amazing.

review: This game is great.Its cars that play football.What else do you need to know?Its easy to get a hang of but difficult to master.Matches last 5 minutes (a bit more if its a tie score) so its a great game to play when you dont have much time to play.You can customize everything on your car from the body type to tires exaust flames car stripes flags and hats.You unlock stuff simply by playing a match so the more you play the more stuff you unlock.The game is fun and adictive so you can easly lose a couple of hours playing it without even noticing.If you want to play it with your friends but they dont have the game its ok just give them controlers and you can pretty much split screen play with them from the same account either local offline versus modes or even online matches.The maximum number of players that you can have in your team is 4 and the minimum is one so you can pretty much play with whatever group size you want.My only gripe with the local players is that you cannot rename them.Your profile name becomes theirs aswell with the added "(number)" next to their name.I really wish that they could add renaming option to the game that would make it even better.All in all this game is a 10/10 from me because it gives you great time playing solo or can be a great party game that you can play with your friends online or localy.Im giving this game 10/10 and have to add that this is one of the games that you have to have in your steam library.Its worth every penny.
title: Rocket League®

review: On first loading the game I was having a lot of fun batting the ball around with other noobs. Then I saw someone fly up in the air and hit the ball and I realized there was more to this than meets the eye initially. The skill ceiling in this game is ridiculous as the best player would have to instantly predict the path of the ball when someone hits it AND move into the right position and pull off the shot. 225 hours in I can make some pretty sick shots but I still am learning and there is still a long ways to go. The early gameplay all takes place on the ground and can feel like a bunch of dogs chasing a car but as skill/time progresses the strategy seeps in and you can hit the ball higher in the air from further away. Instead of chasing the ball you know whether to make a play or fall back and can pull off increasingly better defensive plays and shots/passes. If you get frustrated by having inconsiderate or noob teammates this game will probably frustrate you. Ball chasing teammates can ruin the game but luckily the games only last 5 minutes and there is unranked play that you can join or leave freely.

review: Best game of 2015! Sure there are more impressive games by terms of scope and innovation but few games have ever made me just smile like a Cheshire Cat for hours upon end like Rocket League.This game makes you feel like a moron at times and a hero at others. Dumb luck and spectacular displays of skill are sometimes one in the same.Sometimes people describe games as "tight" and this game should be the definition of tight game design going forward. There's not a single game mechanic or system that isn't honed to perfection. This game gleems with the sharpness of a surgeon's scalpel. This is my desert island game.
title: Rocket League®

review: This game is basically playing soccer (football) with race cars in a nutshell. But underneath the surface it's so much more. It's so easy to pick up and start playing and difficult to master. It's everything you could look for in a competitive sports game and more. But you don't like competitive sports games you say? Don't let that stop you. Whether you play as a casual player or a hardcore competitive player you'll find something to like. And did I mention how fun it is? Oh my god it's a blast. Even better if you bring your friends.Also this is one of the few multiplatform games out there with the game being available on both the PC and Playstation 4. Mouse/Keyboard or Gamepad the controls are slick and work great. Although I find gamepad easier to use for this game (works great with Xbox 360 controller). It's probably gonna be considered one of this year's biggest surprise hits. It has a high Metacritic score for a reason. Don't wait for a Steam sale. BUY IT NOW! Highest recommendation! Seriously. Why are you still reading when you could be playing Rocket League!?
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is a great rocket car powered soccer game. There are multiple levels to gameplay as you get more advanced. You start off playing normal soccer but it quickly turns into flying around the map scoring unbelievable goals. The controls are easy to use or configure the graphics are beautiful and there's new content added all the time.

I'd imagine having two or three friends to play with helps a lot but the community as a whole seems friendly most of the time so it's probably not a necessity.(Also I'm using mouse and keyboard and that works excellently for me since that's what I'm used to)

review: TLDR version could be 10/10 but sometimes literally unplayable due to server lagging so 6/10Pros Really fun Easy to play hard to master Spectacular and exciting gameplay awesome tricks Really rewarding (10 hours into the game and already dozens of unlocks) Good vehicle customization Good idea to put a league as single player mode in it.Cons Really really frustrating lag issues also known as rubberbanding. It is a server side problem and is caused by unoptimized physics and/or network code. It usually ruins your game and occurs every 20 40 seconds (mainly on crowded EU servers as I found out). Just as always with simple competitive multiplayer games sadly there are lots of annoying arrogant kids. Annoying "Buy our newest and greatest DLC it is cheap and great and you should buy it!" window in the main screen which you can't close.

review: Have you ever watched any of the Top Gear episodes where they play football with cars? If not stop reading and go watch one now! If you have then imagine that but at 4 times the speed with cars that can jump and boost to even more ludicrous speeds in an arena where driving on the walls is not only allowed but encouraged! This game is pure no nonsense balls to the wall fun whether you like football or not (I don't much like it personally) you will have a lot of fun with this. The handling of the cars of just the right level of arcadey fun that you always feel in control and you very quickly get to grips with the camera which does about as good a job as it can trying to keep up with the ball! Once you have the basics of the game down there are plenty of tricks you can pull to keep the ball away from the opponents and going toward their goal. On top of these there is lots of neat car customization which includes the usual decals flags wheels and boost smoke colour and of course the hats! Hey it works for TF2 so why not put a hat on your car )There are a couple of modes exhibition and season vs the AI which is the best way to start playing until you start to figure out how stuff works and then there is the online mode. Whether you play in a random group or with friends the online mode is a lot of fun and will keep you going to many months to come!All in all this is a thorough recommendation from me football has finally become fun again for me and all it took was cars in hats!

review: It's car soccer. Do you really need any other reason for wanting this game?For those still reading Rocket League is the epitome of video games that I could ever ask for. It's easy to learn and very hard to master. You can have fun regardless of your skill level whether you are just flinging your car at the ball in a 4v4 bunch ball rugby match or if you've mastered the art of manipulating the boost to fly across the map and score a clutch goal in 2v2 ranked. The learning curve is very smooth as it allows you to test out all kinds of things from first learning how to fly with boost to getting the right angle to block a shot without just sucking the fun out of exploring the nuances of the game. There is ranked casual a single player season and now rocket labs are being introduced which are different maps that can really stretch your knowledge of angles whether the map has turned into a circle or the goal has split into two different halves at a 45 degree angle or terraces are added to the sides completely screwing over any concept of car physics you ever knew.Games are 5 minutes each which definitely has the "just one more game" appeal to it as you can either have an amazing game and follow it up with another while you're hot or have a terrible game and want to end on a good note. It's not quite so bad that you will just casually burn through an entire afternoon playing it but is definitely good enough to play out for an hour or two.Perhaps the most compelling reason for me stating that it is the epitome of a video game is that it's all for fun. The skins are internal to the system so there's no trading. Rankings can be compared to friends but overall don't mean that much. This game is definitely at it's best when you just have a group of friends using some loose coordination to pull off spectacular plays and more importantly the epic failures that lead to spamming "What a save!" when your teammate completely whiffs and the other team scores in overtime to win the game.

review: TL DR It's fantastic easy to pick up difficult to master.I have played probably 250 hours in this game (I have played a ton with friends on their consoles and PCs so those hours aren't on my Steam total). I have probably spent 100 hours just watching people play Rocket League including tutorials and professional competitions such as the Rocket League Championship series. Because of these two things I think I have enough experience to credibly give a full review of the game.Pros Easy to pick up. The basic controls are very simple I would say simpler than Mario Kart. The rules are incredibly simple 5 minute games get the ball in the net more than your opponent. Instantly addicting gameplay. I have several friends who do not play games at all and still play Rocket League several times a week. The game is fast and gorgeous and every goal feels like an accomplishment. Huge amount of depth. I've spent more time on this game than any other I've played with the exception of The Witcher 3 and I would not consider myself anywhere close to mastery. Learning advanced mechanics such as powersliding flying dribbling fast kickoffs etc. opens up whole new levels of play and learning the elements of strategy such as positioning and rotations is key to being a top player. None of the top players in the game (some with more than a thousand hours) are even close to the skill cap yet and new techniques are being discovered by players. Robust online play. For casual players there are modes that can be played without regard to rank and some modes that are different than the standard competitive modes such as hoops (basketball) snowday (hockey) and chaos (4v4). Hopping into a match is quick and easy and there is endless replayability in these matches. Hopping onto the competitive scene provides challenge to people who want to prove themselves and get better eventually becoming champions. Since the matches are only 5 minutes long it is very easy to squeeze one or twelve matches into a spare few minutes. Cool collectibles. There are tons of boosts toppers decals paint and antennas that can be earned by playing and cars are very customizable. Certain items are earned from reaching a new ranking level before the season ends. There is a fun little trade in system to earn more rare items by discarding some more common ones. I would love to see some expansion on this with more items but there are so many right now it is difficult to complain. Built in training system. There are modes that allow free play goalie striker and aerial training which are quickly accessible and useful for building skill and training for more advanced skills. There are also modes which allow games against bots when for training or when offline play is the only option. Very active developers. I have to give a shout out to Psyonix for giving this game the life it deserves. The developers hear the complaints of the players and fix issues with the game and are constantly adding new content (collectible cars and maps). Growing eSports community. There are some people who believe it or not make lots of money playing Rocket League. There are professional players right now playing in one of the world's largest eSports tournaments the Rocket League Championship Series (RLCS). This game is the perfect game to be an eSport because it is very viewer friendly and has spectating built in. There are new tournaments for Rocket League starting all the time. Pioneer for cross platform play. Players on PC Xbone and PS4 can all play with each other and against each other online. Play with friends in a lobby regardless of the platform.Cons Must have a good internet connection. Playing online is very difficult if your internet connection sucks. I would recommend having 120 ping or less. Some small bugs. The few bugs that pop up very rarely almost never affect gameplay but spectating can have a couple issues with the camera and nametags.I think that about sums up the game. It is by far my favorite sports or online game and one of the best games I have ever played. Worth it for the casual or hardcore.

review: With (at time of writing) 266 hours of game time I think it's fair for me to put down my verdict.+ Great graphics (for those interested). This game doesn't get boring to look at and I have a feeling it has one of those timeless designs that will still look good as the years fo on.+ Fantastic attention to detail. Small swaying grass tire skids tire squeaks on the Basketball mode and outside the arena fountains that are fully animated clock that actively counts down the time. Despite mostly looking at the ball when playing the game there's plenty to notice if you stop and look around. Stress on "if". + Low barrier for entry. Unlike MOBAs which pretty much require mastery before your first game it's easy to hop into a match and do decently. Just have the right attitude and you're good to go.+ High skill ceiling. There are still moves being discovered. Early on it was aerials. Then pinches. Now rooftop dribbling and Freestyles. I wonder what's coming in next!+ Excellent Dev Communication. Active on both the forums and subreddit and regularly interacting with fellow members. + No Pay To Win DLC. The cars you get free are just as good as those you buy. And end of the day all you need is skill. Multiplayer matchmaking. As of now you either get a game really quick but with poor competition or after a long while with good competition. At times with opponents that easily overpower you. Have patience though. Slightly toxic community. It used to be better hopefully doesn't get much worse. I'd recommend disabling your level tag (the one that says You're a Master Rookie etc) as too many people think experience skill. You get experience from playing bot matches too so it doesn't exactly translate. Easy bots. Playing on All Star (which is the highest it gets) and you can still pretty much win easily. They're best for warmups or early days so I wouldn't say it's a bad thing.Overall this is definitely a game that everyone should try. There's a huge playerbase now with the crossplatform multiplayer (at times the lowest I've seen is 10000 in Asia East and SE Mainland two regions I frequently select) and highest being 28000 in the unranked public playlist. Once you learn the tricks of the game how to play what position and so on along with the camarederie you build with total random strangers it really is something special. One game you may barely touch the ball. The next you're scoring a wall jump aerial. It's that great. Definitely recommend.

review: I only got this game because all the reviews were great thats one purchase made on reviews I will never regret.Pros You will never be bored game/skill progression is unrivaled by any game. There is always something new to learn! Casaual and Competitive modes The only thing that affects your gameplay is which car you chose all other costomizations are visiual only AI and singleplayer is great when you first start Gives you a reason to live once you get addicted Great Party and Trading systems You will want to make friends with people you find you play best with Awesome training modes Custom maps to explore Not a very hardware intense gameCons You really should buy a controller if you want to get any good You NEED a high framerate for this game anything under 55fps will not cut it in my opinion Once you get more experienced you will develop a dream to go to RLCS and begin to train tirelessly ignoring your homework family and responsibilities. You will find yourself staying up till 2 31am playing and dream of making amazing air dribbles in your studyhall as you catch up on sleep.Tips Find people you play well with and try to get to know them and play with them The youtube community is amazing. There are plenty of really helpfull tutuorials online from great players! And...Then there's NeatMike and the rest of F2. When chosing a car how well you play with it is always more important than how it looks Learn how to jump up and meet the ball asap sticking to the ground will punish you eventually Train Train Train. Pratice is the best thing you can do to help your game Ball controll is always more impressive than lucky freestylesBrb gonna go play just 5 more miunites )

review: Pros easy to learn to play. graphically beautiful not so much power consuming. Lots of different playmodes both serious and fun. The competitive system is really good people rarely disconnect at my rank (prospect which is surprising. Good enough community. micro transactions only offer new skins cars etc. You buy the whole game and you miss NOTHING. You loot an object at the end of EVERY GAME. Even if you lost. In a good 10hrs of play you can fully customize any car the way you want. Finished and polished game very few bugs. PS4 and PC can play together via Psynet. Isn't that wonderful. No lag felt during matches.Cons You HAVE to have a controller. Unplayable with keyboards. If someone quits a competitive match you'll be screwed bots can only attack and are mindless. If you miss goals make big mistakes while in competitive you'll get bashed and insulted. But that's in prospect not the whole game ... no communication besides pre programmed interactions between PS4 and PC players.In overall it can be fun with friends or a highly competitive game. It can switch from casual to competitive in a snap.8.5/10. Barony Certified.

Single player is a little disapointing the AI literally don't seem to care if they're on your team and are a hinderance. For example I had 2 season matches where my AI teammate scored no less than 2 goals they weren't accidental tap ins either they were purposeful dribbles up the pitch to score. I had to start defending against my own AI team mates! o

review: I love this game to bits! On paper this might sound like a simple and silly game but after 480+ hours I can easily say that this game is anything but. And I can't say enough about the Devs Psyonix they are just the best. I have had this game for over a year now and have seen many free content updates maps modes and customizables alike. This game is a steal for $20!The first few times you play you will probably be very confused and the camera really takes some getting used to. But don't worry because RL has a great matchmaking system that will see you match with equally skilled players (most of the time). After you have a few hours of practice and you have the basics down I suggest heading over to YouTube for some begginer tutorials. It's a quick way to learn how to better control the ball and in no time you will be the MVP of your matches. Once you feel comfortable enough you can try out the ranked matchmaking system which is a competetive league compared to the unranked system which doesn't count towards your ranked level. Another great thing about this game is its tremendous Esports value. Where other Esports games like CSGO Overwatch and LOL are sometimes hard to follow and understand Rocket League is just completely different. It opens a whole new door in Esports as probably the easiest game to understand (the ball goes into the goal and you score 1 point). It's just incredible to watch the pros play this game and see the things they can do. I'm sure I have much more to get out of this game and I am so thankful that Devs like this still exist &lt 3. Thanks Psyonix and keep up the good work!
title: Rocket League®

review: In the Season mode how the is it justified that a team going 0 10 is capable of kicking your (let's say you're going 10 0 so far)? Like really this CPU team has supposedly lost every single match they've played in and suddenly once they face you (the undefeated champion at this point) they stomp your I get it scaling up the difficulty is a thing... But this is supposed to be like a sport so the ing teams that are losing horribly everywhere else shouldn't ing stand a chance against you by the time they come up.I play Pro in Season at the moment. 18 Weeks. Presently I'm going 8 0. That's EIGHT wins ZERO losses. Then I come up against the piece of Bombers who are going 1 7. 1 WIN and 7 LOSSES. How the ing did they beat me?! Why the were they the hardest team I've faced as of yet?! t. Stupid mother ing game with it's scaling CPU's can go to ing hell. ing Ehem anyways... This game is the greatest game I've played in like 10 years buy it. Just ing do it. P.S. you Bombers. I hope your entire ing team dies in a ing wreck.

review: It's a mixed bag. Nothing about it is good for or welcoming toward new players. Matchmaking creates uneven teams more often than not. Netcode will change your position speed and orientation if there are lost packets and replays will show you conveniently swerving to perfectly avoid a block or shot where you where driving completely straight. The physics are predictable but only after you learn them the hitboxes are based on invisible borders that may vary widly from the appearance of the vehicle. The graphics are nothing to speak of the music is awful the statistics are meager the default controls are not set up well "support" for anything beyond 1920x1080p60 is a lie and the camera gets locked behind the wall. Despite all of that I still play it because it's fun.
title: Rocket League®

review: Labor of Love Award! 2017I Thought This Game Was Cool Before It Won An Award! 2016I instantly knew this game was going to be great when I first laid eyes on it.Easy to learn freakingly hard to master.Keep on trying to Fly!Instant Favorite! Get It!Detailed Review Positive (aspects) Variety of Arenas to play in (more are still coming thanks to Rocket Lab) Many customization options for your RC car Ranking system is similar to CSGO (play first 10 games before getting a rank) DLCs are optional and does not affect gameplay (Cosmetic DLCs are the greatest NOT Pay to Win) Gameplay is fun and refreshing every match (because it's a Sports game) Training Mode (allows you to practice new moves and improve old ones) Season and Exhibition Mode (for those who wants to play Single Player or warm up before playing Online) Stats Page (to see your Win/Lose % and amount of MVPs) Replay Page (to watch your best matches... duhhhhhhh)Negative (aspects) Random drops in FPS Random temporary disconnection in game (major problem when playing competitive because every second counts)As a result this game proves that Indie game developer can do just as well (or BETTER) than AAA game companies.Nice Shot!Nice Shot!Nice Shot!Chat disabled for 5 seconds.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League's unique mechanics allow for a gameplay experience like no other. Soaring through the air smacking a loose ball into the net is a feeling only rocket league can give you. The game is highly team based so make sure you have some friends to play with. Rocket league may seem like a simple innocent game at first but behind this is a massive skill curve which can require a LOT of practice. Even with 50+ hours on the game everytime I play I still learn new things. Rocket League devs are active and I can't wait to see where it goes next!
title: Rocket League®

review: Oh boy..here we go...Being a fan of soccer I LOVE THIS GAME and i like RC cars too the question is would i recommend the game to a friend? Yea i think i would. Its easy enough to just pick up and play and alot of fun when you play with friends but the match making.....sheesh....could use some work. I have 300+ hours in this game so its about time i wrote a review....I am blue star and consider myself an above average player who likes to play defensive (which im scorned for but i saved the team's butt on a number of occations but noone cares about that) and then all out assault with a counter attack WHICH USUALLY WORKS!! BUT!!! I keep getting matched with players below me and players of the same rank who i have no idea how they got there. ANyway thats a personal gripe to the point....Pros Fluid Gameplay Easy to pick up Fun with friends Perfect for Lan Parties Visuals amazing Arenas colorful and relaxing NOT PAY TO WIN all DLC are asthetic ONLY!!!!Cons Camera angles Getting used to switching on and off ball tracking Hitboxes being different in each car Custom arenas that just make the ball bounces impossible to predict Pinches and physics of the ball just being totally random at times Single Player is useless to play unless its just for practice. NO SINGLE PLAYER CO OP!!!!I would still recommend this game and its out of 10 ratio would be as followsEase of picking up the game 8/10Gameplay 8/10Multiplayer 8/10Community 4/10 (its just the toxic playerbase of league of legends YE BE WARNED!)Beauty 10/10Skill Based game 9/10 (except for those totally crazy pinches)Overal Recommend and would buy again!!!

review: This has been one of the biggest if not THE biggest surprises of the year for me. The moment I played it I was hooked. This is a very well balanced casual and competitive game with a towering skill ceiling. It has been a real joy to see my skill improve from day one to now over one hundred hours of gameplay. There are a variety of cars to choose from which all behave the same for the most part (there are slight differences in the hitboxes and turn radii afaik) and you can also customize these cars with paint schemes skins hats wheels and antennas (these do not change car performance). You can choose to play 1v1 up to 4v4 either casually or competitively with a rankings ladder and all of the maps look great but have the same layout (devs have mentioned adding more unusual layouts in the future). I was on the fence about this game for a month or so after release but I am kicking myself for not picking this up earlier. I have played 104 hours and the game hasn't become stale. Rocket League is pure unadulterated fun. P.S. As of this writing there are 3 DLC packs available at reasonable prices that add nothing but new vehicles and cosmetic options.

review: Don't let the huge competitive scene around this game scare you it's still great for casual fun with family or friends.Controls are tight and satisfying nothing feels better than sinking an aerial shot into the goal from midfield. Additional gamemodes like basketball and hockey as well as custom game parameters like gravity strength ball shape and infinite boost plus experimental maps with non standard shapes (my favorite being the horseshoe shaped field with goals on either end of the arc) all mean you will never get bored with this game. Once you get into it it's tough to put down. If you think you'll like it I guarantee you will.

review: Rocket League is great! Yes it has some issues but all games do. Rocket League offers excitement competition fun with friends and a lot more. I play every day(at least once) because of how much fun it is! I almost exclusively play ranked matches. Ranked Season 1 definitely isn't built well but the changes for Season 2 (starting in February) look awesome! Ranked Season 1 is just based on the number of points you have and you gain or lose points each game depending on whether you win or lose. Season 2 is supposed to be based on your skill taking more into consideration when ranking you. I can't wait for Season 2 and I do not see myself stopping playing this game any time soon!EDIT I've had the game for nearly 3 years now and I'm still playing it almost daily. It's still so much fun with how much you can do with your car (I think the possibilities are almost literally limitless)! Definitely recommend this game to ANYONE who likes to play video games. Feel free to send me a message or anything if you have questions!

review: I recommend this game This game is a great game. It has a wide variety of cars and items to add to your car such as hats and antennas. With the items in the game you can create over a whopping 10 billion car combinations! There are a few different game modes you can play and Psyonix just recently added a new funny and exciting game mode called Rumble . You have two teams orange and blue. The main objective for each team of course is to score the most goals. It has a lot of game modes but each one is similar and for some people this could get boring. However I have 500+ hours on the game and I still enjoy it as much as I did when I played my first match.Some people think the price is a bit expensive but for me it couldn't be better. You can't complain at a great game for a price of 15 when there are others out there for 25 40 and they aren't even good. Also the DLC's are pretty good the price range being around 1 2.50.BUY IT!!

review: Rocket League Review I absolutely love this game. The controls are quite smooth when using a controller. I've found that as you play the game you'll master more tricks. I've gotten pretty good in the few (few meaning 58) hours that I've played Rocket League. The developers Psyonix are also incredible. They really care about their players and do everything they can to make sure that people are having a great experience. They also charge reasonable prices. No DLC for $40 *Cough* EA *Cough* I thank them for everything they've done and will do for us. I'd definitely recommend this game to friends. I've already gotten one friend hooked on Rocket League and I hope to get a few more on board. Now if you'll excuse me I have a few goals to score. )

review: A near perfect video game.This game is a rollercoaster ride of emotions. At certain points anger is induced not by the game itself but by my inability to perform at peak perfomance when I know I can do better. Some games I play well I land my aerials and precision shots are spot on. Other games I almost feel like I'm back at square one struggeling to get to grips with even the most basic concepts of the game. I guess this could be applied to any competitive skill based multiplayer game. Just know that no matter how good you get at Rocket League you will still miss the odd slow rolling ball by dodge jumping sideways instead of forward helplessly watching the ball CRAWL into the opposing team's goal along with your dreams.Wow!Wow!What a save!10/10
title: Rocket League®

review: This is one of the best games on Steam and I highly recommend it. It's a fast pace game with absolutely lovely mechanics. Whether you want some action to have fun or just to relax on your chair (or couch) this a an awesome choice. You will spend a huge amount of time on this game playing trading or simply using the soundtrack of the main menu as a background of your other activities. I really like the trading system that they've made because it's different from the one in CS GO. There are hundreds of ways to customize your car and in order to get some of the rare items you don't need to spend even a cent because while playing you will get crates and other items which you can trade for something else with other players. So get this game and have a good time with it. 10/10

review: ... The ball is everything. Nolifer update I don't think I will ever be able to stop playing this. It has ceased to be a video game. It is a constant. I dream of flying cars and shots with impossibly perfect trajectories. I feel the field beneath my wheels. I pirouette in the air looking for a glimpse into the very fabric of time and space a way to find the unsaveable Quantum Angle. I am finally whole. It's football with rocket cars and none of the BS. Takes a minute to learn and the rest of your life to master. One of the very best games I have ever played. Need proof? Look at how many hours I have spent on it. I don't regret a sincle second of it and the game is just as fun now as it was in the beginning. The community is super active and the developers keep on adding great new things. A truly special experience. Starbase ARC update With this update Rocket League now has an incredible customizable training mode. which is a massive advantage if you want to learn the trickier shots the game has to offer. And trust me they can get really really tricky. But nailing an upside down deflection shot or chasing the ball off the wall and into the goal with a freestyle aerial is an incredible feeling. And now you have all the tools you could possibly need to get there.
title: Rocket League®

review: I prefer keyboard and mouse when gaming.I don't like racing games.I get bored by playing sports games.Yet rocket league is a unholy mixture of all of it and I play it with a controller AND it has replaced tf2 as my goto "relax and game" multiplayer game (which says a lot as I have 1800+ hours in tf2).The game is not perfect but the developers listens to the community and responds to suggestions very often.Some people don't like the crate system they implemented and that's fair it's a good thing you can turn it off so you won't recieve them.Also you'll learn very quickly that nice compliments can be used in very very sarcastic ways.However if you like voice chat know this The voice codec used is literally garbage and even the best microphone will sound garbled and barely understandable so please don't use it.

Play this game with friends is what makes this game so glorious Buy it support Psyonix and enjoy the exciting matches of Rocket League! I give this game the highest rating and recommendations!UPDATE 2017 STILL ROCKING (or Rocketing) )UPDATE 2018 "Never give up never surrender!" STILL PLAYING!

review: Oh hey just passing by after 950 hours. So I've played a bit I'm good but no pro but that isn't the point.After playing the game since release and will still play a lot more I can honestly say that for 20 bucks you just can't miss that game. Don't believe me ? Buy it play it you won't refund. Sure there's some kind of drama going on right now because of the crates but come on guys there's an option to totally hide this functionality if you don't like that. I personally do like it bought some keys got some good stuff but I'm playing the game every day so why not.The gameplay you say ? Oh sorry I forgot about that. Well at first you'll be lost but within the first 15 minutes you'll get all the controls of course use a gamepad. Now how many hours do you need to master them ? Hahaha silly...Someday maybe just keep trying I'm still on it so good luck to you and welcome to Rocket League !

review: What can I say about this "great game" for 400 hours?1) Not a balanced competitive mode.2) Do Not understand the system of lowering and raising of ranks.3) Very bad physics. Sometimes.4) Cases which do not benefit.5) Useless dlc.6) This optimization if you have a weak computer.7) Excellent system ban. Playing against a beginner you can lose with a score of 10/0. Just people playing on new accounts nothing is forbidden. But if you write it your teammates are noobs you will be banned. Cool Eh?Summing up what we have. Sometimes do not understand physics unbalanced competitive mode and cool the system ban. If you do not mind the nerves then this game is for you.My rating 6/10.

review: A well made game for all types of players.I play this game casually as an arcade type game and i find it very good it is well made with a good thriving community and cross platform play. A variaty of cars with different stats and hitboxes and all have a unique look.This game can also be taken very seriously with leagues like RLCS weekly and monthly tournaments and Majors frequently it can quench a competitive players thirst for a smiple yet complex competitive game.This game can be played in short or long periods of time and you can pick it up whenever and just play. If your looking for a game to play whilst waiting for a long queue you can or even if you want a simple game you can play and stop at anytime this is your game7/10

review: My friend's been going on about how awesome this game is for a while so I figured I'd buy it.Absolutely great game and the only con I have is one that applies to me and some other people.No. South. African. Servers.Getting to Pro with 200+ ping all the time is painful enough but then playing ranked matches where you occasionally get lag spikes is in a whole other league. TL DR if you're south african don't buy the game until they get servers somewhere out here probably Johannesburg. For others... what have you been doing? Living under a rock? BUY THE GAME! I thought my friend was over exaggerating like he did with CS GO (haters gonna hate) but NOPE this game is 100% AMA ZING.

With several hundred hours in the game I personally have barely learned half the mechanics that can be achieved.The game looks amazing if your computer can handle the graphics.The game sounds amazing if you have any kind of speakers.The community can be toxic at times but is almost always positive.This game is a must buy for those people who want a game to grind over the course of a long time not for those who are looking for a quick and fun game to play with friends. 8.5/10

review: One of the most addicting and best games I have ever played. I don't think I have put as much time into one game as I have with this. At times it tends to be a little too addicting if that's even a thing. Graphics gameplay style and everything is awesome and no two games are exactly alike EVER!Edit This game is ruining my life. I've played this game pretty much every day for the past 3 years. I did the quick math that's about 3 hours a day of my life wasted because I keep playing this game. I'm trapped. The fact that I've played this much and can't even get above champ 3 is me off. It keeps calling me back to play and rage and continue to grind for an in game title that means nothing. If I spent the amount of time that I've played this game and used it towards something useful I would actually be a productive member of society.

review: Product received for free. This is no soccer.This is not a racing game.This is rocket League. A surprisingly addictive game about cars and balls.+ Quick start! get up and running ingame within like 1 minute. A Match will last around 5 minutes on average. + Plenty Customizations!+ Plenty people online!+ Other game modes like Hoops (Basketball). And Snow day (Play with a puck on ice)+ Really addictive! One.More.game!+ Easy to start Very hard to master!+ Workshop items. Not great but they offer variety and chances to practice.++ Almost entirely skill based! Many kids think it's the end of the world when your team fails. ( They kinda know how the chat works too / DLC &amp Lootcrates are relatively pretty expansive! This game is essentially a grind. I wish there was something like an adventure mode etc.+ Game could become Free2Play in the near future. The ingredients are already there it's a wonder it didn't happen yet. (Received for free during the Steam Controller launch period)
title: Rocket League®

review: Just BUY IT! This is the most awesome game I've ever played or seen. You can jump in for 1 or 2 matches or play 5 hours straight. Play in casual mode or test your skill in ranked. Rage with team of randoms or gather your friends and kick some It is still lot of fun.If you really don't know wait for sale but I assure you it's well worth the money. Hell I'd sacrifice my leg and some non vital organs if I had to.
title: Rocket League®
